loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is from Barangay 5, Tangub City. She is 44 years old, married, and has three adult children. 

Sally makes a living by preparing and selling fried chicken to the local community. Sally has been engaged in her business for 5 years and earns 10,000 PHP a month through this work. 

In 2010, Sally joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sally is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed for food preparation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated through use of the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food for sale.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro, tiene 39 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 3 hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio de Gracias, Lempira.  Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura.  Lleva 10 años de dedicarse al cultivo de café, el cual vende  en grano en el mercado local y es su fuente de ingresos. Ha decidido solicitar otro préstamo en la institución, el cual es el quinto ciclo y es por 13,000 Lempiras que utilizará para comprar abonos y fertilizar su finca de café. Su propósito es mejorar la cosecha y los ingresos económicos de la familia.

loans.use: Compra de abonos para fertilizar su finca de café.

loans.name: Mawunyo Ekpé

texts.en:
Mr Mawunyo Ekpé B. is a man 43 years old. He is married and father of two (02) children. Jeweller by trade, he is not succeeding to exercise his career due to the lack of means for the very expensive raw materials for the Jewell fabrication. Then, he decided to make a training in aviculture as there were true demand of eggs and consuming chicken on the market of his locality. Being back from his training, he started the chickens breeding with his own limited means at $ 75. He has benefited from three consecutive credits of $ 200; $ 300 and $ 550 which he had well managed and regularly repaid. But still today, his offer is not always at the level of his demand. With his experiences, Mr B. desires highly to expand his activity in order to be able to increase his incomes and improve his family living conditions. To that purpose, he is requesting a credit of $ 850 to enlarge his henhouse and to have at his disposal the fund for the acquisition of provisions.

Monsieur B. Ekpé Mawunyo est un homme âgé de 43 ans. Il s’est marié et est père de deux (02) enfants. Bijoutier de formation, il n’arrive pas a exercer son métier à cause du manque de moyens pour s’installer, les matières premières pour la fabrication des bijoux étant très rares et très chères. Il décida alors de faire une formation en aviculture car il y avait une demande réelle d’œuf et de poulet de chair sur le marché de sa localité. De retour de sa formation, il commença l’élevage des poules avec des moyens ses propres moyens limités à $ 75. Il avait bénéficié de trois crédits successifs de $ 200, $ 300 et $ 550 qu’il avait bien gérés et régulièrement remboursés. Mais à ce jour, l’offre n’est toujours pas à la hauteur de la demande. Avec ses expériences, Monsieur B. désire vivement étendre son activité afin de pouvoir augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Pour ce faire, il sollicite un crédit de $ 850 pour élargir son poulailler et disposer de fonds pour acquisition les provendes.

loans.use: Henhouse building and provendry purchase

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase wheat and green bananas inventory and upgrade her grocery business

loans.name: Shukufa

texts.en:
Shukufa G. lives in the Beylagan region. She is 50 years old. Her husband died a few years ago, and she has two children.

She is engaged in sheep-breeding.

In 2007, she applied to Normicro's Beylagan branch for a loan in the amount of $400. She used this loan to buying 10 sheep.

She wants to purchase more animals.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea S. is 56 years old and lives in Siem Reap Province with her husband and their 3 children.  Mrs. Chea is a housewife, and her husband is a carpenter who earns about $5/day.  One of her children works in construction and can earn about $4/day.  Mrs. Chea S. is worried because her family spends a lot of money on transportation every day, taking taxis to and from work and school.  She will use this loan to buy the family a used motorbike so they can transport themselves.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her family's transportation

loans.name: Olga Isabel

texts.es:
Olga Isabel works selling catalog shoes to her neighbors and friends. For three years she has had this business and has been able to contribute to the monthly costs of her family. She is 40 years old with 2 children. Her husband works making metal doors and windows. With the loan, she would like to buy more shoes to have stock in her house. She is part of a group called Genesis 2, together with Ana Lidia Diaz Alfonso, who works as a seamstress for women in the community. For her part of the loan, Ana Lidia will buy thread and fabrics to make garments to sell in her community.

OLGA ISABEL, se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catalogo entre sus vecinos y amigos, desde hace tres años que se mantiene con ese negocio y de esta forma contribuye al gasto familiar, tiene 40 años, 2 hijos y su esposo trabaja haciendo puertas y ventanas de metal .Ella espera con el préstamo invertir comprando más zapatos para tener un stock en su casa .Pertenece al grupo Génesis 2 junto con doña Ana Lidia Díaz Alfonso que trabaja como costurera entre las mujeres de su comunidad y con su parte del préstamo comprará hilos , telas para hacer prendas y vender entre las personas de su comunidad .

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Sales of footwear

loans.name: Celia Zenaida

texts.es:
Celia is 64 years old and since she was very young she has gotten ahead through a lot of effort and sacrifice. She worked on several jobs so she could offer well-being and education to each of her children.

In spite of having to take the roles of father and mother, she did not let the circumstances, fear, or insecurity, defeat her. On the contrary, she built an armor in her heart and her body to fight and not allow herself to be defeated.

With her young girl in arms, she went out every day with meat and cheeses, which she obtained in small production centers, to sell them in the markets of the city. Everything that she gave to her little ones have good results and now she is very satisfied when she watches them working in different activities in their community.

For different reasons her children had to go away and now she has been left alone at home, and she keeps working with the same dedication to satisfy her needs and to not feel alone. She now works selling cosmetics and this gives her great satisfaction and helps her not feel lonely because she has found company in each one of her clients.

Thanks to the vitality and strength that characterize her, she still has several dreams she would like to see come true. The first of these is to renovate the small sales stand she has in a very busy market, to which she would like to add new merchandise.

You can make the wishes of this dedicated woman come true.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

Celia tiene 64 años y desde muy joven ha sabido a costa de mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio salir adelante; trabajó en múltiples labores con el fin de proporcionarles bienestar y educación a cada uno de sus hijos.

A pesar de tener que asumir roles de padre y madre no dejó que las circunstancias, el temor y la inseguridad la vencieran por el contrario construyó un armadura en su corazón y en su cuerpo para luchar y no dejarse vencer.

Con su pequeña niña en brazos diariamente salía a vender carne y quesos que adquiría a pequeños centros de fabricación para comercializarlos en los mercados de diversas ciudades.Todo cuanto sembró en sus pequeños han rendido frutos muy buenos y ahora muy satisfecha los observa desempeñándose en diversas labores dentro de su comunidad.

A razón de este hecho y por diferentes circunstancias tuvieron que alejarse y ahora se ha quedado sola en casa y sigue trabajando con las mismas fuerzas para satisfacer sus necesidades y no sentirse sola, la venta de cosméticos rubro al que ahora se dedica la llena de mucha satisfacción y le ayuda a no sentirse sola porque ha encontrado en cada una de sus clientas compañía.

Y debido a la vitalidad y fuerza que la caracteriza aún desea cumplir varios sueños y el primero de muchos es ambientar el pequeño puesto de ventas que adquirió en un mercado muy concurrido al que desea adicionarle artículos de mercería.

Tú puedes hacer que esta diligente mujer pueda cumplir su anhelado sueño

loans.use: Renovating and creating a small sales locale.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
For 27 years, Mr. Juan has worked selling tacos in his taco stand, since he was 26 years old. He started with the desire of forming a family and being able to give his children a better future than he had since he only completed elementary school and with such schooling the quality of potential jobs decreases. During these 27 years, he has gone through all kinds of things, good and bad times in which he almost closed his business and others in which he has even thought about expanding starting other locations.

However, the times they are going through right now have not been very good, and this is why he is requesting a loan for US$925, which he is willing to pay back in a period of 6 months. With this money, Juan will renovate his taco stand because the one he has is very old and needs to be renovated given that competing businesses have started around him with new, attention grabbing carts. With your help, Juan will be able to move his business forward, which is his passion in life.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Desde hace 27 años el señor Juan se ha dedicado a vender tacos en su taquería desde los 26 años comenzó con la ilusión de formar una familia y poder darle a sus hijos un futuro mejor que el que él tuvo. Puesto que estudió hasta la primaria y con ese estudio la calidad de trabajos va bajando. Sin embargo en estos 27 años han pasado todo tipo de cosas buenas y malas temporadas en que casi se cierra el negocio y otras en que dan ganas hasta de hacer sucursales. Pero a pesar de todo este negocio ha mantenido toda su familia y ah dado educación a sus hijos, los cuales ya son mayores.

Sin embargo la temporada que están pasando actualmente no a sido muy buena por eso está solicitando un crédito de $925 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Juan va a renovar su puesto de tacos ya que el que tiene ya es muy antiguo y necesita renovarse, puesto que los que la competencia está llegando a su alrededor con carritos nuevos y muy llamativos. Con tu ayuda Juan podrá sacar adelante su negocio que es su pasión por vivir.

loans.use: Remodeling his taco cart (Remodelar el carrito de tacos)

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana is 25 years old and is a single mother of three children, 2 boys (ages 1 and 3) and one girl (6 years old). Ana has two fruits & vegetables stands at the local San Lorenzo market, she's had them for over 10 years.

Ana began to work with her mom since she was very young at the same stand where she works now. She comes from a very humble family but thanks to their efforts they were able to complete construction of their home.

In the future they hope to purchase more fruits & vegetable stands in order to have larger sales in the area. She requests the credit in order to purchase wholesale items such as apples, bananas, pineapples, grapes, tomatoes, onions, lettuce, carrots, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Ana tiene 25 años y es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos, dos varones de 1 y 3 años y una nena de 6. La Sra. Ana tiene dos puestos en el mercado de San Lorenzo hace ya más de 10 años, en donde vende verduras y frutas.

Ana empezó a trabajar desde muy joven con su mama, quien era dueña del puesto hasta que un día le dejo a su cargo el negocio. Provienen de una familia humilde, gracias al esfuerzo de ambas pudieron terminar de construir su vivienda.

En el futuro tiene pensado comprar mas puestos para una mayor venta de sus productos. Hoy día solicita el crédito con el que podrá adquirir mercaderías en grandes cantidades como manzanas, bananas, piñas, uvas, tomates, cebollas, lechugas, zanahorias, etc.

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly L., 58, works making beef soup and selling a variety of grocery products to the people in her area, making an average of around $ 5 each day of profit. She started this business in 2000, the time her husband started a running a butchery shop in his area making on average about $3.30 of profit per day.

One of her children works at a garment factory, another one is employed at Thailand as a laborer, and the rest are students.

Mrs. Ly L. hopes to use this loan to purchase more grocery products to expand her growing business and use the leftover money to buy large quantities of cashew nuts from the growers for resale.

loans.use: To purchse more grocery products to expand her growing business and buy large quantities of cashew nuts from the growers.

loans.name: Cadith

texts.es:
Mrs. Cadith E. L. is a partner of the communal bank “Honesty and Work”. She lives in the region of San Martin, in the province of Mariscal Caceres and the district of Juanjui. The business is located in her own home, where she sells groceries, soft drinks, and candy. In the same space she has installed 6 computer booths and she also provides telephone service.

With the support of her husband and young children, as well as through her perseverance, Cadith has managed to make the business grow considerably. When it started they had almost empty shelves, but now they offer a variety of products.

With a loan of S/.2,500 (approximately $850 US), which she will repay in 6 months, Cadith will buy groceries like rice, sacks of sugar, oil, cases of milk, soft drinks, candy, and other items in order to supply the business and cover her clients’ needs. Part of the loan will also be invested in cleaning and maintaining the computers.

Mrs. Cadith is 38 years old. She lives with her husband and three children, who motivate her to make an effort each day to reach her objectives. She is an enterprising woman who wants to remodel her house so that she can expand her business to provide better service to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Breanna Wong, Kaleigh Ruffner, and Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteers.

La señora Cadith E. L. es socia del banco comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. El negocio se ubica en su propia casa donde vende abarrotes, bebidas gaseosas y golosinas. En el mismo ambiente tiene instalado cabinas de Internet, con 6 computadora y también presta servicio de llamadas telefónicas. Con el apoyo de su esposo, el de sus pequeños hijos y su perseverancia ha logrado que el negocio se incremente considerablemente, ya que cuando se inició sólo tenia un andamio casi vació, ahora oferta variedad productos. Con el préstamo de S/.2,500, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará abarrotes como arroz y azúcar en sacos, aceite y leche en cajas, gaseosas, golosinas, entre otros, para surtir el negocio y cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes. Parte del capital lo invertirá en la limpieza y mantenimiento de las computadoras. La señora Cadith tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos, quienes la impulsan a esforzarse cada día más y alcanzar sus objetivos. Es una mujer emprendedora que desea refaccionar su casa y así poder ampliar el negocio para una mejor atención a sus clientes.

loans.use: To purchase groceries (rice, sugar, oil, milk, etc.)

loans.name: Sonia Maria

texts.es:
I have everything ready to install security bars on my brick fence. I need to protect my family since my husband works all day, and we have a 4-year-old daughter. We do not allow her to play in the street because of the dangers that exist, so we chose to construct a small protective wall and install security bars. I am requesting a loan of $400.00 USD in order to put security bars on an existing protective wall in front of my home.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo ya la preparación para poner las rejas en mi vivienda necesito que mi familia este protegida ya que mi esposo trabaja todo el día y tenemos una niña de 4 años, no la podemos dejar que juegue en la calle debido a los peligros que hay así es que preferimos poner una barda pequeña y las rejas”. Solicito $ 400.00 dlls para poner rejas en la barda que ya tenemos construida en mi vivienda.

loans.use: Installation of security bars on a protective wall in front of my house

loans.name: Sum

texts.en: Sum P. is 32 years old and lives in Kampong Cham province. Since 1990 she has been a fish seller, meaning she has worked the markets in Kampong Cham since she was 14 years old. She has become quite good at her job managing a daily income of US$10. Pon Sokthy, her husband, is a motor taxi driver earning US$3.50 per day. Being a motor taxi driver in Cambodia is only a step above unemployment in most cases. It is inconsistent work and requires long hours under hot sun. Drivers who are fortunate manage to find work in larger cities and develop a regular client base. Pon Sokthy does relatively well in the capital city of Kampong Cham province. Together they provide for their three children. All of the kids are fully enrolled in school, another impressive achievement for your average poor Khmer family. Sum P. wants to help her husband develop a more consistent source of income by purchasing some farm land by their home on which they can grow rice and raise pigs. Their loan would go towards the start up costs for this venture.

loans.use: To buy farm land and pig feed.

loans.name: Lucero Marisol

texts.es:
Lucero started her business because of necessity. Her husband’s wages weren’t enough to get ahead so she began to work—out of her house so she could watch over her children. She decided four years ago to sell food to the employees of a nearby company and to students of a nearby school. Little by little her business grew.

Lucero now needs a US $250 loan, to be paid back in four months. She will invest in inputs for her food production and buy two new gas burners. With your support she can do it!

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva volunteer.

Lucero inició el negocio por necesidad economica dado que el sueldo de su esposo no le alcanzaba para salir adelante y se puse a trabajar por su cuenta en casa, para no descuidar a sus 2 hijos. ella decidio emprender su negocio de venta de comidas Comenzó hace 4 años vendiendo comidas a trabajadores de una empresa aledaña y a una escuela, poco a poco fue incrementando. Ella necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 4 meses para surtir materia prima y comprar 2 quemadores para su negocio. con tu ayuda podra lograrlo!!.

loans.use: To buy food inputs and two new gas burners

loans.name: Samrith

texts.en:
Mrs. Samrith Sophet, 28, lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia, home to the country’s famous Angkor Wat Temples. To earn a living, she has been selling desserts since 2002 and earns approximately $2/day. Her husband, Kat Khoeun, is a motor-taxi driver and also earns around $2/day. The couple has two children.

Mrs. Samrith is now seeking a loan of $700 in order to help her husband replace his old motorbike with a newer, more fuel-efficient one. She believes that a better motorbike will help cut costs and better his business.

loans.use: To replace an old motorbike

loans.name: Comité Santa Teresa Group

texts.es:
The group consists of sixteen working female members in the Sagrado Corazon D. Jesus neighbourhood of the city of Caacupe. Most of the women are engaged in the making and selling of potato chips as street vendors. The group is in the eighth round of funding by the Mujeres Emprendedoras (“Women Entrepreneurs”) programme and is one of the very few groups that has the unusual characteristic of purchasing ingredients for their business in bulk, thus obtaining a lower price from their suppliers for their purchases. Each member has been granted a line of credit of approximately $250.

The group was established in the home of one of the members and meets regularly in the early hours of the morning before work begins. A strong sense of comraderie has developed amongst the group members as a result of their collective activities such as organising raffles and preparing food for fairs to assist two of the members who had become ill and unable to work.

Group members appreciate the opportunity offered to them by Fundación Paraguaya in the form of a line of credit that provides them with working capital and enables them to negotiate a lower price from their suppliers, thus increasing their profit margin.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

El comité está integrado por 16 señoras trabajadoras del barrio Sagrado Corazón D. Jesús D. la ciudad D. Caacupé, la gran mayoria D. las señoras se dedican a la elaboración y venta D. chipas en forma ambulante, ellas están actualmente en el 8to ciclo del programa comité D. Mujeres Emprendedoras, y tiene una caracteristica muy peculiar que es uno D. los pocos comités que en el momento D. realizar las compras para su negocio, lo hacen todas juntas, con el objetivo D. obtener un menor precio debido a que compran en cantidad y asi obtienen precio D. mayorista. Cada una D. las señoras estan manejando una linea D. crédito promedio D. gs. 1.000.000 (~$250).

El comité se inició con las primeras reuniones en la casa D. la señora Sandra F., y la misma se realizaba a primeras horas D. la mañana ya que todas debian empezar con sus actividades laborales a primera horas D. la mañana, no obstante siempre son muy puntuales. La señora Concepción Castro, manifiesta que éste grupo D. mujeres tiene un alto sentido D. solidaridad ya que en algunos casos tuvieron que realizar actividades, como ferias D. comidas , rifas, para obtener recursos y asi ayudar a dos integrantes del comités quienes tenian problemas en su salud.

Las señoras agradecen a Fundación Paraguaya por otorgales esta oportunidad D. acceder a una línea D. crédito que le permite tener un capital D. trabajo y asi poder mejorar el precio en la compra D. sus materias primas ya que esto inciD. directamente con el precio D. venta D. sus productos.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients such as starch, cheese, vegetable oil, flour, as well as milk, biscuits, drinks in general, etc.

loans.name: Elmidar

texts.en:
Elmidar has been in the taxi business for ten years. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Agdam region in Azerbaijan. He has settled in the town of Khirdalan, where he is married with two children.

Elmidar is requesting a loan of $1200 USD to buy spare car parts that he needs to improve his taxi business.

loans.use: To buy spare car parts to improve his taxi business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase wholesale the chicken, cow and pork meat she retails in her community.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia tiene 32 años de edad, estudió secundaria completa, es casada y madre de 02 hijos gemelos de 09 años de edad. Vive en el distrito de Conduriri, provincia El Collao, Puno y es una de las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Maria Parado de Bellido” en Conduriri. 

Con su crédito inicial de S/.300, compró frutas para ser comercializado en la feria de Conduriri. Desde los 13 años de edad aprendió a vender cueros de alpaca, ovino, los cuales compraban en diferentes comunidades y vendía a los mayoristas. A los 16 años de edad formó su hogar y continua con el negocio, paralelo a ello, los días particulares se dedica a hilar lana de alpaca y vende en la ciudad de Ilave a los mayoristas que viene del país de Bolivia.

Con este crédito de S/.500, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará 02 cientos de naranja a S/.26, 02 cientos de lima a S/.30, 01 ciento de plátanos a S/.20 y con el resto de capital comprará lana de alpaca para hilar.

Su meta es comprar una casa en la ciudad de Ilave y que sus hijos estudien porque no le gustaría que sean comerciantes.
texts.en:
Antonia is 32 years old, finished secondary school, is married and the mother of twin 9-year old boys. She lives in the Conduriri district in the El Collao province of Puno. She is a founding member of the communal bank “Maria Parado de Bellido” in Conduriri.

With her initial loan of 300.00 soles, she bought fruit to sell in the Conduriri market. Since she was eleven years old, she learned to sell leather from alpaca and sheep which she bought in different communities and sold to wholesalers. At 16 years of age, she formed her home and continued the business at the same time. On particular days, she dedicates herself to spinning alpaca wool to sell in the city of Ilave to the wholesalers who come to the country from Bolivia.

With this credit of 500.00 soles, to be repaid in three installments, she will buy 2 hundred oranges at 0.26 soles, 2 hundred limes at 0.30 soles, 1 hundred bananas at 0.20 soles, and with the rest of the capital will buy alpaca wool to spin.

Her goals include buying a house in the city of Ilave and that her children study because she would not like it if they became merchants.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase oranges, limes, bananas, etc.  Also, to purchase alpaca wool to spin.

loans.name: Trork

texts.en: Mr. Trork K. is a 60-year-old rice farmer in Ta Preas village in TaK. Province, Cambodia.  His wife, Mrs. Tet Mao, is a duck breeder. Their four children are all grown; three are farmers and the fourth works in a garment factory. Because the soil in his rice paddy is infertile soil Mr. Trork K. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and to hire laborers to work in the field.  He expects to thereby increase his harvest and his living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire laborers.

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.fr: Originaire d'Abomey,dame H. Clarisse est née vers 1975 à Porto-Novo.Elle n'a pas été à l'école et très tôt elle a été initiée par sa mère au commerce.En effet ,cette dernière était revendeuse de médicament au marché noir.Ainsi dame HEKOUINON a commencé à vendre de médicament avant de se lancer dans la vente divers articles:fournitures scolaires ,chaussures,pots et bouquets de fleur.Cela fait presque 10 ans qu'elle exerce cette activité et c'est pour la renforcer  à l'approche des fêtes qu'elle sollicite ce 3ème prêt de 100000fcfa pour s'approvisionner en fleur et chaussure.
texts.en:
Mrs. Clarisse H. is originally from Abomey, she was born in 1975 in Porto-Novo. She did not attend school, and very early on her mother introduced her to the business. Indeed, she was a black market medicine reseller. Thus Mrs. H. started selling medicine before selling various articles: school supplies, shoes, flowers, and pots. She has been practicing this activity for the last 10 years and to strengthen her business with the Holidays nearing she is requesting this 3rd loan of 100,000 CFA (USD 200) to stock up on flowers and shoes.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 10 dozens of flower bouquet, 10 dozens pairs of shoes

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
La señora Adriana R. R. tiene 48 años, vive en Buenos Aires, distrito de Víctor Larco Herrera, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio primaria completa, tiene 02 hijos de los cuales 01 depende económicamente de ella.
Adriana se dedica a la venta de leche, al inicio vendía la leche en baldes de casa en casa, con las ganancias obtenidas logro comprarse una carretilla y actualmente tiene su propio triciclo,  negocio que desarrolla en su propia casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Las Palmeras”, lo invirtió en la compra de alimento balanceado para sus vacas.
Con el crédito de 2200 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de alimento balanceado para sus vacas.
Adriana sueña con tener un pequeño establo.
texts.en:
Adriana R. R. is 48 years old. She lives in Buenos Aires, district of Víctor Larco Herrera, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru. She finished primary school. She has 2 children, but only one of them still depends on her. Adriana sells milk. At first, when she started, she sold milk in buckets, door to door. With the money she made, she was able to purchase a wheelbarrow and currently she owns a 3-wheeler to transport the milk. She requested for a first $100 loan from the community bank “Las Palmeras” to purchase balanced food for her cows. She will use this current $700 loan, which will be paid off in 6 months, to purchase more cow food. Adriana’s dream is to one day own a small corral.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase balanced food for her cows.

loans.name: Savridin

texts.en:
Savridin N. is 50 years old. He is married with three children. Savridin is the sole breadwinner for his family and his only income comes from the cultivation and sale of large livestock. He sells his livestock at the local market. Every year, he buys young heifers from the farms in adjacent villages. He raises them with the help of his wife and children and then sells the adult cows and bulls to local butchers.

Today, Savridin is thinking about expanding his business, since the income from his present herd isn't enough to provide for his family. He plans to purchase an additional young cow. To do this, he needs to invest an additional $900 USD in his business. In order to receive this amount, Savridin has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner organization, IMON International.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history. Its history includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and many famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets like Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, Western culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.fr: F. Mohamed est âgé de 42 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il est conducteur de taxi moto depuis 3 ans à Atakpame. A cause de la vétusté du moteur de son appareil, il désire avec ce crédit acquérir une nouvelle moto afin de redonner un élan à son activité. Cette activité lui permettra de gagner plus d’argent pour améliorer les conditions de  vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mohamed F. is 42 years old, married, and the father of two. He has been driving a motorbike taxi for three years in Atakpame. Due to the worn condition of the motor, he would like to use this loan to acquire a new motorbike in order to provide a boost to his business. This work will enable him to earn more money to improve his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Laurice

texts.en:
“Try and try until you succeed” is the favorite quotation of Laurice. She is 28 years old and married to Dennis, a driver. Their marriage is blessed with two children: Christopher, who is 9 and a grade-three student in the public school located in their village; and Clifford, who is 2 years old.

Laurice has managed a village store for almost two years and generates a weekly income of PHP2,000 that she uses as rolling capital. Her business also enables her to help her husband in meeting the needs of their family and to save something for the education of their children. She is now asking for a loan of PHP10,000 to be used to improve her business and to purchase more stocks for her store.

loans.use: Business improvement and purchase more stock

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A., 23, sells drinks (malt, fan milk, fan ice, etc.) and meat pies in a shop by the roadside. She procures the drinks from the wholesale dealers in the regional capital, Cape Coast, and bakes the meat pies herself. In addition to the snacks business, Mary also sells phone credits.

This hard working young woman is single and lives independently. She says she wants to be financially secure before she enters into marriage. Mary lives alone in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana. She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to procure drinks in bulk and produce pies on a large scale.

loans.use: To buy drinks in bulk

loans.name: Dupe

texts.en: Dupe A. is thirty-five years old and married with five children. Dupe sells provisions. She is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Edwige

texts.fr:
T. Edwige est née à Abomey dans le Département du Zou. Edwige est marie à PADONOU Désiré. Edwige a six enfants, tous scolarisés mais seul le benjamin est encore à sa charge. Edwige n'a jamais fréquenté. A son jeune âge, Edwige vendît la glace; ensuite,du charbons de bois. Maintenant, Edwige vend des divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, huile végétale, et les articles de mercerie ainsi que les cartes de recharge téléphonique). Edwige a déjà eu deux crédits avec ALIDé. Ces crédits lui ont permis de développer son activité. Aujourd'hui, Edwige sollicite un troisième crédit pour pouvoir continuer le développement de son activité afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
T. Edwige was born in Abomey in Zou County. Edwige is married to Padonou Désiré and they have 6 children, all enrolled in school. Only the youngest is still in her care. Edwige never went to school; at a young age, she sold ice and later charcoal. Now she sells various items (candy, cookies; tins of milk, sardines, tomatoes; sugar, pasta, detergent, and dish and bath soap, vegetable oil, and sewing notions as well as telephone recharge cards).

Edwige has already had two loans through ALIDé. These loans have permitted her to expand her business. Today, Edwige is requesting a third loan to be able to continue to develop her business and better satisfy the needs of her clientele. The meaning of ALIDé in the local language of Bénin, Fon, is "there is always a pathway for the poorest of the poor". Bénin is a small country in West Africa beside Nigeria. Its per capita average income is US$ 1,500.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 8 bolts of poplin, 2 cartons of sewing thread, 4 cases of soap, and 30 dozen zippers

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena A.’s main business is raising hogs. The business has become a big help in sending her children to school. She is 28 years-old and is married to Eduardo A. Jr.  Elena is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP in order to purchase more feed for her hogs. She will use the extra income she earns from her larger pigs to meet the needs of her family. The couple is working very hard together to increase their income so that they can send their children to college. At the moment, Elena lives in the village of Liwayway Diffun, Quirino with her happy family. She is hoping that her business will expand in the future and their standard of living will increase.

loans.use: To buy feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose E. sells provisions and rice. She is 32 years old and is married with three children. She is requesting the loan of N100,000 to purchase more provisions and rice to sell. Rose says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and rice to sell

loans.name: Nacel

texts.en:
Nacel N. is single and she decided to live separately from her mother because she wanted to achieve her goal to become a businesswoman.

Nacel decided to become a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and she is now applying for her 3rd loan as she has decided to venture into the business of cow raising.

Nacel's ambition to have a cow-raising business was fulfilled by the benefits and services of Paglaum and now she lives happily at her own place because of her successful business.

loans.use: To use for her cow-raising business

loans.name: Busayo

texts.en: Busayo is 30 years old and married with a child who is in school and doing well. Busayo sells drinks. She is requesting for the loan amount to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina A. is currently in the business of selling rice and beans and is requesting a loan to purchase maize flour to sell. Sabina is 49 years old and married with a husband who works as a security guard. She has five children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a hotel and buy a motor bike.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour to sell

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es:
El señor Salvador S. ya ha tenido dos créditos con FVP los cuales ha pagado puntual mente.
El está solicitando un crédito escolar, para poder pagar la inscripción de la escuela y la compra de los uniformes y útiles, ya que en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder realizar está necesidad que se le presento para el estudio de sus hijos.
Don Salvador se dedica a la construcción y reparación de viviendas y su esposa la señora María Guadalupe Salazar trabaja de limpieza en una casa particular.
Estos son los ingresos que generan para su familia y con el cual una parte será para pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Salvador S. has had two loans with FVP, which he has paid back punctually. He is asking for a school loan to be able to pay for school registration, school uniforms, and school supplies. He does not have the necessary money to pay this necessity for his children’s education. Salvador works in home construction and repair. His wife, María Guadalupe Salazar, works as a house cleaner in a private home. These are the incomes generated by his family. He will use part to pay for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for registration, uniforms, and school supplies

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria V. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 51 years old, married and has five adult children. For over seventeen years Gloria has operated her own multicab service for the local community. She earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Gloria joined HSPFI to gain access to their financial services. Gloria is requesting an initial loan of 5000 PHP that will be used to repair her multicab. Any revenues generated from her business will be used to improve her service.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her multicab

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda R. is from the village of Owaon. She is 63 years old. Erlinda is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Erlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used for additional working capital for the business. This will be Erlinda's sixth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital

loans.name: Maria Rita

texts.en: This is Maria Rita R., 43 years old. She lives in Barrio Filipino, Pasay City, with her husband Ronaldo, also 43, and their six children. Maria Rita has a small space near a train station. For more than twenty years already, she has been selling cold drinks and bottled water to busy customers who are mostly day-to-day passengers of the commuter train. She earns P1,800 per day. Maria Rita became a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2006. She is now applying for a loan of P13,000 for the continued operation of her business. In the future, Maria Rita wants to see all her children successfully finish their education. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Carlita

texts.en: Carlita C. is from the village of Mohon. She is 67 years old, is widowed, and has seven adult children. Carlita owns and operates a specialized retail store selling charcoal and coconuts in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,800 PHP a month. In 2004, Carlita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Carlita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 14th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a fifty-four-year-old divorced mother of four children. All of her children are currently in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Kade is a farming as well as a commercial center in the region. Alice has a fish-selling business. She buys the smoked fish from nearby fishing communities. She hawks to sell in her community and also sells at the local market. Alice has been in the fish-selling business for over twenty years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy smoked fish in bulk

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
El microempresario: José Antonio M. P. tiene 45 años de edad, es casado con dos hijos mayores de edad y actualmente se encuentran estudiando en la universidad. El negocio del señor M. es un taller de reparación y venta de repuestos para bicicletas, este negocio tiene aproximadamente unos  25 años de estar prestando servicios a la población Blufileña.

Una de las ventajas del negocio es que en la ciudad hay una cantidad considerable de bicicletas y solamente existen dos talleres que brindan este servicio. El microempresario M. ya fue beneficiado con un préstamo por parte de kiva, el cual ya cancelo y aprovecha para agradecer a los prestamistas que confiaron en el y le hicieron el préstamo al igual que a kiva y también a ADEPHCA.

Al igual que otros negocios, tanto la venta de repuestos como las reparaciones de bicicletas aumentan ya que muchos jóvenes y adolescentes reciben de regalo una bicicleta para estos días de navidad y requieren este servicio. Esta solicitando se le financie para comprar los siguientes repuestos: 30 unidades de Tubos de bicicleta Nº 26 y 30 unidades de Tubos de bicicleta Nº 24, los compra a US 2 dólares cada unidad, 60 unidades de llantas de bicicleta Nº 26 y 50 unidades de llantas de bicicleta Nº  24 compra cada unidad a US 3 dólares, 40 unidades de Rin para bicicleta Nº 26 y  30 unidades de Rin para bicicleta Nº 24, los compra a US5 dólares cada unidad.
texts.en:
José Antonio M. P. is 45 years old, married, and the father of two adult children of whom one is a university student. He operates a bicycle repair shop and also sells bicycle parts. His business has been serving the population of Bluefields for approximately 25 years. One of the advantages of his business is that it is only one of two shops in the area to provide repair services to the numerous bicycles that exist within the city. José was the beneficiary of a previous Kiva loan, which has since been repaid. He wants to take this opportunity to thank the Kiva lenders and ADEPHCA for providing that loan. Like other businesses, he sees more activity during the Christmas season. Many young people and teenagers receive bicycles as Christmas presents, so the demand for spare parts and repair services is much higher during this time of the year. José will use this loan to purchase the following parts: • 30 units of bicycle tube #26 @ $2 USD/unit • 30 units of bicycle tube #24 @ $2 USD/unit • 60 units of #26 bicycle wheels @ $3 USD/unit • 50 units of #24 bicycle wheels @ $3 USD/unit • 40 units of #26 bicycle rims @ $5 USD/unit • 30 units of #24 bicycle rims @ $5 USD/unit

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bicycle parts

loans.name: Sonia Briggit

texts.en:
Sonia Briggit R. Guilluen has had a businesses of selling gifts, crystal glasses, and teddy bears.  She is hoping to expand her business with this loan and to be able to invest in new products that she will sell.  She wants to buy laundry detergent, rice, beans and oil to sell.

Sonia is forty-two years old.  She is a single mother with four children.  Her three oldest kids live outside of the house, but her youngest daughter still lives with her and is currently in school.  She hopes that this loan will be able to increase her sales, so that she can start some construction projects on her house and to so that her daughter can remain in school, and use her education in obtaining a future job.

loans.use: for store inventory

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: Cristina es una mujer emprendedora, tiene 38 años y junto a ella vive con su esposo e hijos: Jerry de 06 años,y Valeria de 15 años, este ultima es independiente. Todos ellos viven en su casa propia. Es así que se dedica a la venta de comida rápida, como es el caso de la salchipapas (papas y salchichas fritas),  siendo este platillo muy  popular y bien degustado por todos sus clientes.  Además de la buena sazón que tiene Cristina, le ha ayudado a obtener más clientela, en consecuencia le ha sido muy rentable su negocio. De esa manera empieza su trabajo a las 7pm hasta las 10pm de la noche, y valiéndose de un pequeño local en el exterior de su casa, en donde saca una mesa y ofrece este peculiar platillo. Cristina espera mas adelante tener un gran restaurante para dar rienda suelta todas sus dotes culinarias que aprendió desde pequeña con su madre. Este es su 18 avo préstamo con MFP y se le considera líder de su grupo ya que siempre  demostró ser muy puntual y responsable. Con el crédito que esta solicitando, comprará mayor cantidad de ingredientes para la preparación de sus platillos y así aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Cristina is a hard-working 38 year old woman. She lives with her husband and two children. Jerry is 6, and Valeria is 15 and independent. They all live together in their own house. She sells fast food like “salchipapas” (fried potatoes and sausages) as this is a very popular dish and well liked by all of her customers. Also, the good seasoning that Cristina gives the food has helped her to get more customers. As a consequence, her business has been very profitable. She starts her work at 7 p.m. and ends at 10 p.m. She uses a small place on the outside of her house where she sets up a table and offers this particular dish. Later on Cristina hopes to have a large restaurant to give free reign to the culinary talents she learned as a little girl from her mother. This is her 18th loan with MFP. She is considered a leader in her group because she has always been very punctual and responsible. She will use the loan she is asking for to buy a larger quantity of ingredients to prepare her dishes and increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more ingredients to prepare food

loans.name: Ana Edelmira

texts.es: Ana Edelmira S. de 42 años de edad, reside en Colón, departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo quien es empleado de una empresa privada, y junto a sus tres hijos menores de edad, los cuales estudian. Ana es una mujer muy comprometida y trabajadora quien se interesa por el bienestar de su familia, es por ello que se esfuerza por brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y darle la ayuda necesaria a su esposo. Ella posee una venta de perfumes para hombres y mujeres, las cuales las comercializa de manera ambulante, haciendo visitas de casa en casa ofreciendo sus productos, así mismo se encarga de elaborar prendas de vestir que comercializa en su propia casa. Ana solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda invertir en su negocio comprando más perfumes y telas, de manera que pueda contar con más productos para vender y materia prima para atender más pedidos de ropa.
texts.en:
Ana Edelmira S., 42, lives in Colón, La Libertad department. She lives with her husband, who works for a private firm, and their 3 young children, all in school. Ana is a very committed and hard-working woman who cares for the well-being of her family--this is why she is working to give a better quality of life to her children as well as helping her husband. She sells mens and womens perfumes as a street vendor, presenting her products from house to house. She also creates garments that she sells from her own home. Ana is requesting a loan that she can invest in her business, purchasing more perfumes and fabrics, so that she will have a larger inventory to sell and more raw materials to fill more clothing orders.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of perfumes and fabrics for her business

loans.name: Sadbarg

texts.ru: Раджабова Садбарг проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст, 45 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Раджабова Садбарг торговлей занимается более 4 лет. Она покупает, перерабатывает и продает национальный вид табака "нос" В переработке табака ей помогает сын. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Sadbarg R. lives in the Khuroson region. She is 45 years old, married, and has four children. She has been working as a trader for more than four years. She buys, processes and sells the national tobacco product, known as "nos". Her son helps her with the processing the tobacco. She is applying for credit in order to increase the turnover of her business.

Translated from Russian by Irina Chakraborty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase business turnover

loans.name: Evans

texts.en: Evans is a 42-year-old married man with four children in school.  He has a hardware shop that he has been running for 10 years.  He is a member of Faulu Kenya and he plans to take his first loan of Kes. 20,000 to educate his children.  He has learned how to keep business records and customer service from Faulu Kenya.  He hopes to expand his business and offer a quality education to his children.  He sees himself owning a prominent workshop in the future.

loans.use: To educate his children

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Working capital for his money exchange business.

loans.name: Lukas

texts.en:
Lukas is a 29-year-old married man with one son. His wife is a businesswoman, while he sells construction materials such as cement, ballast, and sand. He explains that he has been in this business for the past seven years.

Since he became a member of Faulu Kenya, he has been able to expand his business by using the loan he received from the organization. He wants to improve on his sales, so he is requesting a loan in the amount of 44,000 KES ($575). With the loan proceeds, he plans to add to his inventory by purchasing an additional stock of sand, ballast, and cement. In ten years time, he sees himself becoming the main supplier of construction materials in his area.

loans.use: To generate additional sales by purchasing cement, ballast, and sand

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca M. D. D. D. 50 años D. edad, vive junto a su familia, la cual esta conformada por su esposo quien le ayuda en el negocio y junto a sus dos hijos menores D. edad, los cuales estudian por las mañanas y en las tardes le ayudan a su madre con el negocio, residen en el departameto D. La Unión. Francisca posee una venta D. frutas y verduras, la cual esta ubicada en el mercado municipal D. La Unión, lugar el cual posee una gran afluencia D. personas, las cuales llegan a diario a comprar los productos del lugar. Es por esta razón que Francisca desea poder contar con más productos para contar con la capacidad necesaria para atender mayor cantidad D. clientes. Esto es D. mucha ayuda para ella y su familia, ya que es la única fuente D. ingresos que poseen como grupo familiar ya que todos trabajan en el, es por ello que Francisca desea aumentar sus ventas y mejorar su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Francisca M. D. D. is 50 years old and lives with her family, which is comprised of her husband, who helps her in the business, and her 2 children who are underage. Her children study in the mornings and in the afternoons they help their mother with the business, they live in La Unión department. Francisca sells fruits and vegetables in the municipal market of La Unión, a place where she has a great influx of people who buy products on a daily basis. It is for this reason that Francisca wishes to have more products, so that she will be able to take care of her customers. This is of great help to her and her family since it is the only source of income for their family since they all work in the market, this is why Francisca wishes to increase her sales and improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
Ngũ Nguyễn Thị (20203020048) is a 45-year-old woman living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Ngũ is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is  Đông Thái nhóm 09 (9).

Ngũ is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, Ngũ owns & operates a business making & selling food.  The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community.  Ngũ has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5.000.000 VND a month from these activities.

Ngũ joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 5.152.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  Ngũ plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Trương Thị L. (20203020049) is a 52-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her general store.

2.  Trương Thị Huệ (20203020050) is a 24-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her service-based business.

3.  Đinh Thị C. (20203020051) is a 57-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her fishing business.

4.  Trần Thị Hà (20203020050) is a 26-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her service-based business.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Ngũ Nguyễn Thị (20203020048) là 45 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở tH.nh phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Ngũ là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các tH.nh viên.  Mặc dù mỗi tH.nh viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các tH.nh viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên C. thức của nhóm vay này là  Đông Thái nhóm 09 (9).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập C. của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán thức ăn nhanh & những loại thực phẩm cao cấp khác trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Ngũ thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 6 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Ngũ kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND.  Ngũ đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài C. giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  0    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Trương Thị L. (20203020049) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích C. của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa H.ng bách hóa.


2.  Trương Thị Huệ (20203020050) là 24 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích C. của việc kinh doanh là vận H.nh công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


3.  Đinh Thị C. (20203020051) là 57 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích C. của việc kinh doanh là vận H.nh công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


4.  Trần Thị Hà (20203020050) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích C. của việc kinh doanh là vận H.nh công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài C. vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & C. xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy charcoal and corn

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina V., 59, is making sure that she is able to provide for her family’s daily needs. Married to Reymondo V., the couple are blessed with three children. Cristina helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her business of buying and selling frozen meats for quite some time now. She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.

Cristina has been a regular member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends its weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Her good repayment performance with her previous loans has enabled her to borrow ten times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she has used the money she has borrowed to expand and improve her business. To ensure the continued success of her business, Cristina is asking for a loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional frozen meats.

* All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: buying additional meats and frozen products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Tuzamurane Isangano Group

texts.fr:
François H. est âgée de 39 ans, il est marié avec 4enfants, le grand a 13ans et le petit a 2ans.François est président du  groupe appelé Tuzamurane Isangano, ce groupe travail en commun pour l’expansion de leur business diversifié dont tous font le commerce, il travail six jours la semaine ils sont aussi agri-eleveurs car ils vivent dans un milieu rural. François est vendeur des produits alimentaires qui sont sorgho, haricots avec expérience de 5ans.

François et son groupe travail pour augmenter la capacité financière de leur groupe. En fait, le groupe a contracté n prêt au sein d’Amasezerano Community Banking pour acheter les articles pour ravitailler leur business.les bénéfices récoltés après vente de ses produits sont réinvesti pour maintenir la stabilité financière du groupe et épargner afin de préparer pour le bon future la troisieme partie du profit de leur business est epargné au compte du groupe.

Concernant le groupe
Un prêt de groupe signifie que chaque membre prend son montant et l’utiliser pour son propre business, l’avantage est que le groupe garantisse pour les prêts individuels de chaque membre et si un membre ne parvient pas rembourser, tout les membres du groupe remboursent a sa place
texts.en:
François H., 39, is married with four children. The oldest is 13 and the youngest 2 years old. François is the president of the group called Tuzamurane Isangano, which is working together to expand their various businesses. All of them are merchants. They work six days a week and they are also farmers and livestock-raisers since they live in a rural area. François sells foodstuffs such as sorghum and beans and he has five years' experience. François and his group are working to grow their financial capacity. In fact, they have taken out this loan from Amasezerano Community Banking to buy goods to bolster their business inventories. The profit they expect to make after selling this merchandise will be reinvested so as to maintain the financial stability of the group and used to put aside savings so as to be able to afford a better future. One-third of their business profit is put into savings in the group's account. Concerning the group A group loan signifies that each member takes his share and uses it for his own business. The advantage is that the group guarantees the individual loans of each member and if the member is not able to reimburse his loan, all the members of the group will reimburse it in his name.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 5 sacks of sorghum and 2 sacks of beans

loans.name: Bazargul's Group

texts.en:
Bazargul K. is the leader of the group. She is 33 and divorced. She has a daughter and a son. The son is a student and the daughter is still too young for school. Six years ago, with the initial investment of 11000 soms, Bazargul opened a cafeteria, where she sells various kinds of national foods. In this way she makes 20800 soms per month. With money received from the loan, Bazargul wants to purchase food for preparing these national dishes. In the future she plans to expand her business and to purchase a flat in Bishkek.

Sagynbek I., 37, is married. He has a son who is eight years old. Ten years ago, Sagynbek and his wife, with the initial investment of 8000 soms, opened a bakery.  Selling the bread, they make 11000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, Sagynbek wants to purchase eight bags of flour.

Burulkan R. is the treasurer of the group, she is 26. Two years ago, with the initial investment of 15000 soms, Burulkan opened a store where she sells convenience goods and toiletries. In this way she makes 20000 soms per month. With money received from the loans, she wants to purchase various goods to increase the turnover in her shop. In the future she plans to purchase a flat.

Bargigul H., 29, is married. She has two sons and a daughter. Twelve years ago, with the initial investment of 40000 soms, Bargigul and her husband opened a sewing workshop. They make 25000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, Bargigul wants to purchase a sewing machine to expand her business. In the future, she wants to build a big house with a swimming pool.

Begmamat I., 46, is married. She has three sons and two daughters. Ten years ago, with the initial investment of 6000 soms, Begmamat rented a store where he sells convenience goods. In this way, he makes 11700 soms per month. With money received from the loan, he wants to purchase various fruits and vegetables in order to sell them in that store. In the future, Begmamat wants to save some money and to contribute to his son’s wedding. 

100 Kyrgyzstani soms (KGS) = 2.13 USD

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young, ambitious and socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). Mol Bulak is the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the Mol Bulak Finance staff.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda P. is from the village of Angayoso, Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 49 years old. Esmeralda is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Esmeralda owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Esmeralda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Esmeralda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esmeralda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Esmeralda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Esmeralda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Namanve Development Group-Mukono

texts.en:
Casting her mind back, 32-year-old N. Mariam says her business start-up story is no far cry from the status quo where everyone intending to join any business is given a confidential talk by a close friend. What she has given much thought to during the 7 years of operating a beauty salon business is how she can best enforce and make use of blue print measures aimed at improving the future of her business.  

To that effect, Mariam has constantly been planning on how best she can utilize  her finances. Many "make my business better" thoughts cross her mind, day in, day out, as she well knows how some businesses have unraveled as a result of bad decision-making. With the 160,000 shillings she makes in a week, she knows better apportioning of this money in terms of expenditure is vital, even if she only has one child.  Prior to starting her current main business she was inclined to a hotel and restaurant business. With this loan, she wants to buy more cosmetics for her salon.

loans.use: The purchase of more cosmetics for her beauty salon

loans.name: Cheryll

texts.en:
Cheryll B. is from the village of Cabisera II. She is 30 years old. Cheryll is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Cheryll owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Cheryll has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP when she sells her raised animal.

In 2010, Cheryll joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cheryll is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Cheryll from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Angel es un padre de familia de 39 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus cuatro hijos en el Caserío Enmanuel, una zona agrícola perteneciente al distrito de Las Lomas de la provincia de Piura, ubicado en la región del mismo nombre a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde muy joven a trabajar en labores relacionadas con la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de maracuyá, el cuenta con varias plantas que brindan este fruto, el cual es cosaechado dos veces por año. Las frutas que cosecha las ofrece en venta a las plantas procesadoras que preparan el producto para exportarlo a diversos países del extranjero. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno. Con el dinero que le brindan estas actividades el solventa la economia de su familia.

Angel deseabrindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de maracuyá para asegurarse una buena cosecha, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes y pesticidas.

Su mayor anhelo es llegar a ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales. El es una persona responsable y entregada a su familia.
texts.en:
Angel, age 39, lives with his wife and four children. They live in the Enmanuel rural community, which is an agricultural area in the Las Lomas district, Piura province. It is located in the region of the same name, and it is over three hours to the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. He has worked in agriculture since he was very young. He mainly grows passion fruit, and he has various plants that produce this fruit. The fruit is harvested two times a year. He sells the fruit he harvests to processing plants to prepare to export to different foreign countries. He also raises cows. The money from these activities supports the family’s expenses. Angel wishes to provide his passion fruit crops with maintenance to ensure a good harvest. In order to achieve this objective he has seen the need, for the first time, to request a loan for 1,000 soles from the Edpyme Alternativa. He will use the loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides. His greatest desire is to see his children become professionals. He is a responsible person, and he is devoted to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers and pesticides to provide maintenance to his crop of passion fruit

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Remembering the experiences during her youth, Gina T., now 32 years old, has regrets. She got married at the very early age of 16 and never finished high school. Now she has seven children to take care of. She has promised herself that she would work hard and teach good values to her children so that they will not suffer the same fate as she. 

Gina is a very dynamic mother who has always dreamed of a bright future for her children. She joined Ahon sa Hirap, Inc., a partner MFI of KIVA in the Philippines, in 2006. She started selling fish in their community but now after several years her business has improved. She is applying for a loan of Php 20,000 to finance her now enlarged fish trading business. She will buy more fish and supply directly to fish vendors in the market. 

She has already identified buyers and she is planning to market her fish in other towns and provinces. She is hoping that KIVA lenders will support her business plans so that she can generate more profit and be able to pay for her children’s schooling. Her ultimate dream is to send her children up through college and see them earn a degree. 

Note: Please ignore the date on the picture; the setting on the camera is not properly adjusted. That's why the date is still 2007.

loans.use: to buy assorted fish in greater volume to wholesale

loans.name: Ramin

texts.en: Ramin B. is 30 years old, married, and has two children. He started his small convenience store when he was unemployed and needed a way to pay the bills. His biggest dream is to have a general store where he can sell seasonal fruits and vegetables. With the loan, Ramin expects to keep growing his business little by little and keep improving his quality of life and economic situation until he achieves his goal. He has applied for a loan of 1000 AZN.

loans.use: purchase more seasonal fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anne Shibonje

texts.en:
