Anne Shibonje, 60, is married to Kizito Wanjila.  The couple live in the Eregi area in Vihiga, and they have two grown children: Judy Shiosho, 35, and Martin Akunda, 30.

Anne has been running a kerosene business for the past 4 years, and has seen her business grow in that time. She is applying for her third loan from KADET as she is in dire need of a gallon of kerosene to add to her stock. She has a passion for helping needy children in the neighbourhood, and the profits made from this loan will go toward meeting their education expenses.

Her desire is to have a kerosene supply depot. She also wants to help the needy children in society and hopefully one day open a children's home.

loans.use: to buy a gallon of kerosene

loans.name: Yor

texts.en:
Mrs. Yor T., 53 years old, operates a small shop in her house where she has opened a coffee shop, and she also sells fish-paste for an additional fee. She typically makes around US$ 3 in profit each day to support her family needs. She was married but she divorced her husband years ago. She has two children, and both of them have different occupations. 

Mrs. Yor T. is running her business smoothly because she has skills in public relations which she uses with her customers. Presently, she wants to expand her business by buying different kinds of drinks to sell. As she lacks money to make this possible, Mrs. Yor T. has decided to request a loan from Kiva. Mrs. Yor T. will use these funds to buy more soft drinks to sell.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es:
Martha Cecilia I. V. tiene 22 años. Vive en Unión Libre  vive con el compañero y los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. El LA UNION se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Aguas Frías, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Martha se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 14 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y los vende en la feria de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa grande.
Le gusta ir los domingos a caminar con la familia.
texts.en:
Martha Cecilia I. V. is 22 years. She lives in Unión Libra in the district of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos with her partner and their three children.

The members of the V.R.C La Union (the Union Community Bank) are located in the Aguas Frías area, in the district of Ventanas, and they pursue short-cycle agricultural work. They harvest corn, rice, and beans, and they spend a lot of time doing this.

Martha has pursued agriculture, especially growing corn, rice, and beans, for 14 years. She buys her inputs in Ventanas and sells them in the Ventanas market in her area.

She is requesting this loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers for her crops. The support from the loan will help her financially to buy the necessary goods. She faces obstacles like plagues, illnesses, and variation in the climate. Her dream is to buy a large house. She enjoys going on walks with her family on Sundays.

loans.use: Agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Masika

texts.en:
Masika is a married woman with ten children, nine of whom graduated from school, while one is still too young for school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has been operating a coconut selling business from home for over one year. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future. 

With the Kshs 10,000, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy coconuts for resale

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Joaju Group

texts.es:
El comité “Kuña Guapa Joaju” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de Capiibary. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas, Despensa, cría de animales.
  Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo y al adquirir el crédito se le abren muchas puertas Para el progreso de sus emprendimientos.

La Sra. Celestina C. es una de las integrantes del comité, ella posee una despensa y crías de animales. 
Ella realiza varias actividades, es una señora muy creativa en su actividad, y así ella logra ayudar a su familia. 
Es una señora muy trabajadora y siempre trata de dar lo mejor a su familia. 
Se encuentra muy satisfecha con su actividad y las capacitaciones que recibe el grupo. 
La señora  solicita el crédito para la compra de balanceados etc.
texts.en:
The “Cuña Guapa Joaju” committee was formed by a number of neighbors from the city of Capiibary.  All the members of the committee carry out independent business activities such as sales, running a grocery store and raising animals.

The members of this group are very united and capable of jointly carrying out activities that strengthen their team spirit.  The loan they receive will open many doors for them.  It will help them to make progress in their businesses.

Celestina C. is one of the committee's members.  She owns a grocery store and also raises animals.  She carries out several business activities and is a very creative woman.  Through her business activities, she manages to help her family.  Celestina is a very hard-working woman who always tries to provide her family with the best.  She is very happy with her business activities and also with the training that her group receives.  She is requesting this loan to buy balanced animal feed.

loans.use: To buy balanced animal feed

loans.name: Chhay

texts.en: Chhay H., age 40, is a married woman who earns her living by buying rice in bulk at a reasonable cost. She sells her rice to people to earn her income. Usually, Chhay H. generates an income, on average, of $8 per day to ensure that her family has a comfortable standard of living. She has been married for many years to Boeum Chal, 40, a horse cart driver. They have four children: three are single, one is married, and lives separately. Chhay H. is concerned in that she has one son who doesn’t have an occupation yet. To encourage her son, Chhay H. would like to request a loan for her son to buy a horse and cart for running a new career.

loans.use: To buy a horse and cart for running a new career.

loans.name: Carolina Enriqueta

texts.es:
Carolina, tiene 26 años de edad y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Carolina es una joven emprendedora y trabajadora que se dedica a la confección de manualidades y vende sus productos a dueños de tiendas, librerías y colegios. Ella también es profesora en un centro educativo inicial, ella con su bondad y su amabilidad enseña a niños de 3 a 5 años de edad. Carolina requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales a para confeccionar sus productos como por ejemplo papel, colores, tela, lana y muchas cosas más. 

Carolina pertenece al banco comunal “Caminemos Juntas” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal está conformado por personas emprendedoras y trabajadoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Carolina is 26 years old and lives in the city of Cusco, Perú. Carolina is a young, enterprising, and hardworking woman who makes handicrafts and sells her products to the owners of stores, bookstores, and schools. She is also a teacher at a kindergarten. She teaches children who are 3 to 5 years old. Carolina needs the loan to buy more materials for making her crafts, like, for example paper, colors, fabric, wool, and many other things. 

Carolina belongs to the “Caminemos Juntas” communal bank of the UMF Asociación Arariwa in Cusco, Perú. The communal bank is made up of enterprising and hardworking people who are looking for every opportunity to help their children get ahead.

loans.use: To buy materials for making crafts

loans.name: Oti Katty

texts.es:
La señora Oti, es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Del 2000 del distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 23 años de edad, está casada y tiene una niña, su esposo es administrador de empresas.
Lleva trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años.  Se dedica  a la publicidad y estampados de polos, en las campañas electorales subieron sus ingresos por la demanda que hubo de los paneles publicitarios y los polos estampados.
Con este nuevo préstamos de S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles comprará 1 kilo de pintura roja, verde, blanco, amarillo, negro, azul para estampado, 5 bastidores, 5 espátulas, 2 kilos de imprimante, 1 plancha.
Manuela Ramos sabe cómo puede brindar apoyo a sus socias de los bancos comunales, orientandolas para distribuir mejor su dinero y les sirve mucho para poder surgir, mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Oti is a member of the “Mujeres del 2000” (Women of 2000) communal bank in Callería district, Ucayali department.  She is 23 years old, married and has a daughter.  Her husband is a business administrator.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos loans for two years.  She’s in publicity and polo shirt printing.  During the electoral campaigns her income rose due to the demand there was for publicity panels and printed polo shirts.

She will use the new, 1200 new sol, loan to buy 1 kilo each of red, green, white, yellow, black and blue printing ink, 5 frames, 5 spatulas, 2 kilos of fixer and one iron.

Manuela Ramos knows how to provide support for the members of its communal banks teaching them to better distribute their money which is very useful for them to surge forward improving their quality of life.

loans.use: She will buy one kilo each of red, green, white, yellow, black and blue paint for printing, 5 frames, 5 spatulas, 2 kilos of fixer, 1 iron.

loans.name: Pon

texts.en: Pon S. is a professional tailor, making US$ 3 each day in Battambang province. She is married and has three children, and all of them are employed as construction workers. Her husband, Chom Rin, makes approximately US$ 2 every day, growing rice. Pon S. would like a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase a motorbike for her children to use to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es: Maximiliana es una madre de familia de 37 años que vive al lado de su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace más de 4 años decidió junto a su esposo mejorar sus ingresos económicos de manera independiente y tras varios fracasos en sus emprendimientos han sabido levantarse y en la actualidad tiene ingresos estables a través de la agricultura y un negocio de servicio de llantería, de reparación de llantas tanto de carros como bicicletas. Por otro lado Maximiliana administra  los terrenos que arrendó para cultivar maíz, habas y papa, mientras que su esposo atiende la llantería, ambos negocios emergentes le permite sostener su economía  para velar por la seguridad económica de su familia por la cual esta muy satisfecha de ver a su familia unida es por eso que en adelante desea implementar ambas actividades sobre todo la agricultura en arrendar más extensiones de terreno para sembrar en mayores cantidades. Es su octavo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero y promete ser puntual en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será muy útil en el progreso de su actividad. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará sacos de abono, semillas y fertilizantes.
texts.en: Maximiliana is a 37 year-old mother who lives with her husband and their 2 children in her own home.  Four years ago, she and her husband decided to improve their income by starting up a business.  After several business failures, they now finally have a stable income through agriculture and also through a business providing tire services for automobiles and bicycles.  On her part, Maximiliana manages lands that they rent and use to cultivate corn, beans and potatoes, while her husband attends to the tire shop.  Both of these growing businesses provide for the economic security of the family, and she is very pleased to see her family united.  In the future, she wants to invest in both businesses, particularly the agricultural one.  She wants to lease more tracts of land so that she can cultivate larger quantities of crops.  This is her 8th loan with MFP, and she is pleased to know that she has financial support, and promises to be on time with her payments.  In addition, she appreciates being part of her communal bank, because all of the members are responsible and cooperative people.  She thanks those persons who will contribute to the loan that she requests, because it will help her to make progress with her business.  With the loan she requests, she will buy sacks of organic fertilizer, seeds, and chemical fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer, seeds, and chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Kea

texts.en:
Kea H., 32, resides in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Kun is a farmer and raises pigs, earning an income of $3 per day. Her husband sells wood, earning an income of $5 per day. 

Each month, the family has to spend $30 on food and $50 on the other necessary expenses. H. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase cows to resell. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy cows to resell

loans.name: Zarif

texts.en:
I. Zarif is 58 years old. He is married with 3 children of school age. Zarif has been in the business of selling cows for almost 30 years. He buys them from villagers and from the nearby province, then fattens them for reselling to abattoirs and farmers. His wife has been a fruit seller for two years. Zarif is requesting a loan of 10,000 Somoni to purchase additional cows to raise for resale. This loan will allow him to better provide for his family.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 44-year-old widow; she has 3 children to raise. Since she can’t read or write, she took a few courses to learn how to make baskets from straw and how to sew the Jordanian traditionA. head covering for men “Shmagh”, so she would be able to support her family financially.

Mariam started a small business 7 years ago; she makes beautifully hand-woven baskets and handmade head covers and from selling them she has managed to support her family.

Now Mariam has applied for a loan to increase her productivity so she can increase her income each year, until she is able to open a small shop to display her work for sale.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to increase her productivity.

loans.name: Jessica Jenny

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo, encontramos un lugar conocido como los arenales aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Fe y Esperanza, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Jessica, tiene  30 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 11, 8 y de un  año de edad,  los mayores  estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido se dedica a la pesca.

Ella se dedica a la cría de chanchos y  aves de corral, tiene una pequeña granja en su casa, nos cuenta que en temporadas compra de cien a doscientos pollos los cuales los cría durante dos a tres meses que es el tiempo para que ya estén listos para la venta, después de este tiempo los pela y los entrega en algunas tiendas de la localidad, también vende por libras o en pie a comerciante que llegan hasta su casa. Los chanchos en cambio los faenan y luego venden la carne por libras,  lleva 5 años dedicada a esta labor.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar la mayor cantidad de pollos, alimentos y medicinas para sus animalitos. Es su cuarto ciclo en el Banco es la tesorera del grupo y está muy contenta porque  le han ayudado mucho.
 
Su sueño es tener una empresa que surta de estos productos a toda la provincia.
texts.en:
In the district of Crucita in the region of Portoviejo we find a place known as Los Arenales. It is where the members of the communal bank named "Faith and Hope" meet every two weeks. It is known for its beautiful beaches, its food, and the welcoming population. 

Here we meet Jessica. She is 30 years old and she is married common-law. She has three children, aged 11, 8, and 1. The older children are in school. Her husband is a fisherman.

She raises pigs and poultry. She has a small farm on her property and she says during certain seasons she purchases from one hundred to two hundred chickens. She raises them during two or three months which is the time needed to for them to be ready for sale. She processes them and sells them to stores in the vicinity. She also sells by taking orders or to merchants who come to her house. The pigs are slaughtered and sold as meat by the pound. She has 5 years in the business.

This new loan will be used to purchase a larger number of poultry, feed, and medicines. This is her fourth loan cycle with the communal bank. She is the treasurer of the group and she is very happy because it has helped her so much. 

Her dream is to have a farm that will supply these products to the entire province.

loans.use: to purchase poultry, feed, and medicines for the livestock.

loans.name: Francheso Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Franchesco Alberto es una joven trabajador y muy dedicado a su negocio propio, se dedica a la venta de ropa usada clasificada, actividad que viene realizando desde poco tiempo, Franchesco vende sus prendas de vestir en muchas comunidades cercanas todas las semanas, muchos clientes los prefieren ya que la ropa es de buena calidad y los precios son baratos.
Franchesco se levanta todos los dias a las 6 de la mañana para salir a vender su mercaderia.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa usada, desea tener mas inventario de ropa ya que las ventas han subido y desea cubrir con todas las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Franchesco Alberto is a hard-working young man who is very committed to his business selling used clothes.  He has been in this business for a short time.  Franchesco sells his clothes lots of nearby communities every week.  Many customers prefer to buy from him because he offers good-quality clothes and his prices are low.

Franchesco gets up every day at 6.00am to go out and sell his merchandise.

Franchesco will use his loan to buy used clothes.  He would like to have a greater inventory of clothes since his sales have risen and he would like to cover all his customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy used clothes

loans.name: Trabajando Para El Futuro Group

texts.es: La Sra. Mirian  es divorciada, tiene 3 hijos, actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Trabajando para el futuro” grupo  conformado por 8 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades D. comercio. Mirian  trabaja desD. hace 15 años en la venta D. prendas D. vestir y a su vez también venD. productos D. belleza Avon y Esika este trabajo surge  raíz D. su divorcio y sus deseos D. salir adelante  ya que se volvió padre y madre para sus hijos y la forma D. sacar adelante a sus hijos era trabajar muy duro , gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación sus hijos cuentan con educación  ha logrado mejores ingresos que le ha permitido construir su casa, y brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida, con el fin D. seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar prendas D. vestir ( Medias, pantalon, blusas, polo) y seguir vendiendo  . Sabemos que Mirian  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos D. Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Mirian is divorced with three children.  She is currently a member of the "Trabajando Para el Futuro" [Working for the Future] village bank.  There are eight members in the group, who work in a variety of businesses.  For fifteen years Mirian has been selling clothing as well as Avon and Esika beauty products.  She started out because she got divorced and she wanted to get ahead; she had become both mother and father to her children and the way to success was to work very hard.  

Thanks to her effort and dedication, her children have an education and she managed to make more income which has allowed her to build her house and give her family a better quality of life.  So she can continue growing, she's seeking a new loan to buy more clothing (stockings, pants, blouses, and polo shirts) to keep on selling.  We know that Mirian will achieve her goals with lots of work and effort and that the loans from Edaprospo will help.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Marifel

texts.en:
Marifel is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Marifel has a shop that sells canned goods, noodles and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy canned goods, breads and snacks to sell.

Marifel has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Marifel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, breads and snacks for resale.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María D. 52 años, es una mujer laboriosa, resiD. en L. ciudad D. Tarma junto a Víctor, su esposo. Ambos tiene 4 hijos pero sólo viven con el menor D. todos en una casa alquilada, también tiene una vivienda propia pero por su negocio arrienda el establecimiento para sus costuras. Mujer ejemplar y buena madre D. familia, así definimos a esta mujer que desD. hace 10 años, viene dedicándose a L. costura D. prendas D. vestir. Tiene muchos clientes, por L. creatividad y diseño que ejerce al remendar pantalones, blusas y demás prendas. Además D. aprovechar está actividad y generar mayores ingresos económicos; venD. dulces, galletas, caramelos, bebidas gasificas y algunos productos D. primera necesidad, con L. ayuda D. su madre, mientras su pareja trabaja como pintor D. fachadas D. pared y en cualquier labor eventual que se le presente, también le ayuda a elL., en L. costura, ya que juntos tratan D. salir adelante. Lo que más le gusta es diseñar y coser, por otro lado le incomoda lavar y planchar las prendas pues tiene que ser muy cuidadosa para que sus clientes regresen, estos  son muy rentables porque les permite tener una vida cómoda y sin preocupaciones, aparte D. tener una ventaja en L. ubicación D. su negocio ya que es una zona comercial. Su meta ahora, es incrementar su tienda con productos comestibles, para generar más utilidades. ElL. pertenece al banco comunal “Taruma” y este es el undécimo crédito con MFP, donD. espera D. un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. María, D. recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero que solicita, en L. compra D. productos D. primera necesidad. para surtir mejor L. mercadería D. su tienda.
texts.en:
María, age 52, is an industrious woman who resides in the city of Tarma with her husband Víctor. They have four children, but only the youngest child lives with them in a rented home. María and her husband also own a house, but it is being used for her sewing business. She is an exemplary woman and a good mother to her family. For the past 10 years, María has been making clothes. She has many customers who appreciate her creativity and designs. María also makes alterations to trousers, blouses, and other articles of clothing. She takes advantage of her customer base to generate more income by selling candy, cookies, caramels, sodas, and a few other basic necessities with the help of her mother. Meanwhile, her husband works as a house painter and takes on any job that is presented to him. He also helps her with the sewing and they work together in order to get ahead. What she enjoys most is designing and sewing. However, she feels uncomfortable washing and ironing clothes. She knows that she has to be very careful so that her customers will continue to do business. Her businesses have been very profitable and allowed her to live a comfortable life without worries. She also has the advantage of her business being situated in a commercial area. Her current goal is to expand her food store so that she can generate more profit.

María is a member of the Communal Bank “Taruma” and is receiving her 11th loan with MFP. She hopes that this small loan will enable her to achieve her goals. Once again, she promises to complete her payments just as she did with her previous loans. In addition, she is grateful to be part of her Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people. With the money she requested, María will invest in the purchase of basic necessities so that she will have more inventory in her store.

loans.use: to purchase basic necessities for her store.

loans.name: Sek

texts.en: From Siem Reap Province, Mrs. Sek is a 30-year-old fish vendor and the mother of three children. Every day, early in the morning, she buys fish from the fishermen and then she hurries to bring her fish by motorbike to the market for resale. She is single as she has been divorced from her husband since her kids were young. Mrs. Sek is handling her investment smoothly. She has a lot of regular customers who buy and eat her fish. She hopes to be able to earn extra income by using a Kiva loan to purchase more fish. With some percentage of the funds, she wants to buy a used motorbike to replace the broken one she uses to pick up her fish every day.

loans.use: to buy a used motorbike and to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is 30 years old and lives in the town of Masidi, in the Gulu region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children. One of her child is currently in school. Annet has a business of a small retail shop that sells spare parts, which she has had for over 10 years. She sells herbal medicine as her second business.  

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase spare parts for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Annet hopes to generate greater profits and to buy food for her family. In the future, Annet hopes to expand her business. Annet is a member of BRAC’s Small Enterprise (SEP) Program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.es:
Marieta tiene 49 años D. edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio D. agua y luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito D. TambogranD., que pertenece al departamento D. Piura.  Esta zona la actividad que desarrollan es la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Marieta desD. hace varios años se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos por catálogo, sus productos los ofrece en su domicilio, pero también va D. casa en casa, cuenta con su clientela que le realiza pedido y ella les da facilidades D. pago, con los ingresos que adquiera podrá solventar sus necesidades diarias D. su hogar.  También cuenta con tierras D. cultivo donD. siembra limón y una vez que cosecha lo comercializa en el mercado y obtiene otro ingreso para su familia.

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es D. 2000 nuevos soles para la compra D. mercadería para seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes y D. fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras, al aumentar su efectivo podrá pagar su préstamo y tener una mejor calidad D. vida.  Marieta es una mujer D. trabajo y dedicada con la finalidad D. darles mejores opciones D. estudios a sus hijos en un futuro.
texts.en:
Marieta, 49, lives with her husband and children in a house that she owns. The house has basic services: water and electricity. Marieta lives in TambogranD., a district in Peru's "departamento" of Piura. Local people make their living from farming, raising livestock and making and selling traditional crafts.
 
Marieta has operated a cosmetics sales business for many years.  She orders merchandise from catalogs and sells what she buys at home or door-to-door.  Her customers place their orders with her and she makes it easy for them to pay.  The income from the business pays for the everyday things she needs for her family.  She also owns land where she grows lemons.  She harvests the lemons, sells them and uses the income to support her family.
 
Marieta is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new soles loan, partly to stock her cosmetics sales business and partly to buy fertilizer for her farming business.  She expects the investment to increase her earnings so that she can both repay the loan and proviD. her family with a better quality of life.  Marieta is committed to growing her business and helping her children get the best possible education.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her cosmetics sales business and fertilizer for her farming business.

loans.name: Karen

texts.ru:
Карену 42 года и он проживает в селе Акнахбюр (Aknaghbyur), Тавушского региона. 
Жена Карена работает учительницей химии в средней школе, дочери учатся в Ереванском Педагогическом Институте на платном отделении, а сын учится в средней школе. Сам Карен работает в сельской администрации.  
Одновременно со своей постоянной работой, Карен занимается сельским хозяйством: разводит коров, выращивает овощи и фрукты, виноград, а на поле выращивает корм для своих двух коров и двоих телят. Часть полученной продукции Карен оставляет для своей семьи, а остальное продает своим односельчанам и скупщикам из соседних деревень и городов.   
Карену необходим кредит на сумму 1.000.000 драм для сооружения теплицы, в которой он намеревается выращивать помидоры, огурцы и другие овощи для продажи, что увеличит доход семьи Карена и позволит ему платить за обучение дочерей в институте.
texts.en: Karen is 42 years old.  He lives in the Aknaghbyur village in the Tavush region.  Karen's wife works as a chemistry teacher at a secondary school, daughters attend a paid division of the Yerevan Pedagogy Institute, and son attends a secondary school.  Karen works in the village administration.  Concurrently with his permanent job, Karen is involved in agriculture.  He breeds cattle, grows vegetables and fruits, grapes, and grows animal feed in the field for his two cows and two calves.  Karen leaves a portion of grown agricultural products for his family and sells the rest to his neighbors and buyers from neighboring villages and towns.  Karen needs a loan in the sum of 1,000,000 dram in order to build a greenhouse, where he plans to grow tomatoes, cucumbers and other vegetables for sale, which will increase Karen's family income and allow him to pay for his daughters' education in the institute.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Juana Toribia

texts.es:
La señora Juana Toribia es casada, tiene 43 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 3 hijos los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la sastrería,  a la confección de telas, camisa y pantalones, lleva ya 3 años de experiencia en este trabajo.

Decide solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para ampliar su capital de trabajo para la compra de telas de diferentes clases y colores, trabaja en la confección de pantalones, camisa, y entre otros trabajo que se le solicita a ella. Espera mejorar su trabajo con la ampliación de capital que está haciendo.
texts.en:
Juana Toribia is 43, and married. She didn't have the opportunity to go to school.  She has 3 children who are in school. She's a tailor, a makes cloth items, shirts and pants. She has 3 years of experience in this work. 

She decided to apply for a loan to expand her working capital, in order to buy fabric of different kinds and colors. She makes pants, shirts and other things that people ask her for. She hopes to improve her business through expanding her working capital, as she is doing.

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy is married to Catherine and together they have five children. His primary business, besides owning a posho mill, is transportation. He also farms to supplement his income. He has been in business for the past 20 years. He gets a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

This is his seventh loan from KADET. He paid his previous loans successfully and on time. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer for the crops he has on his land. He will also use part of the loan amount to support and maintain his transportation business by servicing the car. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees and meet other financial commitments.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his crops and perform maintenance on a vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and bags, and to pay laborers

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is a widow with 7 children. Pacita is 66 years old and lives in Purok 6 Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental.

Pacita sells copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production) to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. Each month she earns 3,425 PHP doing this type of work. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP use to renovates her copra dryer behind her. The copra here in the Philippines is dried by putting it in the "landahan" and have fire in the bottom. Behind Pacita that is locally called "landahan" or dryer

Pacita has been a member of GDMPC for 7 years.  Pacita do her very best to improve her business and save portion of her profit because she wants to have electricity in her home.

loans.use: to renovate of her copra dryer

loans.name: Augusto

texts.es: Augusto, de 42 años, convive con Yolanda de 37 años con quien tiene 3 hijos. Juntos habitan en la comunidad de Santa Rosa Alta del distrito de Pichari, donde tienen su casa propia. Augusto es un hombre entusiasta, trabajador quien desde muy joven se dedico a las labores agrícolas, pensando en el bienestar de su querida esposa e hijos. Él cuenta con el apoyo de sus vecinos jornaleros quienes día a día trabajan en el campo, de esta manera gana un dinero extra. Por otro lado Augusto contrata jornaleros para que le faciliten en la extracción de sus productos, asimismo les da la confianza de cuidar su parcela cuando se ausenta. Él esta contento con el trabajo que realiza ya que desde pequeño siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, gracias a sus progenitores quienes le enseñaron ésta actividad. Considera rentable el negocio que tiene,  porque los productos que cultiva, como: el cacao y café tiene una demanda en el mercado nacional y en el exterior. El problema que él tiene es la aparición de plaga de insectos, que perjudica sus plantaciones. Los planes que tiene para el futuro próximo es seguir expandiendo su cultivo de café. Este será su primer credito con MFP, por el que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de plantas de café.
texts.en:
Augusto, 42, lives with Yolanda, 37, with whom he has three children.  Together they live in the community of Santa Rosa Alta, in the district of Pichari, where they have their own house.  Augusto is an enthusiastic and hardworking man who was doing agricultural labor from a young age, thinking about the well-being of his beloved wife and children.

He counts on the support of his day laborer neighbors who work in the fields from day to day to earn some extra money.  On the other hand, Augusto hires day laborers to make it easier for him to extract his products.  He also trusts them to take care of his property when he is away.  He is happy with the work he does since from a young age he has always worked in agriculture, thanks to his parents, who taught him this work.

Augusto considers his business profitable because the products he cultivates, such as cacao and coffee, are in demand in the national market and abroad.  The problem he has is the appearance of insect pests, which are detrimental to his property.  His plan for the future is to continue expanding his coffee production.

This will be his first loan with MFP, for which he is committed to paying off his loan installments punctually.

He will use the 1500 PEN to buy coffee plants.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants.

loans.name: Calixta

texts.en:
Calixta is 39 years old and married.  She has three school-aged children. She is from the village of Pantaon, Ozamiz City. Her husband is a farmer.

To earn a living, Calixta owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, operating a specialized retail store. Calixta decided to provide for the needs of the community. She offers different kinds of products, like foods for snacks, noodles, eggs, sugar, soap, and others.  Calixta has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Calixta joined GDMPC to gain financial access from the cooperative to help expand her business. This is the fifth cycle of loans taken from the cooperative. She is requesting this fifth cycle a loan of 6000 Php to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. In the future, Calixta plans to make her business bigger to have an additional return every month, because she plans to renovate her house from the income she generates from her business.

loans.use: Purchase more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Patrick Njai

texts.en: Patrick Njai is a 32-year-old single man. He describes himself as honest and determined. He operates a motorbike, transporting passengers. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a shopping centre in Nakuru. His primary customers are frequent and [he has] new customers. He describes his biggest business challenge as the motorbike breaking down. He will use this 40,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy more spare parts to maintain and service the motorbikes. His business goal is to buy a car which he will be using as a taxi within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts to maintain and service his motorbike.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Narcisa; ella tiene 47 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de crianza de animales como pollos, cuyes y gallinas al por mayor, la socia en la tienda de abarrotes vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y leche, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de crianza de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes como azúcar, leche, arroz y aceite y también para comprar alimentos para los animales. 
La socia Narcisa ha solicitado un anterior credito individual,pero este credito publicado pertenece al grupal del banco comunal perolniyoc,este creedito grupal solicito para su tienda de abarrotes y crianza de animales y el credito individual solicito para agricultura y tambien para implementar su tienda de abarrotes.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member is named Narcisa. She is 47 years old and is married with 4 children. 

The member alternates her daily activities between her grocery store and the breeding of animals such as chickens, guinea pigs, and hens at wholesale prices. 

Regarding her grocery store the member sells basic stapes such as rice, sugar and milk and through this business the member is able to raise her children. She wants to expand her grocery store and breeding of animals. 

She is asking for a loan in order to buy supplies for the grocery store such sugar, milk, rice and oil and also in order to buy feed for the animals.

Narcisa has also asked for a previous individual loan, but this stated loan, as a member of the communal bank group Perolniyoc, is for her grocery store and animal feed, and the previous individual loan was for agriculture and also to supply her grocery store.

The member is happy for the loan and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her grocery store such as sugar, milk, rice and oil, and also to buy animal feed

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina is 42 years old and is married, but they don’t have child yet. She has a retail store based in her home, and she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase items such as biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil, sugar and other ingredients to sell. She has been running her business for nine years. She is thankful because her income has been increasing. Her husband is her motivation for improving her business. She is working hard because she wants to have a better quality of life by doing something that brings in additional income. She hopes that she can get the loan amount she has requested.

loans.use: to purchase items such as biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil, sugar and other ingredients to sell.

loans.name: Francis Babu

texts.en: Francis, 32 years old, is married. He has three children with ages ranging from three and ten years old. He describes himself as an ambitious, polite and kind man. He operates a retail business where he sells papers. He has been involved in this business for four years. His primary customers are frequent and new. He describes his biggest business challenge to be government restrictions on paper sales and increased cost of paper sales. He will use the loan Kes 70,000 to purchase more paper bags. His business goal is to be a wholesaler of paper within five years.

loans.use: To buy more papers.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen de sesenta y cuatro años de edad vive con su compañero de vida en casa propia. Ella posee una venta de tortillas y adicional a eso vende choco bananos, charamuscas y hielo, es muy conocida en el lugar y se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues todo lo que comercia es de muy buena calidad y a precios accesibles, además el servicio es excelente siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa en el rostro; Carmen es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante, piensa que siempre hay que soñar y apuntar a lo más alto de lo que sabes que puedes lograr para así poder llegar al éxito, es por eso que está  dispuesta a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor, bananos, chocolate entre otros. Carmen tiene la esperanza que con su esfuerzo logrará darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carmen is sixty-four years old and lives with her life partner in her own house. 

She has a business selling tortillas and in addition to this she sells chocolate bananas, charamuscas [cold coconut juice], and ice. She is very well known in her area and has gained a lot of customers. Everything she sells is good quality and her prices are accessible. Her service is also excellent. She always greets her customers with a smile on her face.

Carmen is an entrepreneurial woman with a great desire to get ahead. She believes that you must always dream and aspire to the greatest thing that you think you can achieve to be able to have success. This is why she is requesting a loan from Integral that will allow her to purchase wholesale corn in addition to bananas and chocolate, among other things.

Carmen has the hope that with effort she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy whole sale corn and bananas and chocolate.

loans.name: Geneflor

texts.en:
Geneflor is a married woman who has two children. She is 33 years old, residing at Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Geneflor owns and operates a farm business, planting & harvesting bananas for sale to earn a living and she's been three years in this business. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. 

In 2008, Geneflor joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Geneflor wants to make improvements to her house and see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loans.name: Makhfirat

texts.ru: Махфират замужем и любящая мать троих детей. Более 15 лет она занимается откармливанием скота. Имеет в обороте 4 голов крупного рогатого скота, из них двое дойная корова. Махфират старается расширить свой бизнес ради улучшения своих жилищных условий семьи. Махфират хотел бы получить займ в размере 4000 Сомони для покупки корма для скота.
texts.en: Makhfirat is married and a loving mother of three children. She has been in the business of fattening cattle for more than fifteen years. She has four heads of cattle in stock with two of them milk cows. Makhfirat tries to expand her business for the sake of improving living conditions for her family. Makhfirat would like to take out a loan in the amount of 4,000 somoni to purchase livestock fodder.

loans.use: to buy fodder for cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Margaret wants to buy one dairy cattle and cotton wool from neighboring country and sell it in the country.

loans.name: Kpoliawoè

texts.en:
Born in 1975 in Ghana, Madame Kpoliawoe A. is married and other of five children. Along with her agricultural activities, she also sells "Kom" ( a food made with a corn base) that is known by the locals as a good addition to meals. Madame A. loves her work and is quite an expert in this culinary art, and she quickly gained the trust and business of all the neighbors. At present, she is asking for a loan of $850.00 which will allow her to stock corn and garantee her sales of "Kom." Also, she wishes to expand her business in order to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Née en 1975 au Ghana, Madame Kpoliawoè A. est mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants. En plus de ses activités agricoles, elle vend du « Kom » (un aliment à base du maïs) qui est très apprécié par la population de sa localité pour mieux contribuer aux dépenses du foyer. Aimant bien son activité, très accueillante et maîtrisant bien l’art culinaire, elle a vite gagné la confiance de tous les habitants. A présent elle sollicite un crédit de $850 qui servira à faire un stock de maïs afin de garantir sa vente de « Kom ». Ainsi, pense t-elle rentabiliser plus ses activités pour contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: To purchase corn to make "Kom."

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Lucy would like to buy a digital camera and digital video recorder for her photography business.

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
Pascuala is 33 years old, married and has 4 children. Her husband works as a rural taxi driver. She works selling clothes door to door in her community, which she buys at wholesale price at the Guatemalan border. She belongs to the group “Moscoso 2” together with Angelina Concepción Urbina who sells candy to schoolgirls and boys. With this loan Pascuala hopes to diminish the trips to the border and increase the quantity of clothes she purchases each time and therefore, increase her income. Angelina wants to establish a candy kiosk in a nearby high school located in her community.

Translated into English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

Pascuala tiene 33 años , casada , tiene 4 hijos, su esposo trabaja como taxista rural, ella vende ropa ofreciendo de casa en casa entre las personas de su comunidad, ella la compra en la frontera con guatemala al mayoreo. Pertenece al grupo moscoso 2. Junto con angelina concepcion urbina (vende dulces a los escolares ). Con el prestamo pascuala espera viajar a la frontera menos veces pero traer mayor cantidad de ropa para aumentar sus ingresos. Angelina quiere poner un pequeño kiosco de dulces en una escuela secundaria cercana a su comunidad.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing items

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Petrona has been a craftworker since she was a small girl and supports her husband in the care of her home and her two small children. With her ability of needlework she makes table cloths, napkins, cushions, bedspreads, and other merchandise that she sells around the village of Zinacantan or in the city of San Cristóbal in the market of craftswork. She also has a small stand by the edge of the international road where the tourists buy their products. She belongs to the group of the Market 2, where she hopes to wait for a loan to buy the fabric and string for her handcraft.

Translated from Spanish by Johnny and Gabe of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteers

PETRONA ha sido artesana desde muy pequeña de esta forma apoya a su esposo en el mantenimiento de su hogar y de sus dos pequeños, ella con la habilidad del bordado hace manteles, servilletas, cojines, sobrecamas, chales mercancía que vende en el pueblo de zinacantan o en la ciudad de San Cristóbal de las casas en el mercado de las Artesanías, también tiene un local a las orillas de la carretera internacional donde compran sus productos los turistas que transitan por ahí. Pertenece al grupo Merced 2 , con el préstamo espera comprar mas tela e hilo de bordar para sus artesanias.

loans.use: Buy materials for her crafts

loans.name: Rosa Merlincher

texts.es:
Rosa is mother of three children who go to school in a small educational centre in the city. She shares her small home with her husband who uses his small boat to transport people from one place to another.

Rosa started her own business out of her house with only a couple boxes of cookies and a bag of caramels. Due to her care and patience, little by little she increased the number of products she sold until later having a well assorted display with the help of her three children who help her with the sales.

Since her sales have increased she is now in need of supplying her store with more candy for her display and is hence requesting a loan with which she will be able to buy more products for the delight of her clients.

Let us help continue with the progress of this loving mother since her long term project is to be able to own a small store which sold exclusively these products.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Rosa es madre D. 3 hijos, que están aún estudiando en un pequeño centro educativo D. su ciudad y comparte las instalaciones D. su pequeña casita con su esposo que se dedica al transporte fluvial en su pequeña embarcación, un bote, con el que traslada a sus pasajeros D. un lugar a otro. Rosa empezó a trabajar provista con un par D. cajas D. galletas y una bolsa D. caramelos en casa y debido al empeño y a la paciencia con la que cuenta poco a poco fue incrementando sus artículos hasta poner un tablero bien surtido con la ayuda D. sus tres hijos que colaboran con la atención y la venta. Debido a que aumentaron sus ventas se encuentra en la necesidad D. abastecerse con la compra D. más dulces para su tablero y solicita un préstamo con el que podrá adquirir más productos para comodidad D. cada uno D. sus clientes. Ayudemos a continuar con el progreso D. esta amorosa madre ya que su proyecto a largo plazo es poder contar con una bodeguita exclusivamente dedicada a la venta D. estos productos.

loans.use: Purchasing candy to increase sales

loans.name: Dilfuza

texts.en: M. Dilfuza is married and she lives with her family in Spitamen. She has worked in a bazar since 2003 and during her experience i.e. 5 years, in clothes sale she showed herself as very capable of making business, she is quick and smart. All these qualities allow her to make good business and has succes in it. Now she wants to expand her business and her family will have another source of income with the help of the loan.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Mirna Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mrs. Mirna C. has been selling clothing for 20 years in the city of Managua. She is a married mother of three children for whom she is responsible to support.

She began her business with U$200 with the goal of bettering her living conditions as there have been few resources and to support her small children providing them an education so they may grow up to be successful professionals.

Mrs. C. has worked with Ceprodel for 2 years, obtaining 6 loans that have allowed her to better her living conditions and continue to support her three children for today more than ever they need your support.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Mirna C. se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 20 años en la ciudad de Managua. Es una madre casada y con tres hijos de los que tiene la responsabilidad de mantener.

Inició su negocio con un capital de U$ 200 con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones de su hogar ya que ha sido de escasos recursos y urge apoyar a sus pequeños brindándole educación para que lleguen a ser grandes profesionales.

La señora C. ha trabajado con Ceprodel desde hace dos años obteniendo 6 créditos que le han servido para mejorar sus condiciones de vida y continuar apoyando a sus tres hijos que hoy mas que nunca necesitan de su apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Vorn S., 39, is a mother six children and lives with her husband in a part of Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia. She works selling fish and chickens at a busy market making on average $2.30 each day in profit. Her husband is a taxi-conductor making about $2 per day.

One of her children works driving a motor-taxi, another one is a construction worker, and the rest are enrolled in school.

Due to a growing customer demand, Vorn S. would like to request a loan to expand her inventory to meet her client’s needs. Moreover, because of her children are growing every day, she also needs part of the loan to expand her house.

loans.use: To expand her inventory to meet her client’s needs, and also to expand her house for her growing children.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita is a member of the "Santa Rosa de Lima" communal bank and lives in Juanjui, in the San Martín region of Peru. She runs her business out her home located in the La Merced neighborhood. She has a convenience store set up selling general groceries and other daily-needed items. With perseverance in her business she was able to send her children to school and turn them into productive members of society. Today she's 71 years old and carries on with the same enthusiasm and is preparing herself for happy golden years.

With the $600 loan, which she plans to repay in six months, she will invest in the purchase of diverse grocery items such as all kinds of soap, rice, sugar, beans and legumes, toilet paper, fish, canned fruit and oil.

Margarita lives with one of her sons and her daughter-in-law. Her jovial spirit is displayed in the daily attention she pays her customers and she feels happy to be a productive member of society, especially in her neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Margarita es socia del banco comunal “ Santa Rosa de Lima ” vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. El negocio está ubicado en su propia casa situado en el Jirón Libertad en el Barrio La Merced , en la que tiene instalada una bodega donde vende abarrotes en general y otros productos de consumo diario. Con su perseverancia en el negocio logró que sus hijos estudiaran y fueran personas útiles a la sociedad. Hoy a sus 71 años continúa con el mismo entusiasmo y preparándose para una vejes feliz. Con el préstamo de S/.1,700.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, será invertido en la compra de diversos abarrotes como cajas de jabón por cada marca (marsella, bolivar, jumbo, etc), sacos de 50 kilogramos de arroz, azúcar, menestras de diversos variedades., papel higiénico en paquetes, conservas de pescado y de frutas en cajas y aceite por litro, Margarita vive con uno de sus hijos y su nuera. Su espíritu jovial lo demuestra en la atención diaria a sus clientes y se siente feliz de sentirse útil a la sociedad sobre todo a los moradores del sector en el que vive.

loans.use: Purchase groceries like rice, sugar, beans, legumes, etc. / Compra de abarrotes (arroz, azúcar, menestras, etc)

loans.name: Prisciliano

texts.es:
Prisciliano ya tiene un buen dinero ahorrado con el que piensa comprar un terreno, donde futuramente edificara su local de ventas.

Prisciliano C. sells cosmetics. He has been working using credit from the Paraguayan Foundation since 2003. He began as the collector for a cosmetics distributor and little by little he saved to become a seller of cosmetics himself.

Now he has built a large client base and continues to dream of a day when he can guarantee a fixed amount of sales for his business. He visits his clients and this helps him to meet new people that eventually become new clients.

Thanks to the good quality of his products and his friendly demeanor, his clients are satisfied with his products and would like to have a location of his own.

He is always increasing his offerings, thus Prisciliano is seeking a loan to be able to acquire a larger selection of merchandise like body creams, anti-wrinkle aids, makeup, perfume, hair dye, shampoo, salon accessories, brushes etc.

Prisciliano already has money saved with which he can begin to think about buying land to build his store on in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sedloff, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Prisciliano C. se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de forma ambulante y bajo pedido. Trabaja con los créditos de la Fundación Paraguaya desde el año 2.003. Empezó como cobrador de una empresa distribuidora de cosméticos y poco a poco fue ahorrando para poder dedicarse el mismo a las ventas.

Hoy día tiene una gran clientela formada y sueña con poder contar el día de mañana con un local de ventas fijo. El visita a sus clientes y estos lo ayudan referenciandolo a nuevas personas que luego pasan a ser clientes nuevos.

Gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos y su amabilidad, sus clientes están bastantes satisfechos con sus productos y lo apoyan para que tenga un local propio.

Como cada vez aumentan más sus pedidos, hoy día, Prisciliano solicita un crédito para poder adquirir un gran lote de mercaderías como cremas para el cuerpo, antiarrugas, maquillajes, perfumes, tintes para cabello, shampoo, accesorios para peluquerías, cepillos, etc.

Prisciliano ya tiene un buen dinero ahorrado con el que piensa comprar un terreno, donde futuramente edificara su local de ventas.

loans.use: To buy goods such as body cream, antiwrinkle creams, makeup, perfume, hair dye, shampoo, accessories for a salon, brushes etc.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: I have been married for four years and have two kids: one boy and one girl. Both of my kids are not of school-going age yet. I reside with my family in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. My husband runs a grocery store; he started the store three years ago. He sells all daily-use items in his shop. He works at the shop from 6 am to 10 pm daily.  We live in a joint family system and therefore we want to save extra profits from our income to build a house of our own.

loans.use: Improve the range of items in our grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand a business by adding natural medicines.

loans.name: Lim

texts.en: Mrs. Lim L., 34, lives in Siem Reap Cambodia, home to the country’s famous Angkor Wat temples. She is a housewife and her husband is a taxi-driver. The couple has four young children, one of whom attends school. Lim is now seeking work opportunities for herself and her family. She would like to borrow $1,000 in order to purchase a motorbike that she and her husband could use to commute to work.

loans.use: Lim would like to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Comité Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
This committee is made up of 17 working women from the Costa Alegre de Cabañas neighborhood in the city of Caacupé. Most of the women make and sell chipas [traditional Paraguayan cheese bread]. The committee is currently in the fifth cycle of the Mujeres Emprendedoras [Women Entrepreneurs] program, which provides average loans of about $125 to each of its members.

The committee was established with the first meetings in Maria Cirina S.’s house. Maria took charge of bringing the women together for meetings to appoint members of the group. One of the characteristics of this group is its on-time installment payments and its savings. The committee’s current goal is to meet with other women in the neighborhood to clean the sidewalks and streets, as well as plant trees on the block, all with their children’s care and wellbeing in mind.

Maria is very happy and proud to be an integral part of a group of women with honest goals such as helping to improve the quality of life in their community by doing community work. For example, they have organized athletic activities, musical contests and a San Juan party, with the objective of raising funds to increase their savings. In so doing, the group has planned for any unexpected event that might occur and thus provided the greatest assurance that late payments will not occur.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

El comité está compuesto por 17 señoras trabajadoras del barrio Costa Alegre de Cabañas de la ciudad de Caacupé, la gran mayoría son fabricantes y vendedoras de chipas, actualmente el grupo se encuentra en el 5 ciclo del programa de comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, y la misma están siendo beneficiadas con un crédito promedio de gs. 494.000 (~$125) para cada integrantes.

El comité se inició con las primeras reuniones en la casa de la señora Maria Cirina S., quién fue la encargada de convocar a las señoras para las reuniones de conformación del grupo y una de las caracteristica de este comités es la puntualidad en el pago de sus cuotas y sus ahorros. El comité actualmente es tiene como objetivo la de reunirse con las demás señoras del barrio para limpiar las veredas, la calle, arbolarizar la cuadra dónde viven, todo pensando en el cuidado y bienestar de sus hijos.

La señora Maria, se siente muy contenta y orgullosa de ser parte integrante de un grupo de señoras con finalidades nobles como la de ayudar a mejorar el nivel de vida de su comunidad a través de trabajos comunitarios, entre ella destaca que tuvieron que realizar actividades deportivas, concursos musicales y fiesta de San Juan, con el objetivo de recaudar fondos para capitalizar sus ahorros y asi preveer cualquier contingencia que pueda ocurrir en un futuro y por ende evitar al máximo algún tipo de atrasos en sus cuotas.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for making traditional Paraguayan bread, such as starch, cheese, vegetable oil; as well as merchandise for sale, such as sugar, meat, tea, flour, milk, charcoal and all types of drinks

loans.name: Vahdeta

texts.en:
Vahdeta was born in 1989 and she lives in a suburb of the town of Doboj called Sjenina Rijeka. She has just started working in the textile industry and, in her free time, she sells clothes and cosmetics. 

With this loan of 700 KM, Vahdeta will purchase additional clothes and cosmetics to sell. 

She hopes that she will earn more money, because her husband's salary of 600 KM (~ $420 USD) is not enough for their new life. They are a newly married couple and they need money to start from the beginning.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia inició el negocio por superación personal, ya que le gustan mucho las ventas y para ella es una forma de conocer personas y ayudarlas a través de sus productos naturistas. Comenzó en Agosto de 2004, ella era consumidora de los productos que actualmente vende, pero una amiga que le vendía los productos la convenció para que ella también se convirtiera en vendedora, fue así como comenzó a vender dichos productos, primero entre sus familiares, y después entre vecinos y amistades, los cuales la fueron recomendando con otras personas y en la actualidad tiene un buen numero de clientes. A partir de su crédito anterior otorgado a través de KIVA ha podido incrementar sus clientes aunque este año ha sido un poco difícil por la situación económica.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 4 meses para poder comprar más productos que le permita tener un mejor surtido que ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera incrementar sus ganancias
texts.en:
Julia began her business by overcoming personal obstacles, as she likes sales and for her it is a way of getting to know and help people through natural products. She began in August of 2004 as a consumer of the products she sells today. A friend was selling products to her and convinced her that she too should become a seller, and it was this way that she began to sell these products, first to relatives, then to neighbors and friends who were recommended by others and today she has a good number of customers. Beginning with a prior loan given through KIVA she has been able to increase her customers even though it as been a rather difficult economic situation. She needs a loan for US $300 which will be repaid in 4 months in order to by more jewelry and shoes that will permit her to have a better stock to offer her customers and in this manner increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy jewelry

loans.name: Georgina Marisela

texts.es: La señora Georgina habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, barrio ubicado en la capital  de Managua, tiene la edad de 37  años, se encuentra casada con  el señor Iván Perez que es ingeniero civil, juntos tienen  3  hijos, los cuales están estudiando. La señora Georgina se dedica a la venta de nacatamales que inicio este negocio con las ventas de sopas hace 2 años, ella aspira mejorar su casa donde habita  mas de 9 años, por tanto solicita un crédito de C$  8,000 a un plazo 10 meses para comprar material de construcción y ponerle cielo raso a su casa; así mismo poder en un futuro mejorar las condiciones de estructura de su cocina,  ya que le gustaría ampliarla para invertir mas en la elaboración de nacatamales y de esta forma tener mas ingresos para apoyar mas a su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. Georgina lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood located in the capital city of Managua. She is 37 years old and is married to Mr. Iván Perez, who is a civil engineer. They have 3 school age children. Ms. Georgina sells nacatamales—Central American tamales—for a living. She started this business via soup sales 2 years ago. She aspires to repair her house of residence, where she has been living for more than 9 years. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of $8,000.00 Nicaraguan córdobas, which will be repaid in 10 monthly installments, so that she can build a ceiling for her house. She would also like to improve her kitchen structure in the future because she wants to expand it and invest more in the preparation of nacatamales, thus increasing her income so that she can further support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for ceiling

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en:
Cecile E. is a 36 year old married mother, who lives in the village of Wome. There is no electricity in Wome. It is a small village located approximately 130 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital.

Cecile makes and sells palm oil to provide for her family. This oil is an ingredient widely used in Togolese dishes. The process of making palm oil takes several days and requires considerable attention and skill. With this loan from Kiva, Cecile plans to buy a fresh supply of palm nuts to make palm oil to sell. With the profits she will earn, she will be able to pay for her childrens’ school fees and other expenses.

loans.use: Purchase supplies of palm nuts, with which to make palm oil to sell

loans.name: Phong's Group

texts.en:
There are four borrowers in this group, which is made up of people who live in the Kompong Pras Commune in Battambang Province. Mrs. Phong T. is 33 years old. She owns and runs a store in front of her house, where she sells beef soup and roast beef to customers who come to eat in her house. She currently earns approximately $4 per day. She is married to Lot Sitha, age 35, who is a rice farmer who also works with her. They have two children, both of whom are in school. T. hopes to expand her business, which is why she is applying for this loan.

The remainder of borrowers in this loan group are:

Mrs. Lay T., 33, is a teacher who also sells cakes to students. She is requesting a loan to buy motorcycle-repairing materials for her husband's business.

Mrs. Lay T., 28, is a primary-school teacher. Her husband, Som Ol, 40, is buying a car which he will resell at a profit. T. is requesting funds to use as a capital for her husband's business.

Mrs. Pech L., 54, runs a well-digging business and has several employees. She is seeking a loan to buy more well-making materials which will make this work easier.

loans.use: To expand various small businesses

loans.name: Cecilia Armida

texts.es:
La señorita Cecilia Armida H. R. tiene 55 años es secretaria de su Banco Comunal, vive en Buenos Aires, distrito de Víctor Larco Herrera, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio Idiomas en UNT, carrera que ejerció durante 10 años, por motivos de salud tuvo que dejar de trabajar, no tiene hijos.
Cecilia Armida inicio su negocio vendiendo comida rápida por las tardes, con sus ganancias obtenidas logro incrementar su negocio y ahora tiene su propio restaurante, negocio que desarrolla en su propia casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Las Palmeras”, lo invirtió en la compra de utensilios de cocina
Con el crédito de 1600 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para su restaurante. 
Cecilia Armida sueña con ampliar más su negocio y viajar a EE.
texts.en:
Cecilia Armida H. R. is 55 years old and studies several Languages at the UNT. She used her skills to work for 10 years, but due to a health problem she had to stop working. She has no children. She lives in Buenos Aires, district of Víctor Larco Herrera, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru. Cecilia started her business selling fast food in the evening. With the money she made, she was able to improve her business, and now she owns a restaurant at home. She requested for a first $100 loan from the community bank “Las Palmeras”, which she used to purchase kitchen supplies. With this $500 loan, which will be paid off in 6 months, she will purchase basic food products for her business. Cecilia’s dream is to diversify her business and to travel to the US.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic food products for her restaurant

loans.name: Makole F Group

texts.en:
Melania has owned a small food vendor store in the Ipagala neighborhood of Dodoma for 2 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 250. Every day she works at her business. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more foodstuffs for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and get more food for her family.

Melania is 45 years old, widowed, and has two children: ages 20 and 18. She also cares for one additional dependent. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members Janeth, Lucy, and Dora. Each woman also has her own small business in Dodoma.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to expand her business

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: C. is 21 years old and a resident of the Siem Reap Province in Cambodia. He has three children, all of whom are single and under his care. He is married to Saran, 21, who is a firewood provider to their community. C. has been working with his wife since 2002. He uses his cart with oxen for his business and earns a good profit. To make a greater income for the family, C. is requesting a loan of $ 300 to buy one more ox for his business. He dreams of having a bigger house and degrees for his children.

loans.use: To buy one more ox for his business

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester has managed a rolling store business for almost 3 years. She sells meat and fish in their village. With her desire to increase her products, she wants to borrow PHP 8,000 that she can use to purchase a bigger quantity of fish and meat. Through her business, she is able to help her husband generate income to support the basic needs of their family, for household expenses and to support the education of their children. She strives hard to increase her income for the benefit of their family since her husband does not have a permanent job.

She is already 45 years old and her husband is working as a part-time welder. They have eight children: Analyn – 24 years old, college graduate; Fernando – 21 years old, a helper; Anabelle – 19 years old and already married; Erlindo – 18 years old, a high school sophomore; Ana Rose – 13 years old, grade six; Carla – 10 years old, grade four; Carlo – 8 years old, grade one; Kately Ann – 7 years old, is not studying due to lack of financial resources. They have a big family and she wishes to uplift their poor life situation, thus Ester and her husband are doing their best to become successful in the business.

loans.use: To purchase fish and meat for re-sale

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Greetings from Chantal M. in Kigali, Rwanda! Chantal is 33 years old, married, and has four children (aged 13, 10, 7, and 5 months) and four dependants. 

Chantal is requesting her first loan from Kiva partner, Vision Finance Company, so that she can buy more clothing to sell from her market stall. She has been in business for ten years and has one employee in her shop. She works daily from 7am to 5pm. Chantal is requesting a loan of 500 000 RWF to be repaid on a monthly basis over an eight-month period.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Rodrigo Cristino

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega, el joven Rodrigo P. se dedica a su negocio de transporte por medio de su triciclo llevando a los clientes de un lugar a otro y cobrando de acuerdo a la distancia recorrida.

El problema que hoy en día el joven P. atraviesa es que el triciclo requiere de reparación y para esto ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de los repuestos y así continuar con su negocio de transporte.
texts.en:
In the city of Chinandega, Rodrigo P. operates a transportation business. On his cycle rickshaw, he brings clients from one place to another, charging according to the distance traveled. The young P.'s present problem is that his cycle needs repair. For this reason, he has turned to Ceprodel to obtain credit to purchase the replacement parts and continue his business.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair cycle rickshaw

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.en:
Châm Đào Thị (446101154) is a 46-year-old female living in the town of Kim Động. She is married and has two school-aged children. Châm owns and operates a general store selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

In 2001, Châm joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Châm is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to expand her business. The loan will be her 5th loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her store.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her store

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en:
E. A. Ernestina is married and has 4 dependents. She has received schooling through Junior High. Ernestina sells clothing at Akotokyir. She has been in this business since 2005. Her husband is a security guard. Ernestina uses her income to pay for housekeeping expenses.

Ernestina will use the loan to purchase more clothes for resale for more profits. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ernestina plans to reinvest for more profits.

loans.use: purchase more clothes for resale

loans.name: Zikrillo

texts.ru: Бобиев Зикрилло проживает в районе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 25 лет. Женат, имеет 1 ребенка. Зикрилло более 7 лет занимается торговлей. Он имеет торговую точку, где в основном торгует продуктами питания. Клиент просит кредит, для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Zikrillo B. lives in Kurgan-Tube region. He is 25 years old, married and has one child. Zikrillo has over seven years trading. He has a shop which mostly sells food. He is requesting a loan in order to increase his trade turnover.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of trade turnover

loans.name: Nget

texts.en: Nget S., 30, is a construction builder in the city, with an income of US $4 per day.
