The total average monthly income of the family is 1500 laris. 

Valerik requested a loan to purchase feed for his pigs and cows for the fall and winter months. He will feed the domestic animals well during the fall and winter and get quality milk and piglets, which will be sold for a convenient price. The family will get a planned amount of income, part of which will be used for covering the loan and the remainder of which will be spent on improving the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase feed for pigs and cows.

loans.name: Sam Ang

texts.en:
Sam Ang (in the photo) is 51-years-old and her husband, Sras, is 50 years old. They live in a village about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1980 and have four children; two sons and two daughters. One is married and lives outside the family home, one is an electrician, another one is garment worker and another one attends school.  

Sam Ang and her husband raise fish at home. She is asking for her first loan of $500 to help wither her fish farming business by buying fish feed.

loans.use: to buy fish feed.

loans.name: Jesse Iván

texts.es: Jesse dentro de 5 o 10 años se ve litigando en los juzgados como todo un profesional. La inspiración de su vida es su mamá porque nunca pierde las ganas de salir adelante y siempre le ha inculcado ser un profesional de bien.  Le hace destacar de los demás estudiante los deseos por cumplir sus metas. Espera con este préstamo poder llegar a obtener su título y ejercer su profesión
texts.en: In 5 or 10 years, Jesse sees himself litigating in the courts as a professional.  His inspiration in life is his mom because she never lost the desire to get ahead in life and always encouraged him to be an upstanding professional.  Jesse stands out from the other students because of his desire to achieve his goals.  He hopes that, with this loan, he will be able to obtain his degree and carry out his profession.

loans.use: to pay for his degree course

loans.name: Heart

texts.en:
Heart is 21 years old and single. She lives in the Philippines. Heart has a retail shop that sells clothes such as shirts, underwear, and pants. She has had this business for two years. 

Heart is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy clothes to sell. Heart is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Heart hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a hardworking business woman, age 34. She is married and blessed with two children who are in school. She has been practicing both crop and dairy farming for the last two years to support her family. Her potential customers are the local residents. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy cabbages and tomato seedlings.

loans.use: To buy cabbages and tomato seedlings.

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine is a 39-year-old married woman with four children who are all in school. Her husband is also employed and contributes to the provision of basic family needs. She owns a house that has electricity, but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Irine has operated a vegetable grocery for the past seven years with her neighbors as her customers. She dreams of expanding her business but faces a major challenge of seasonality. 

With a loan of KES 40,000 she wants to purchase more stock of cabbages, tomatoes, potatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of cabbages, tomatoes, potatoes and onions for resale.

loans.name: Precila

texts.en:
This is Precila, 47, resident of GMA, Cavite City, the Philippines. She is married to Luciano, an employee, and is mother to her three children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Precila is a mineral water distributor.  What she basically does, is to buy mineral water in containers from wholesalers and then sell them per container (five gallons per container) at a profit.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2,500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan.  She will be utilizing the loan to buy more stocks of mineral water needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Precila dreams to be able to give all of her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She also hopes to have a growing network of customers. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can, also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of mineral water needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her salon and provide good services for her clients

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a widow and has two children. She is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. 

Elizabeth operates a business providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. Every month she earns PHP 4,000 from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 21,149.61 to repair her vehicle to provide better service.

In 2010, Elizabeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to improve and expand her business and to earn twice as much income from her business.

loans.use: to repair her vehicle to provide better service

loans.name: And Jef Group

texts.fr: Le groupe And Jëf a été créé le 08 Mai 2010. IL est composé de 12 membres issues du même village, elles s'activent dans l'embouche et le petit commerce. Ndioba est la responsable du groupe. Elle debout à droite sur la photo. Elle est mariée et âgée de 29 ans. Elle fait de la couture(draps de lit, pagne)comme activité principale. Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience pour ce type d'activité. Son prêt va la permettre d'acheter du tissu des fils pour broderie. Son objectif est de renforcer son niveau d'épargne d’accroître  son activité.
texts.en:
The group And Jëf was formed on May 8, 2010. It is made up of 12 members from the same village. They are active in animal fattening and shopkeeping. 

Ndioba is responsible for the group. She is standing on the right in the photo. She is married and 29 years old. Her main business is sewing (bed sheets, loin cloths). She has good experience for this type of business. 

Her loan will allow her to buy fabric and embroidery thread. Her goal is to strengthen her savings and to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric and embroidery thread.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom, 57, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

She and her husband have been involved in the agricultural business for over seven years; they have extensive experience and are successful in their careers. They are involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle. In addition, she sells sweet cakes to generate extra income to support the family. 

She earns approximately USD 5 per day. Two of her children are employed in a mirror shop and earn about USD 6 per day. Due to difficulties in the family’s transportation, Mom is requesting for a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the money saved from her transportation expenses to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to build a new house and help her children get bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Nila

texts.en: To earn a living, Nila and her husband are operating a tricycle known as a “side car” in other region. Tricycle is the common mode of public transportation in the Philippines. They have been doing this business for 12 year to earn a living. Nila and her husband work hard to provide for the needs of their family. Definitely, they are asking for a loan for their tricycle maintenance. They will buy spare parts, motor gear and paint. In this way, they will be able to continue operate their tricycle for their livelihood. The family live in Clarin, Bohol with their children.

loans.use: buy spare parts, motor gear and paint

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Ayawavi

texts.en:
Born in 1976 in Davédi, Mrs. Ayawavi A. lives in a union with a carpenter who does not manage to take care of the family's needs. She has learned some tailoring and now works with a girlfriend. However, taking into account her experience and the number of customers, she believes that she would profit more from working alone.

In order to accomplish this, she is asking for a credit of $950 which she will use for the renting a workshop space, purchasing a machine and selling her products. She will thus be able to take care of her family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1976 à Davédi, Madame A. Ayawavi vit dans une union de fait avec un menuisier qui n’arrive pas à la prendre en charge. Elle se débrouille avec la couture qu’elle a apprise entre temps. Actuellement elle est associée à une copine pour le travail. Mais compte tenu de son expérience et du nombre de ses clients, elle pense s’installer seule pour bien profiter de son travail. Pour la réalisation de ce projet, elle sollicite un crédit de $950 qui va servir à la location de l’atelier, à l’achat de machine et à la vente des articles de mercerie. Ainsi donc, elle pourra se prendre convenablement en charge.

loans.use: Renting a space for making and selling drapery products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more fish stocks and fish fillet stocks to be able to expand her business

loans.name: Maria De Jesús

texts.es:
Señora Maria de Jesús is a widow. Her children are already married and she lives alone. Due to her age, it has been very difficult for her to find a job, and to obtain the resources that she needs, one of her daughters suggested that she sell powdered milk. So she decided to begin her business two years ago. Now she receives help from one of her daughters and together they have succeeded in increasing the sales considerably. In the afternoons, Maria goes out to sell her products and give demonstrations, so that her clients will get to know her.

At this moment, Maria is requesting a loan of $250 dollars that she will use to purchase merchandise to meet her clients' demands and increase her sales. She will repay this loan in three months. Help Maria improve her quality of life. She has confidence that people will help those who need it most. She appreciates the opportunity that your support provides for her.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La señora Maria de Jesús es viuda, sus hijos ya están casados y vive sola, por su edad le ha sido muy difícil encontrar un empleo y para obtener los recursos que necesita una de sus hermanas le recomendó vender leche en polvo, y así fue como decidió iniciar su propio negocio hace 2 años, ahora recibe la ayuda de una de sus hijas y juntas han logrado incrementar las ventas considerablemente, por las tardes Maria sale a ofrecer sus productos y hace demostraciones para que sus clientes los conozcan.

En estos momentos Maria solicita un crédito por $ 250 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes e incrementar sus ventas, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en 3 meses. Ayuda a Maria a mejorar su calidad de vida, ella confía en las personas que ayudan a quien más lo necesita, y te agradece la oportunidad que le brindas con tu apoyo.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to meet her clients' needs

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is a married woman who is 37 years of age. She has five children and two adopted children. She is very poor. Her husband is a fisherman, and this is the only source of income they have been relying on for many years. She decided to join SPBD, which she thought was the only way she would be able to get some financial assistance. She will use her loan to buy herself a fishing net, canoe, some fishing rods, a fishing spear, and other things she needs for fishing. In the future Maria is planning to own a bigger boat so she will be able to get more fish when they go fishing.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Azad

texts.en: Azad was born in Baku. He is 23 years old and is not married yet. He runs a furniture workshop where he repairs furniture and makes new furniture as well. He has been in this business for three years, but his business is not well developed yet. He wants to repair the workshop, to buy necessary tools and equipment for work, and and to develop his business. He applied to Normicro Baku branch for a loan in amount of $1000 for the first time as he has little of his own funds to invest in his business. He wants to buy tools first.

loans.use: To buy tools and equipment

loans.name: Oysuluv

texts.ru:
Oysuluv U.’s husband went abroad in search of employment. The money he was making was not enough to satisfy the growing demands of Oysuluv U.’s family, and Oysuluv decided to start a business. She has been selling fabrics for more than 4 years. Now, Oysuluv U. wants to expand the business to help pay for her son’s traditional upbringing and education.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Во времена возникновения сложной экономической ситуации и невостребованности рабочей силы муж Уроковой Ойсулув принял решение выехать на заработки за пределы республики. Однако со временем из-за экономической ситуации и из-за роста потребности семье стало не хватать этого дохода - и тогда в помощь своему супругу она решила заняться предпринимательством. В настоящий момент она занята в этом уже более 4 лет и в расширении бизнеса видит верный путь к устройству жизни своего выросшего ребенка - согласно традиций.

loans.use: Expand inventory of fabrics sold to include more expansive better quality products

loans.name: Fernando  José

texts.es:
Mr. Fernando started his small business 25 years ago. He has been selling in the streets of Managua .He decided to ask for loan of $275 to CEPRODEL in order to improve a small stand in the market where he has established his business. He sales meals and of his goals is to improve the infrastructure of its business.

The economic contribution and financial help of CEPRODEL has helped Mr. Fernando to improve the conditions of life of him and his small son. He is planning to keep in this business that has helped to provide for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Fernando inicia su pequeño negocio hace 25 años vendiendo en las calles de Managua, hace 2 años decide solicitar préstamo de C$ 3,000.00 a CEPRODEL para acondicionar un pequeño local en el mercado en donde actualmente establece su negocio ofreciendo al publico general sus comidas y la venta de Atol.

Aunque tiene un pequeño local establecido en las instalaciones del mercado una de las metas del Sr. Fernando es mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio.

Con el aporte económico resultado de los financiamientos de CEPRODEL ha mejorado las condiciones de vida de el y de su pequeño hijo. Y piensa seguir en esta actividad que le han servido de sustento a su familia.

loans.use:
Sales of food and Atol( corn meal)
Venta  de  Comida  y  Atol

loans.name: Loida

texts.en: Loida is forty-four years old and she is a versatile entrepreneur.  She already has a great deal of experience in business because she has been a couturier and a shopkeeper.  Currently she runs a beauty salon in the Mata Los Indios community of Santo Domingo, where she offers services in hair straightening, hair dying, hair styling, and so forth.  She also sells beauty products and fashionable hair accessories.  Loida wants to expand her business in order to attract new clients and to increase her income.  With this loan, she would like to buy products for her salon and to add new lines of hair products.  This would be the second loan that the entrepreneur would receive from FSMA. She wisely used the first loan she received from our organization and timely repaid that first loan.

loans.use: This second loan will be used to purchase a wide range of products to supply a beauty salon.

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
At 27 years old, Marcial has been able to establish his career thanks to his small auto repair shop, where he works diligently providing his customers with the best care and the best job possible. He could work more effectively and efficiently if he had the necessary tools, but funds are necessary to obtain them; therefore he is seeking your help to acquire the tools that will make his repair shop the best in the city.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer. Marcial a sus 27 años ha podido gracias a su carrera establecer un pequeño taller de mecánica en el que labora con mucho esmero y dedicación, dando a sus clientes la mejor atención y mejor trabajo posible, pero su trabajo podría ser de mayor eficiencia y efectividad si contara con las herramientas necesarias.Sin embargo el factor económico es necesario para obtener lo que tanto necesita, por esa razón recurre en búsqueda de tu ayuda para adquirir pronto las cosas que harán de su taller el mejor de su ciudad.

loans.use: To purchase auto repair tools

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela M. has always been a very hard-working woman: after separating from her husband she had to find an activity which would generate income but at the same time permit her to care for her children who today are 9 and 7 years old as she had no one else who could look after them. The solution was to start a business in her house selling stationery and hiring a computer. The result of this first effort was that she stocked more merchandise: additionally, she now also has a cyber cafe installed in the same location.

She is asking for a loan of $750 dollars that she will repay in 4 months to invest in her business buying merchandise. With your contributions Adela will continue generating income which will allow her to maintain her children.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Adela M. siempre ha sido una mujer muy trabajadora después de separarse de su esposo tuvo que encontrar una actividad que le generara ingresos pero que a la vez le permitiera cuidar a sus hijos que actualmente tienen 9 y 7 años, ya que en ese entonces no tenia quien se los cuidara fue que inicio un negocio en su casa vendiendo papelería y rentando una computadora. a base de esfuerzo fue que surtió mas mercancía, ahora además de esto cuenta con un ciber café en las mismas instalaciones.

Ella solicita un crédito por US $750 que pagara en 4 meses para invertirlos en su negocio comparando mercancía. Con tus aportaciones Adela seguirá generando ingresos que le permitan mantener a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Prisca's Motomoto Group

texts.en:
Prisca is 24 years old and is a married woman. Sheowns a small shop of mobile phone items which she started in 2006. She works everyday from 9am to 5pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more mobile phone items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Prisca P., who has business dealing in clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more phone items for her business.

loans.name: Agustina's Group

texts.es:
Susana, Agustina and Paulina are members of the Commercial Bank of Santa Bárbara: the members are from the community of the same name which belongs to the District of Tambillos which is located 30 minutes from the town of Ayacucho.

Sausana is married: she is 47 years old and has 8 children. Agustina is a widow, aged 44 and with 3 children. Susana and Agustina travel to fairs where they sell fruits and buy cereal grains which they sell in the town markets of Ayacucho.

Meanwhile, Paulina is married, aged fifty and has four children. Paulina sells vegetables which she sells in the market of Las Américas.

Susana, Agustina and Paulina need loans of 600, 450 and 900 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of wheat, barley, maize, fruits and vegetables.

Susana, Agustina and Paulina dream of having stable employment, improving their business and providing their children with a good education.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Susana, Agustina y Paulina son socias del Banco Comunal Santa Bárbara, las socias son D. la comunidad del mismo nombre que pertenece al Distrito D. Tambillos que queda a 30 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Susana es casada, tiene 47 años y 8 hijos, por otro lado Agustina es viuda, tiene 44 años y 3 hijos. Susana y Agustina viajan a las ferias donD. venD. frutas y D. las ferias compra cereales que venD. en los mercados D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Mientras que Paulina es casada, tiene 50 años y 4 hijos, Paulina venD. verduras que venD. en el mercado Las Américas.

Susana, Agustina y Paulina necesita prestamos D. 600 soles, 450 soles, 900 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. trigo, cebada, maíz, frutas y verduras.

Los sueños D. Susana, Agustina y Paulina son tener un puesto estable, mejorar sus negocios y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Susana, Agustina and Paulina need loans of 600, 450 and 900 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of wheat, barley, maize, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia is a 61-year-old woman who lives with her husband, daughter, and 2 grandchildren: Augustine, age 9, and Milagro, age 1. Delia opened up her small general store on the side of the main highway that connects two cities: Paraguarí and Villarrica. The general store has been in business for over ten years.

Delia previously sold meals and goods to her neighbors and to the local miners, her husband's co-workers, who work in the quarries even today. Her small business is currently very prosperous. Customers come on weekends to purchase her famous, homemade empanadas (stuffed pastries).

With this loan, she intends to expand her business now that the route is being paved. She would like to increase her merchandise in order to meet her customers’ demands and boost sales.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Delia tiene 61 años, vive con su marido, una hija y dos nietos, Augustine 9 años y Milagro de 1 año. Delia abrió su pequeña despensa al costado de la carretera principal que une dos ciudades, va de la ciudad de Paraguarí hasta la ciudad de Villarrica. El negocio funciona hace ya más de diez años.

Anteriormente, Delia, vendían comidas y mercaderías a sus vecinos y a mineros compañeros de trabajo de su marido quienes trabajan hasta hoy día en la cantera. Su pequeña empresa funciona actualmente con mucho éxito. Los fines de semana, los clientes vienen para adquirir sus famosas empanadas hechos en casa.

Con su préstamo pretende ampliar su negocio ya que la ruta principal está siendo pavimentada y desea aumentar su stock para satisfacer la demanda de los clientes y aumentar su movimiento de ventas.

loans.use: Purchase meat, eggs, milk, and canned goods

loans.name: Dios Padre Misericordioso (Merciful God The Father) Group

texts.es:
The Merciful God the Father group was formed due the help of Mrs. Saturnina C., mother of four, who sells meat to help cover the costs of her home. She is well-known by her neighbors in the ‘Merciful God the Father’ neighborhood, so she was easily able to gather the other members of the group. Some group members sell fruit, others clothing, others lingerie, and others sell prepared foods. They are all very interested in the ‘Hard-working Women Program’ and are willing to form a group based on honesty, responsibility, and solidarity.

The group carries the name of the neighborhood which is located in one of the poorest parts of the city. In spite of the poor economic conditions in their neighborhood, these women get by due to their group activities, as they are well-known as excellent workers.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

Para la formación de este comité contactamos con la Sra. Saturnina C. madre de 4 hijos, quien se dedica a la venta de carnes para solventar los gastos de su casa, dicha señora es muy conocida por los vecinos D. barrio Dios Padre Misericordioso llegando así a juntar a las demás integrantes D. grupo, algunas tienen despensas, venta de frutas, venta de ropas, venta de lencerías, venta de comidas típicas entre otros. Todas están muy interesadas sobre el programa COMITE DE MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS, y están dispuestas a formar un grupo, basado en la honestidad, la responsabilidad y sobre todo la solidaridad.

El grupo lleva el nombre D. barrio y el mismo está ubicado en una de las zonas más precarias de la ciudad. A pesar de la escasez laboral en el lugar estas señoras sobresalen con las actividades que realizan en grupo, llevando la calificación de excelentes trabajadoras.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing, lingerie, necklaces, bracelets, sugar, oil, milk, baked goods, meat, fruit, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Shavkatjon

texts.en: H. Shavkatjon is 41 years old. He is married and has five children. Due to the lack of employment options in his country, it was difficult for Shavkatjon to find work and financially support his family. Therefore, 12 years ago, he decided to start his own business selling men's shoes. Shavkatjon has been receiving financial help through IMON for the past 3 years, and it has helped his business grow. Little by little, Shavkatjon has been able to expand his inventory and, thanks to the good service he offers, his business is now growing rapidly. Currently, however, Shavkatjon needs a loan of US$1,000 which he will use to buy additional merchandise to meet the demand of his clients and to continue expanding his sales business. Shavkatjon is committed to paying back the loan within 9 months. Throughout his career, he has acquired such qualities as perseverance and stamina, and they will also now help him succeed in repaying the loan on time.

loans.use: Purchase of new men's shoes for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy sugar, rice, flour, oil, soap, toilet paper, condensed milk, eggs

loans.name: Olga Maria

texts.es: La señora Olga Maria R. Cortéz habita en el barrio América uno, barrio ubicado en la capital de Managua, tiene 55  años de edad, se encuentra soltera, vive  con sus tres hijos de 20,25 y 30 años de edad, los cuales están trabajando. Actualmente la señora Olga se desempeña como enfermera del centro de salud de Tipitapa, tiene 6 meses de estar trabajando para este centro, donde en un futuro desea poder encontrar un mejor empleo donde pueda ganar un mejor salario, para seguir apoyando a su familia y a darle una mejor estabilidad económica, por tanto la señora Olga desea seguir trabajando con micro créditos de manera que poco a poco pueda ir mejorando la casa donde ella habita, ya que  por el momento requiere de un financiamiento de C$ 10,000 aun plazo de 12 meses para cambiar el techo de su casa.
texts.en:
Señora Olga Maria R. Cortéz lives in the neighborhood América, located in the capital of Managua. She is 55 years of age, single, and lives with her three children, who are 20, 25, and 30 years of age and all working. Presently Señora Olga is working as a nurse at the health center in Tipitapa; she has been working for six months in this center, where in the future she desires to be able to come across a better job in which she can earn a better salary to continue supporting her family and giving them better economic stability. Señora Olga wants to continue working with micro loans so that little by little she can go about improving the house where she lives, and at the moment she requires financing for C$ 10,000 (Córdoba, currency of Nicaragua) to fix her roof, which she will pay back in twelve months.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Change the roof of her house.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 40 year-old-man who lives in Nabatieh, in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. He has been a blacksmith for seven years. He has requested a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase an electric generator.

Hassan is known for the quality of his work. He installs iron doors and windows. His clients are his friends, neighbors, and others. 

While work, he faced some difficulties because he had an accident in which he broke his leg.  As a result, his work was slower, which made him unable to handle big projects. Despite his accident, he has always been motivated. In the future, he intends to buy a bigger generator and small machinery to improve his business.

loans.use: Hassan needs the loan to purchase an electric generator

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en:
Abibatu U. has a machine that she uses to grind cereal. She also sells foodstuffs like rice, beans, plantains, etc. She makes more profits from the sales of foodstuffs. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. 

She is 36 years old and married with three children. 

She says a big thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. is fifty-six years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, one male and four females. She says four of her children are out of school and are working. Currently, her last one is in junior high school. Her husband works with the national fire service.

Grace runs a ‘chop bar’ (restaurant) in her locality. She sells ‘banku’ and ‘fufu’. Banku is prepared from corn dough. Fufu is another local food made from cooked and pounded cassava. Both dishes are served hot with soup. She lives with her family in Konongo in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. She buys bags of rice and maize from Kumasi.

Grace has been in business for over fifteen years. She wants to buy bags of rice and maize on a large scale so that she can cut down on cost, and on frequent trips to procure goods.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and maize

loans.name: Nov

texts.en:
P., 27, earns a living selling firewood from his house.  He usually carves wood from the forest and also purchases from a wholesale supplier. 

He is married with one young child.  His wife's name is Kunthea, 22, and she is a local rice farmer.  She also relies on both seasons for growing rice, including the dry season and rainy season.  

In view of the fact that rice farming is an important source of income for the family's needs and that the dry season is coming, P. and Kunthea have applied for a loan to buy another plot of farmland for growing rice in the dry season. 

They both are people living in Pursat Province.

loans.use: To buy another plot of farmland for growing rice in the dry season

loans.name: Hoy

texts.en: K., 29, owns a battery-powered machine (battery AA) recharged in her family's land in the Siem Reap Province. She has been in this business for more than four years and runs it very well. To help add more income to the family, K. owns a grocery store, and she is noted for her service. Yun, 32, is K.’s husband; he owns a medium vehicle used as a dump truck. The family has three children, all of whom are single and attending school. Now, K. wants to increase her income to provide for her family’s expenses. Thus, K. is requesting a loan of $400 to buy more grocery products and to renovate her grocery shop. K. was not available during the photograph, so her husband is shown instead.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products and to renovate her grocery shop

loans.name: Mahmaradjab

texts.ru: Клиент Бабиев Махмараджаб, проживающий в районе А_Чоми, клиенту 51 год.Женат имеет 6 детей, образование высшее. Сам клиент занимается животноводствам уже более 22 лет у него имеется несколько бычков.На полученные деньгт, клиент хочет купить несколько молодых телят, с дольнейшей перепродажи.
texts.en:
Mahmaradjab B. is a client who lives in the A-Chomi region, he is 51 years old. He is married and has six children. He has high education. He has been doing animal husbandry for more than 22 years and has several calves. He will use the loan money to buy a few more young calves for future resale.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Celedonia

texts.es:
La socia CELEDONIA; es natural del distrito de Calca, en la provincia de Urubamba, nuestra socia tiene 49 años de edad es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo de 20 años. 

Nuestra socia Celedonia, alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio de venta de abarrotes, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, para lo cual requiere el préstamo para su debida implementación, y de este modo seguir apoyando en los estudios superiores de su hijo.

La socia valora y agradece el apoyo otorgado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de la deuda en el tiempo programado.
texts.en:
The partner CELEDONIA is native of the district of Calca, in the province of Urubamba. Our partner is 49 years old, she is a single mother of a 20-year-old son. Our partner Celedonia, alternates her domestic activities with selling groceries. She has a small grocery store, for this reason she needs the loan for its due set up, and this way to keep on supporting her son with his studies. The partner values and is grateful for the support granted by all the kiva members and she promises to repay the loan in time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products to set up her grocery store.

loans.name: Afi Enyonam

texts.fr: Madame est une femme mariée qui vit dans le quartier d’agoè Zongo. Elle a commencé en 2002 le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale. Elle a ouvert une boutique qui s’appelle « ALLIANCE BOUTIQUE » dans laquelle elle exerce son activité. Elle est une fidèle cliente de WAGES  qui a déjà obtenu 02 crédits qu’elle a remboursé. Son stock de marchandises étant épuisé, elle sollicite son troisième crédit pour acheter 15 cartons de tomates en boîte, 10 bidons d’huile, 03 cartons de lait, 05 cartons de produits congelés. Elle est mariée à un monsieur qui est déclarant en douane, elle a 02 enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. K. is a married woman who lives in the Agoè Zongo neighborhood. She began selling groceries in 2002. She opened a little shop for this purpose that she calls « ALLIANCE BOUTIQUE ». She is a faithful client of WAGES who has already had 2 loans which she has reimbursed. Her stock of merchandise is expended so she is requesting her third loan to buy 15 cases of tinned tomatoes, 10 jerrycans of oil, 3 cases of milk, and 5 cases of frozen foods. She is married to a gentleman who is a customs officer, and she has 2 children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of groceries for re-sale

loans.name: Nidia Isabel

texts.es: Nidia Isabel H. V. tiene la edad de 45 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Nidia tiene 2 hijos y todos trabajan. La actividad económica de Nidia es venta de repostería y comida. Hace más de 12 años que se dedica a este negocio. Doña Nidia inicio este negocio porque no tenía un medio de supervivencia, y con este trabajo logro salir adelante, y además le gusto realizar este tipo actividad. El principal propósito de Nidia es de incrementar las ventas de su repostería y comida. El financiamiento que solicita Doña Nidia es para la compra de arroz, frijoles, aceite, huevos, harina, mantequilla, pollo y carne de res. Los deseos de Nidia son de que su negocio logre tener suficientes clientes para continuar con este negocio.
texts.en:
Nidia Isabel H. V. is 45 years of age. She is married, has two children and all of them work. Nidia's economic activity is selling pastries and meals. She's been engaged in this business for more than twelve years. Doña Nidia started this business because she had no means of survival and this work was a way to get ahead. She also enjoys this sort of activity. Nidia's main purpose is to increase her sales of pastries and meals. The financing which she is requesting is for the purchase of rice, beans, cooking oil, eggs, flour, butter, chicken and beef. Nidia hopes that her business will be able to have enough customers so that she can continue with this business.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Ziada

texts.en: Ziada is a rice seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya. She belongs to Kilimahewa 1 group.  She works at her business daily.  She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can  buy more rice for resale. She is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  Ziada is married and has six children ages 30, 27, 25, 20, and 18.

loans.use: To buy more rice for resale.

loans.name: Kudratullo

texts.ru: Кудратулло Самадов проживает в районе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 30 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Кароматулло более 9 лет занимается животноводством, он откармливает и продает крупно рогатый скот. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы закупить крупно рогатый скот для откармливания и продажи.
texts.en:
Kudratullo S. lives in Kurgan-Tube region. He is 30 years old, married, and has three children. Karomatullo has over nine years of experience in animal husbandry, raising and selling cattle. He is requesting a loan to buy cattle which he will feed and sell.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene S. is from the village of Danao. She is 30 years old, is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Irene owns & operates a fishing business; the main source of income comes from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Irene has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Irene joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Irene repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC, which she used to to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets. Irene is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to expand the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Irene from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of  her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Esther Olubunmi

texts.en: Esther Olubunmi is 43 and is married with 2 children. She sells good-condition used books. She is requesting a loan of N100, 000 to purchase more books to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more used books to sell

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.en:
B. Nazokat is 37 years old. She is married and has two children. Nazokat has been running a grocery store for the past 12 years. She sells sweets, sugar, preserved food, juices, soft drinks and also different kinds of toys for children. The inventory she has for sale is of very good quality and selection. Nazokat is respectful and patient with all of her customers, which attracts people and brings them back to her vending facility to buy groceries again. Nazokat is seeking to keep her business sustainable and has requested a loan of 4700 Somoni to increase the inventory she has for sale. We believe this current loan will enhance the potential of her business and help Nazokat reach all of her aspirations.         


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Edda Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Edda del Socorro S. de 55 años de edad, es una mujer de “Armas tomar”, según nos describe ella misma. No desaprovecha una oportunidad para iniciar un negocio y sacarle mucho beneficio. Edda trabaja en la venta de Ropa por encargos, actualmente distribuye la misma en un sector más amplio como lo es el Bo. Camilo Ortega y  el Bo. Loma Linda, pero pretende ampliar aun más su clientela. Y esto lo lograra a través de los créditos que ADIM le proporcione.

Edda a trabajado en créditos con grupos solidarios, y este es su 4 ciclo en créditos individuales, afirma estar muy agradecida por qué ADIM, ha sabido apreciar su potencial de comerciante y le ha facilitado créditos para la mejora de su negocio.

Edda lleva ya 20 años en el negocio, y éste para ella ha sido exitoso, con el ha podido criar a sus hijos y garantizarles un nivel de vida mejor al que ella tuvo cuando era niña. Su mayor anhelo es que sus hijos la superen en cuanto al desempeño en los negocios y puedan establecer su propia empresa. Sueño que piensa ver cumplido con prontitud.
texts.en:
Doña Edda del Socorro S. is 55 years old. She is a woman who “doesn’t mess around,” as she describes herself. She didn’t waste the opportunity to start a business and has now reaped the rewards. Edda sells clothing to order and currently distributes her merchandise in larger neighborhoods such as Camilo Ortega and Loma Linda. She hopes to expand her customer base and is seeking the assistance of a loan through ADIM.

Edda has previously worked with solidarity group loans, but this will be her 4th individual loan. She is grateful to ADIM because, without the help of her loans, she would not be able to grow as an entrepreneur and improve her business.

Edda has successfully managed her business for the past 20 years. She was able to raise her children and provide them a standard of living that was better than what she experienced as a child. Her greatest wish is that her children can overcome all obstacles so that they can establish their own businesses. She dreams that her wishes come true quickly.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise requested by her customers

loans.name: Faridah's Group

texts.en:
B. Faridah is the leader of her lending group in Jinja. She is 30 years old and married with four children aged 14 to 3 years. All her children are in primary school and she would like to educate them until university so that they can become self-reliant.

Faridah owns a restaurant in Ivunamba where, for six years now, she has prepared all kinds of foodstuffs and various kinds of sauce. She is able to make 70,000/= as weekly profits and these, together with her husband’s additions, help to run her home plus pay her children’s school fees.

Faridah has a dream of growing her restaurant into a bigger one so that she will be able to make more profits and employ more people. She needs a loan to be able to buy more foodstuffs for her restaurant’s expansion.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for her restaurant

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Née vers 1969 à Koutiala, Madame Fatoumata Fané  est mariée mère de 8 enfants et   vit avec son époux et ses  enfants dans le quartier  Koko  de la préfecture  de Koutiala (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Dû à des raisons sociales, Fatoumata a prématurément abandonné les études  pour s’intéresser  aux activités génératrices de revenus  auprès de sa maman  commerçante import  export depuis son enfance. La  vente de tissus et chaussures   son ses activités principales, elle l’exerce depuis  15 ans. Sa notoriété est bonne car elle ravitaille beaucoup de petits détaillants au grand marché de Koutiala.  
Dans le souci d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et satisfaire sa clientèle en quantité et en qualité, elle n’a pas pris du temps pour faire recours à l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso. Après une année de collaboration,  elle est à son 2ème  prêt individuel, le précédent a été correctement payé sans difficulté.  
Avec ce financement elle compte acheter, 50 paires de chaussures et 10 pièces de tissus wax au Nigeria . Elle effectue sa vente au grand  marché de Koutiala à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes, au comptant ou à crédit.  
Avec l’augmentation de son chiffre d’affaire, elle compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de 100.000 FCFA  qu’elle envisage utiliser pour le remboursement des taux d’intérêts de Soro Yiriwaso,  participer aux  dépenses quotidiennes  de la famille et investir le reste dans son activité.

loans.use: Achat de  tissus et chaussures.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose A. is married and has four children. She has received schooling through to senior high school level. Rose sells second hand clothing at Elmina near Atabadze, which she has been doing since 2000. Her husband is a trader. Rose uses her income to support her husband in the upkeep of the family. Rose will use the loan to purchase more second hand clothing to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rose plans to save to further her children's education.

loans.use: Rose will use the loan to purchase more second hand clothing to sell.

loans.name: The Rain Group

texts.es:
El grupo lluvia esta conformado por tres mujeres seccionales que han trabajado arduamente por su familias. Una de ellas es la señora Lorena del Socorro C. de 37 años que  desde el año 2000 vende tortillas con las cuales se ayuda para educar a sus 5 hijos todos en edad escolar. C. ocupara el préstamo  para comprar leña y maíz.

Flor de María U. de 40 años vende choco bananos, helados, hielo y lo que más desea es seguir adelante. Martha Lorena M. de treinta años desde hace tres años que tiene un cafetín y ocupara el préstamo para invertirlo en productos como café, gaseosa, chiverías y comidas rápidas.
texts.en:
The Rain Group consists of three local women who work hard for their families. One of them is Sra. Lorena del Socorro C., who is 37 years old and has been selling tortillas since 2000. Her income helps pay the education expenses of her 5 children. Lorena will use her loan to buy firewood and corn.

Flor de María U. is 40 years old and sells chocolate-covered bananas, ice cream, and ice. Her greatest hope is to succeed in her business. Martha Lorena M. is 30 years old and has been operating a cafeteria for three years. She will use her loan to buy products such as coffee, sodas, yogurt, and convenience foods.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & supplies for their respective businesses

loans.name: Women Of Faith Group

texts.en:
Nohn G. is a leader of a group of five borrowers called "Women of Faith." She is 37 years old and married with the children, ages 9 to 16 years old. Their educational levels range from 1st to 8th grade. Nohn also cares for her two brothers–in- law. She dropped out of school in 8th grade due to early childbirth and poverty. She thought it wise to get into business.

Nohn and her family live and work in the Barnesville Estate north of Monrovia, the capital of Liberia. She sells consumer goods. She buys the goods, such as pepper, bread, and oil from wholesalers and sells them at retail prices sells to the residents of Barnesville Estate. She also makes soap.

She has been running this business for 10 years and hopes to improve her shop. Nohn talks to her customers politely and sometimes extends credit to customers when they don’t have money. This encourages customers to continue patronizing her business. She started selling dry meat from rural Liberia with LD$1500.00, which was given to her by her sister. 

She needs this loan to purchase flour, oil, seasonings, and some sodas for making soap so that she can serve her customers. Nohn dreams of giving her children and other family members a better education.

loans.use: To purchase flour, oil, seasonings, and soda for making soap

loans.name: Avon Group

texts.es: María Catalina M. A., Ninet Carolina B., Jahaira Aracelly L. H. y  Daysi María
texts.en: María Catalina M. A., Ninet Carolina B., Jahaira Aracelly L. H. and  Daysi María

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Banquito Nueva Alianza Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL “BANQUITO NUEVA ALIANZA”

Delia es una socia de la alcancía comunal “Banquito Nueva Alianza” llamada así no solo porque sus miembros viven en la misma zona, sino también porque buscan conocerse mejor, dar oportunidades y compartir experiencia. “Desde pequeño he enseñado a mis hijos a esforzarse, ya que si algo llega fácil, entonces fácil también se va”.

Apenas Delia acabó el colegio, empezó a ayudar a su tío en el aparado de calzado, fue ahí donde aprendió el oficio del aparado y reparación de calzado, pero era algo que a su corta edad, le parecía muy cansado, entonces decidió ayudar a una señora, amiga de la familia, en la venta de productos de belleza, cosméticos de marcas conocidas, pasaron los años Delia ya con una pareja estable decidieron tener hijos, fue así que Delia se convirtió en madre de dos hijos, entonces Delia tomo la decisión de independizarse, fue así que se inscribió para ser vendedora de productos de belleza ahora ya tiene 10 años dedicada a ese negocio, y en la actualidad gracias al asesoramiento de su tío y con la ayuda de su pareja Delia abrió en su casa uno espacio para el aparado y reparación de calzado, ella se ha dedicado mucho a sus trabajos, y agradece que gracias a ellos ha podido darle la educación a sus hijos y arreglar su casa.
Con el nuevo préstamo Delia planea invertirlo en la compra de productos de belleza ya que es su negocio mas rentable.
Ella sueña con tener su hogar en completa armonía, estar más unida a su familia.
texts.en:
Delia is a member of the Communal Bank “Banquito Nueva Alianza” (New Alliance Bank), which is so named not only because the members live in the same area, but also because they seek to know each other better, provide opportunities for one another, and share their experiences with each other. She says, “Since they were little, I’ve taught my children to try hard because if something becomes easy, then anything can be made easy also.”

As soon as she completed high school, Delia started helping her uncle in his shoe workshop, where she learned the trade of manufacturing and repairing shoes. However Delia grew tired of this work at her young age, so she decided to help a female friend of the family sell a well-known brand of beauty products. After a few years passed, Delia and her steady boyfriend decided to have children. She became a mother of two and then decided to become independent. Delia signed up to be a sales representative of beauty products and has been in this business now for 10 years. Thanks to the to the advice of her uncle and the help of her boyfriend, she opened a space in her house for manufacturing and repairing shoes. Delia dedicates most of her time to both of her businesses, which enabled her to provide for her children’s education and remodel her home.

With this new loan, Delia plans to purchase beauty products since this particular business is more profitable. She dreams of having a household in complete harmony so that her family becomes closer.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Perfecto Socorro Ramos Meza

texts.es:
El señor Perfecto Socorro R. M. trabaja como guarda de seguridad desde hace 14 años, su estado civil es acompañado con 3 personas a cargo. Su esposa es operaria de la zona franca las mercedes.

Ha construido un buen record crediticio en CEPRODEL, cuyos créditos los ha utilizado para consumo personal, compra de vivienda y mejora de vivienda este último.

Agradece a CEPRODEL por brindarle apoyo y por el acompañamiento en todos estos años para mejorar su forma de vida de él y de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Perfecto Socorro R. M. has worked as a security guard for some 14 years. He lives with his partner and 3 other people that he is responsible for. His wife works for the Mercedes "duty-free" zone.

He has a good loan record with CEPRODEL (Kiva’s field partner), and the loans have been used for his personal use, to buy a home and to better his home with his last loan.

He is grateful to CEPRODEL for supporting him and helping him in all of these years to better his standard of living and that of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To better his home.

loans.name: Los Autenticos Group

texts.es: El grupo “Los Auténticos” están representados por la señora Eva y conformado por 10 miembros los cuales tienen sus negocios establecidos en la misma zona pero con una diversificación D. negocios como la costura D. prendas D. vestir, venta D. comida al paso como empanadas con refresco y tucumanas otras se dedican a la venta D. plantas, abonos, al servicio D. jardinería y al transporte público D. pasajeros. Dentro del mercado comercial existe un alto nivel competitivo, pero lo que marca la diferencia es que las socias del grupo ya tienen clientes fieles y ofertan productos D. buena calidad para no quedar mal con sus clientes. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición y mejoramiento D. sus herramientas D. trabajo como llantas nuevas para sus vehículos, retapizados D. asientos y para la adquisición D. mercadería para su venta. En cuanto a la experiencia varios miembros del grupo trabajaron en grupos anteriores y se unieron para seguir trabajando bajo esta modalidad y crecer en sus negocios para poder brindarles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
The group “Los Auténticos” (The Authentic Ones) is led by Sra. Eva and consists of 10 members who have established their business in the same area. However, they are engaged in a variety of activities such as sewing garments and selling food to passersby (including empanadas and soft drinks). Others sell plants and compost or proviD. services, such as gardening and public transportation. Within the commercial markets, there is a high level of competition. What makes the difference, however, is that the group members already have loyal customers and offer high quality products so that they do not lose face with them.

This loan will be used to acquire and improve their equipment needed for work, such as new tires for their vehicles and reupholstered seats. They will also purchase merchandise to sell. Regarding their previous credit experience, several members have worked before in solidarity groups. They have joined together to continue working in this manner and growing their businesses in order to proviD. their families with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Kemisa

texts.en: Kemisa is a Nairobi-based businesswoman who runs a salon in the Kibera area. Operating in a good business environment since 1985, Kemisa has carved her own market in Kibera and says that her customers are reliable. She is requesting a loan of Kes. 30,000 to buy equipment for her salon. A mother to four teenagers, Kemisa hopes to own land and houses, enlarge the business, employ many and educate children. She describes herself as hardworking, dependable and responsible.

loans.use: Buy equipment for the salon

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred M. is a married man and an entrepreneur. He runs a business buying and selling goats and sheep at Vingunguti ward in Dar es Salaam. He purchases the goats and sheep from the auctions and wholesale suppliers and sells to retail customers for slaughtering as well as to meat suppliers.

Alfred has been in the business for three years and the business income generated helped him to buy a plot of land for house construction and provide business capitalization.

Alfred is requesting a loan of TZS 1,000,000 to boost his business.

loans.use: To boost his business

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Madame Fatou G. est une femme mariée âgée de 40 ans avec un bébé de 6 mois.  Elle est couturière commerçante depuis 10 ans et  elle est soutenue par son mari dans son activité. 
 En plus des tissus qu’elle vend, elle confectionne des habits destinés également à la vente. Après 2 prêts octroyés par la caisse Jammi Xaleyi de U-IMCEC Thiès qu’elle a réglés sans difficultés avant même la fin de l’échéance, Madame G.  souhaitait un nouveau  prêt de 450 000 FCFA pour renforcer son activité. 
Avec cette somme, elle va acheter des tissus thioupes (indigo) venant du  Mali pour les besoins de son business. Elle écoule ses produits le plus souvent à Rufisque dans la région de Dakar et à Mbour une ville située à une centaine de kilomètres de Thiès où elle compte pas mal de clients.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatou G. is married, 40 years old with a six-month-old baby. She has been a professional seamstress for 10 years, and is assisted by her husband in her business. In addition to the fabric she sells, she also tailors clothes for sale. Mrs. G. was granted two loans by the Jammi Xaleyi branch of U-IMCEC in Thiès, and repaid them both without problems and even sooner than scheduled. She is now requesting a new loan of 450,000 FCFA to strengthen her business. This loan will serve to buy ‘thioupe’ pieces of fabric (indigo) from Mali that she needs for her business. She sells her products mainly in Rufisque, in the Dakar region, and also in Mbour, a town located 100 kilometers from Thiès, where she has quite a few customers.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric for retail business

loans.name: Unidas Triunfaremos Group

texts.es:
La señora Antonieta, con sus 60 años es D. apariencia rígida y dura, su historia es conmovedora la dureza que refleja su rostro solo esconD. un gran corazón, ella cuenta que antes no trabajaba por  que su esposo no lo permitía. Tiene 2 hijos  mayores D. 35 y 25 años lamentablemente uno D. ellos dejo el país por motivos D. trabajo y  esto la entristeció mucho a punto D. enfermarse y caer en depresión. Fue una amiga que la anima a vender productos D. belleza y así empieza en este negocio, al principio  por entretenerse en algo, pero hace 2 años empezó con mucha dedicación ya que vio que era muy rentable y sobretodo el echo D. estar ocupada la ayudo a superar en parte la ausencia D. su hijo. 
Una vecina le hablo sobre EDAPROSPO y se animo a formar el grupo “UNIDAS TRIUNFAREMOS” todas  amigas del barrio la Sra.Antonieta es la presidenta, es su  carácter la que la ayuda a  llevar su grupo adelante, por otro lado le va muy bien en su negocio y tiene mucha clientela. A pesar del desanimo D. su esposo ella sigue adelante y no se amilana  tiene proyectos que desea cumplir como tener su propia tienda donD. pueda mostrar sus productos D. belleza, con el dinero que D. su actual préstamo comprara  mercadería en productos D. belleza para vender ya  que tiene  pedidos pendientes.
 Antonieta aun tiene sueños por cumplir y sabe que mantenerse ocupada no solo la ayuda a superar la ausencia D. su hijo sino que pueD. ganarse la vida y demostrar que la edad no es un impedimento para seguir trabajando.

*lA Sra. Antonieta es la primera aparece sentada con blusa floreada.
texts.en:
Antonieta, 60, has a hard and rigid appearance. Her story, however, is touching and the harshness of her expression only masks her great heart. She tells us that she didn’t used to work because her husband wouldn’t permit her to. She has two adult children, a 35- and a 25-year-old. Unfortunately, one of them left the country to look for work and this saddened her very much to the point of becoming ill and depressed. A friend of hers motivated her to sell beauty products and this is how she started her business. At the beginning, it was just to have something to do that would keep her mind occupied. However, two years ago she started to really become dedicated to it when she saw how profitable it could be but, above all, being busy helped her to partly overcome her son’s absence. A neighbor in town told her about EDAPROSPO and motivated her to join the “UNIDAS TRIUNFAREMOS” (Together We Will Succeed) group. All the members are from the neighborhood and Antonieta is the group president. Her strong character makes it possible for her to lead the group. On the other hand, she does well with her business and she has many customers. Despite her husband’s lack of enthusiasm for her work, she continues ahead and doesn’t become discouraged; she has projects to meet, like having her own store in which to display her beauty products. With the funds from this loan she will buy beauty products merchandise because she has several pending orders to fill. Antonieta still has dreams to fulfill and knows that she must keep busy, not only to overcome her son’s absence, but to earn a livelihood and show that age need not be a barrier to continue working. *Antonieta is seated in front wearing the flowered blouse.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Esperanca Jose

texts.pt:
Esperança José N. nasceu no Distrito de Chibuto, Província de Gaza, Sul de Moçambique tem 47 anos de idade, separada e mãe de 2 filhos de 29 e 21 anos de idade, já não estudam. Fez somente 3ą classe não continuou por falta de condições financeiras, porque perdeu o pai muito jovem. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu de Gaza para Maputo com a mãe depois de perder o pai. Tem um negócio próprio desde a sua juventude, não possui nenhum empregado e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 6.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua casa, porque não possui conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de sua irmã. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar (fardos de roupa usada para crianças) para aumentar a quantidade de sua mercadoria.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro, gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar na melhoria da sua casa.
texts.en:
Esperança José was born in the District of Chibuto, in the Gaza Province, South of Mozambique. She is 47 years old, separated and mother of two children who are 29 and 21 years old. They are no longer in school. She only completed 3rd grade and didn't finish school due to the lack of financial resources since her father died when she was very young. She lives in her own house with her children and doesn't support anyone else. She left Gaza to go to Maputo with her mother after she lost her father. She has had her own business since her youth and does not have any employees. She has an income of around 6.000.00mt, which she spends with household expenses and saves some on her own since she does not have a bank account. She has never had loans from other banks. She came to know about Hluvuku through her sister. This is her first loan, in the amount of 15.000.00mt. She intends to purchase used children's clothing in bulk to increase her inventory. She is committed to paying this loan on time in order to be able to request other loans. In the future, she would like to request more loans for improvements in her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of used children's clothing in bulk

loans.name: Bakirova`s Group

texts.ru:
Токтогул,60, вдова. У нее 5 детей; 4 дочери и 1 сын. Все взрослые и живут отдельно. Клиент занимается животноводством: разведением и откормом скота. До распада СССР она работала в колхозе дояркой. После распада начала заниматься этим делом самостоятельно. Кредит будет потрачен для закупа коров. 

Анаркан 71 лет. Она также как и предыдущий участник группы вдова. Она проживает вместе с внуком. Вместе с внуком она содержит маленькое домашнее хозяйство. Ежемесячная прибыль от животноводства составляет около 45 долларов. Кредит будет использован для закупа овец, которые будут переправлены на пастбище. 

Темиржан, 55, женат. У него 5 детей: сыновьям 32 и 28 лет. Дочерям 27, 25 и 20. Вместе с супругой они разводят скот на протяжении 5 лет. Он тоже планирует закупить скот на полученный кредит. На фотографии также снялась супруга Темиржана.

Майрамкан 54 года. Ее супруг занимается пассажирскими перевозками. У нее 7 детей. На кредит она планирует закупить овец для откорма.


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Toktogul is 60 years old, a widow. She has 5 children: 4 daughters and 1 son. All of them are grown and live separately. The client is involved in animal husbandry: breeding and fattening of livestock. Prior to the breakup of the USSR, Toktogul worked as a milkmaid at a collective farm. Then, she started to run this business on her own. The loan will be used to buy cows. Anarkan is 71 years old. Just like the previous group participant, she is a widow. She lives with her grandson. Together, they run a small home business. The monthly income from animal husbandry is about 45 dollars. The loan will be used for the purchase of sheep that will be sent off to a pasture. Temirjan is 55 years, married. He has 5 children: the sons are 32 and 28 years old, and the daughters are 27, 25 and 20. Together with his wife, Temirjan have been breeding livestock for 5 years. He also plans to buy livestock, using this loan. The photograph also shows Temirjan’s wife. Mayramkan is 54 years old. Her husband is involved in passenger transportation. She has 7 children. She plans to use the loan to buy sheep for fattening.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cows

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda E. is from the village of Baliangao. She is 30 years old, married, and has two school-age children. To make a living, Belinda is engaged in the agricultural sector, specializing in hog raising. Through this activity she is able to earn a monthly income of 3,400 PHP. 

In 2008, Belinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Belinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Belinda is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for hog raising. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Belinda from PMPC. 

About PMPC:  Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for hog raising

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina P. sells provisions in front of her house in Takoradi. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a welder. She has received junior high education. Faustina uses her income to help her husband with the general upkeep of their home. Faustina will use this loan to purchase more groceries to sell. Faustina plans to save the new profits from her expanded business to build a shop.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Seydou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Seydou B. est un homme marié de 31 ans et père de 2 enfant. Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni (préfecture de Bougouni,  troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Très tôt, Monsieur Seydou B. a abandonné l’école pour mener  les activités économiques notamment l’achat et la vente de bicyclettes.
Il a appris cette activité dès son jeune âge avec son cousin.
Avec une expérience de 8 ans, Monsieur Seydou Bagayogo maitrise parfaitement son activité.
 Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali). La vente de ses bicyclettes se fait au marché de Bougouni. Sa clientèle est composée de la population locale.
Afin de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle, Monsieur Seydou B. décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso, afin d’acheter 15 bicyclettes.
Monsieur Seydou B. vend ses bicyclettes au comptant ou à crédit. Il est beaucoup sollicité à la rentrée des classes car chaque enfant veut avoir une bicyclette.
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Seydou compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de120 000FCFA.
Avec ce bénéfice, il compte agrandir son entreprise et  assurer les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Seydou B. is a 31-year-old married father of two. He lives with his wife and children in the Torakabougou neighborhood of the city of Bougouni (Bougouni prefecture in Sikasso, the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Mr. B. left school early to go into business, primarily buying and selling bicycles. He learned the business at a young age from his cousin. With 8 years of experience, he has become an expert at his business. He buys his stock in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali) and sells his bicycles in the market in Bougouni. His customer base is made up of local residents. To satisfy his customers’ needs, Mr. Seydou B. decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso in order to purchase 15 bicycles. Mr. B. sells his bicycles on a cash or credit basis. He has very high demand at the beginning of the school year, since every child wants a bicycle. With this loan, he expects to make a monthly profit of 120,000 FCFA (West African CFA francs). With this income, he hopes to expand his business and pay his family’s expenses.

Translated from French by Rachel Braff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bicycles for resale

loans.name: Tiana

texts.en:
Tiana A. is 57 and married with 8 children.  She owns a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale.  Tiana has 1 year of experience in this business.  Tiana needs a loan of WST$1000 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 150 talas or US $63 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Tiana joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD.  SPBD's loans are Tiana's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase a wheelbarrow, spade, nails, wire fence and galloon for water storage

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.en: A. Jamshed is 20 years old and is not married. Due to his family’s financial situation, he did not have many opportunities to study at the university. That’s why, after finishing school, he tried to become independent and to find a way of earning in order to help his parents with the family’s expenses. Since 2006, Jamshed has supported his family through his efforts. Through the years, he tried various types of activities and finally, four years ago, he started his business selling cellphones. He believes that this business is profitable and the generated income allows him to support his family. Currently, his business is doing well, but Jamshed needs to increase his stock of goods in order to serve the demands of his clientele. With this purpose in mind, Jamshed requests 10,000 Somoni. He is grateful to all those supporting him and promises to repay the loan promptly. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase more cellphones to sell

loans.name: Bhagabati

texts.en:
This is 40 year-old Bhagabati T.. She is married and has 10 children, three sons and seven daughters. In 2006, she established her agricultural farming business. Working 7 days a week and 6 hours a day, she supports her family.

She will use her loan to buys seeds and fertilizers for her work. In the future, Bhagabati plans to improve the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a BPW loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase more seed and fertilizer and to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

This loan was administered by BPW's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Brigite

texts.en: Brigite is married to a farmer. She has five children who are between 6 months and 14 years old. They are all in school, apart from the 6 month old child. She has a small store where she sells household items. She also owns and operates a milling machine to grind grains and vegetables grown locally. She is requesting a loan to increase her inventory of household items for her store. She eventually hopes to carry a wider variety of goods in her store to meet her clients' needs.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of household items to sell.

loans.name: Mwamini

texts.en:
Mwamini is 44 years old, married with four children.  Mwamini is widely known in the business of selling different styles of clothes.  She has been in this business for about 13 years and her business hours are from 7 am until 7 pm every day.

Mwamini needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, Mwamini will expand her business through purchasing more styles of clothes which will mainly include styles for young people because these styles are highly demanded.  With this additional clothing for sale, Mwamini will hopefully earn more profits and these profits will allow her to keep reinvesting for a better financial stability in the future.

loans.use: buying different of clothes for sale

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
