She will use this loan to invest in her business selling groceries, drinks and foodstuffs at retail prices. She is a hard working woman and she is determined to excel in her business and family life. She hopes that this loan will help her build a business that will be profitable and provide benefits for her 5 children.

She hopes for a loan amount N70,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Las Tranquilas Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Las Tranquilas está integrado por  Luz María U. M., Martha Avelleneth A. G. y Maryuri del Carmen M. E.. Ellas habitan en el barrio San Judas el cual se ha destacado por su religiosidad y beligerancia  por los derechos y las necesidades de sus pobladores.

Luz U. M. comercializa productos de limpieza de manera ambulante, Martha A. G. vende productos esquimos en su casa y Maryuri M. E. vende Cd y DVD de manera ambulante.
texts.en:
The group “Las Tranquilas” (The Quiet Ones) consists of El Grupo Las Tranquilas está integrado por Luz María U. M., Martha Avelleneth A. G. and Maryuri del Carmen M. E.. They lives in the neighborhood of San Judas, which is known for its religious and revolutionary struggles to gain basic rights and necessities for its residents. S Luz U. M. sells cleaning products as a street vendor. Martha A. G. sells Eskimo brand ice cream products out of her home. Maryuri M. E. sells CDs and DVDs as a street vendor.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Ericson Blanco Group

texts.en:
Ericson B. is from the village of Luna. He is 31 years old. Ericson is the group leader of an 11-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 'Ericson B.'.

Ericson is single and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Ericson owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling electronic load credits for mobile phones in the local community. Ericson has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Ericson joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ericson has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional load to retail. Ericson is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional load to retail. This will be the second loan taken out by Ericson from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly comprised of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional load to retail

loans.name: Munhbayar

texts.en:
Munhbayar operates a retail meat business in his town. Munhbayar delivers meat to local cafes for use in their food preparation. He also has individual customers who buy his meat on a regular basis. He began his business in 2000 and, after several years of operation, he has managed to establish himself in the business community.

Munhbayar is 37 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Arhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger (a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent). His oldest daughter attends the local secondary school and his wife helps with the meat trading business.

Munhbayar started with working capital of 300,000 tugrug (~ $210 US). Because of his business success, he has managed to improve their quality of life. Now his working capital exceeds 2,800,000 tugrugs (~ $2,000 US). He says, "I want to expand my business in the future and have my own working space." Munhbayar is requesting a 4,000,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase several cows which he will use for his meat business.

loans.use: To purchase several cows

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La señora Norma es socia del Banco Comunal “Brisas del Lago” desde hace 1 año, vive en el distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y  tiene 02 hijos. Ella estudió superior completa, se dedica a la compra y  venta de abrigos de alpaca.

Norma nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.

Ella requiere un crédito  de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar mas abrigos.

Su sueño para el futuro es agrandar su negocio y así poder vivir tranquila.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad de préstamos que ofrece y las charlas que imparte la promotora.
texts.en:
Norma has been a member of the "Brisas del Lago" Communal Bank for the past year. She lives in the district, province and department of Puno. She is 52 years old, married and has 2 children. She completed her high school education and works in the purchase and sale of alpaca wool coats. Norma says the with the first loan she requested from the Manuela Ramos Movement, which was for 500 new soles, she was able to increase her working capital. She now needs a loan for 1,000 new soles with which she will be able to buy more coats. Her dream for the future is to expand her business so as to be able to live peacefully. What she likes most about her communal bank is the access to loans and the talks that the promoters give.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy coats.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria C. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 49 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Gloria owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as cooking oil, soy sauce, candies, eggs, shampoo, soap, toothpaste and other items in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Gloria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her fifth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Donald Ricardo

texts.es:
El señor Donald Ricardo V. F., trabaja para la Alcaldía de Chinandega, se desempeña como Vigilante, tiene dos hijos ambos en edad escolar.

El señor Donald, es primera vez que solicita crédito con ceprodel, ya que tiene la necesidad de hacer unas reparaciones en su vivienda antes que llegue el invierno, por que su techo se pasa todo cuando llueve.
texts.en:
Donald Ricardo V. F. works for the mayor of Chinandega’s office. He works as a watchman. He has two school-age children. This is the first time that Donald has requested a loan from Ceprodel. He needs to make repairs on his house before winter comes because water comes in through the roof when it rains.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy zinc, cement, and paint

loans.name: Vidalia

texts.es:
La Sra. Vidalia G. R. se dedica  a la elaboración y venta de tirillas así como la venta de elotes cocidos, güirilas, y tamales dulce.

La Sra. Vidalia G. solicita un financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como es el maíz, cal, leña y elotes, ya que hoy en día están son más caros dichos productos y ella piensa mantener su negocio ya que es su fuente de ingreso.

Ella comenzó con dicho negocio cuando miro que había mucha demanda de este y poca oferta y desde entonces a diario se dedica a esta labor con la ayuda de sus hijas. Ha tenido este negocio desde hace 12 años y trabaja todos los días desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde, cabe señalar que siempre se a dedicado a este negocio.

La Sra. Vidalia G. espera que con el financiamiento que se le otorgue aumentar sus ventas e ir ampliando más su negocio de venta de tortillas así como la venta de elotes y tamales.

Vidalia G. es una mujer casada y tiene dos hijas de edad escolar las que le ayudan a diario en el negocio. 

Ella es el financiamiento numero 7 que ella tiene en un periodo de 4 años, los impacto de los financiamientos han sido positivos ya que le han ayudado a ir ampliando su negocio y también sus ingresos y de una u otra manera le a ayudado ha mejoras su nivel de vida
texts.en:
Vidalia G. R. makes a living making and selling popular regional dishes such as corn on the cob, maize pancakes and sweet tamales. She is requesting the loan to purchase ingredients such as corn, lime, firewood and sweetcorn because currently those products are expensive and she wants to stick with the business since it's her source of income. Vidalia started the business when she saw those kinds of products were in high demand, and since then she has dedicated herself daily to this work with the help of her daughters. She has had the business for 12 years and works every day from 5 a.m. to 3 p.m. She hopes that with the loan she can increase her sales and expand her business to include selling tortillas as she does with the corn and tamales. Vidalia is married and has two school-age children who help her with the business daily. This is her seventh loan over the past four years, and the financing has had a positive effect in helping her improve her business and her income, and in one way or another helped her improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients such as corn, lime, firewood and sweetcorn

loans.name: Guillermo Isaias

texts.es: El Sr. Guillermo tiene 42 años de edad el es conviviente tiene una hija de 16 años de edad, su conyugue se dedica como ama de casa, el cuenta con casa propia el cual esta en construccion, actualmente esta viviendo en la casa de sus suegros en Av. Aviacion distrito de la Tin guiña. El cuenta con el ingreso del alquiler de su vehiculo, lo adquirio, con ahorros producto de trabajao en la mina artesanal, actualmente tambien continua laborando en la mina, con el dinero que solicita invertira en compra de algunos articulos para la mina.
texts.en:
Guillermo is forty-two and has a common-law wife and sixteen-year-old daughter. His wife is a homemaker. He has his own house, which is under construction, so he currently lives with his in-laws in the Aviación Avenue District of La Tinguina. He brings in income by hiring out a vehicle that he bought with his savings from working at the artisanal [small-scale] mine. He still works there, and he plans to use his loan to buy some mining items.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in mining items

loans.name: Sherifat

texts.en:
Sherifat is into selling clothes and underwear. She wants to boost her business and so she is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more clothes and underwear to sell. She said buying in bulk will increase her earnings for the family upkeep.

Sherifat has been in business for four years now and, with the proceeds from the business, she is able to support her husband who sells wood for roofing houses to provide for his family’s needs.

Sherifat is 32 years old and has two children. She says thank you to Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and underwear to sell

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr: Monsieur Ousmane D. est un jeune couturier de 32 ans qui habite à Guediawaye. Il est membre de la caisse de CSP depuis 2005. Il a déjà rembourse 2 crédits antérieurs. Il est célibataire sans enfants. Depuis 7 ans déjà Monsieur D. évolue dans la couture et la vente d’habits confectionnes ou de prêt a porter. C’est un métier  qu’il a hérité  de son de père. Il emprunte 150 000 frs prévu  pour l’achat de tissus utilises pour la confection de ses habits  à vendre. L’objectif vise par Monsieur D. est de satisfaire sa clientèle dakaroise et gabonaise. Le crédit l’aide à soutenir son père et sa mère  dans la gestion des dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Mr Ousmane D. is a young tailor who is 32 years old and lives in Guediawaye. He has been a member of the CSP savings bank since 2005. He has already repaid two previous loans. He is single and has no children. For the past seven years Mr. D. has been developing his tailoring activity and selling custom made or ready-to-wear clothes. He inherited this trade from his father. he is borrowing 150,000 francs in order to buy fabric to make up the clothes that he will sell. The aim of Mr. D. is to satisfy his customers from Dakar and Gabon. The loan will help him to support his father and mother in the management of the family expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment

loans.name: Boye Guèye

texts.fr: Boye Guèye N. est une femme de 50 ans, Elle est célibataire avec 03 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de MONTAGNE NORD2 depuis le 29 mars 2008 et a 3 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit. C'est un membre très dynamique et plein d'ambition, en un an et demi elle a pu atteindre un encours d'épargne de 184.000 francs CFA. Cette épargne sera renforcée et sera destinée à des investissement pour sa famille, la construction de maison par exemple. Elle développe un commerce de tissu et de vêtements et son crédit lui permettra à s'approvisionner en quantité plus important en tissus et vêtements que les 6 derniers mois pour intensifier son activité. Ainsi elle réalisera plus de bénéfices et pourra participer à l'amélioration des conditions de sa famille.
texts.en:
Boye Guèye N. is a 50-year-old woman who is unmarried with three children to support.  She has been a member of the Banc Villageois de MONTAGNE NORD2 since March 29, 2008.  She has benefited from a loan three consecutive times.  She is a very energetic member and full of ambition.  In 1½ years, she was able to achieve a savings of 184,000 francs CFA.  This savings will be augmented and earmarked for investments for her family, such as for building a house.  She is developing a business involving fabrics and clothing.  Her loan will enable her to stock up on fabrics and clothing in quantities greater than in the last six months in order to intensify her business.  Thus, she will make more profit and will help improve her family's living conditions. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fabrics and clothing to resell

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa K. is a 42-year-old woman who has more than twenty years of experience in poultry breeding. She breeds ducks, geese, turkey and chicken. Sharifa sells her poultry to local residents and, once every two months, she goes to the livestock bazaar and sells a significant amount there.

Sharifa is married and has two children. Her dream is to see them as independent adults with their own businesses. Sharifa has applied for a 600 AZN loan and will use it to purchase more poultry for breeding.

loans.use: purchase more poultry

loans.name: Gulzat's Group

texts.en:
Gulzat S. is 35; she is the leader of the group. Her husband works as a security guard and Gulzat is a secretary in the district veterinary station. They also breed cattle and cultivate fruit and vegetables to make some money. Every year Gulzat and her husband sow wheat and barley, so they don’t need to purchase any food for their cattle. They started farming five years ago with an initial investment of 2,000 soms. Now Gulzat wants to get a loan to pay for tractor services and purchase 500 kilograms of wheat seed. In the future, she wants to build a new house.

Shairbubu Z. is 50 and has two sons and a daughter. Her daughter studies at school. Her older son has gone to work in Russia to make some money. Her younger son studies at university in Bishkek and works on construction to be able to pay for his study. Shairbubu’s husband is retired and he started to breed cattle two years ago with an initial investment of 15,000 soms. Now, by selling some cattle after fattening he makes 4,500 soms per month. Shairbubu applied for the loan because she wants to contribute money for her younger son’s education.

Meerim A. is 31 and a widow. She has a six-year-old daughter and to support her, Meerim does different activities. She takes orders and sews national clothing and provides dressmaking supplies. She also breeds and fattens cattle for sale. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase 10 sheep to increase the number of livestock. In the future, Meerim wants to buy a vehicle.

Turarkul S. is the treasurer of the group. She is 48, a widow and has raised three sons and a daughter. Her daughter works in a sewing workshop, the youngest son is at school, and her other sons work in Russia at the cannery.  Five years ago with an initial investment of 20,000 soms, Turarkul started to sell second-hand clothes and now she earns 5,000 soms per month. She wants to get a loan to repair the house and buy building material to construct a kitchen. In the future she wants to expand her business and contribute some money for her daughter’s wedding.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young, ambitious and socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). Mol Bulak is the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the Mol Bulak Finance staff.

loans.use: To purchase wheat seed

loans.name: Mereane

texts.en:
Mereane S. is 55 years-old and married with six children.  She is starting a business selling wood handicrafts to tourists and the local community.  Mereane needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional handicrafts to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 100 talas or US $42 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2010, Mereane joined Kiva partner SPBD and this is her first loan with them.   SPBD's loans are Mereane's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD:

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii andTonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase additional handicrafts to sell.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a single woman with one child who attends school. She has been operating as a food vendor, selling dry fish from home and door-to-door for the last twelve years. Her main customers are her neighbors and passersby. She has no other source of income. She owns a house with no electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

With this 40,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to start a motorcycle business and purchase a motorcycle. Mariam hopes to own a van in the future. She decided to work with Yehu so as to get a loan and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es: La Sra. Marcela es comerciante, ella vive en la zona de Pura  Pura de nuestra ciudad, su esposo es transportista, tiene 2 pequeños hijos , ellos son la razón de su vida. Trabaja llevando mercadería hasta los pueblos de clima cálido de nuestra ciudad y vende la mercadería al mayor y al menor dependiendo la feria a la que asista, la ropa es de origen Chileno de buena calidad y de precios económicos, esta muy feliz de haber accedido a este crédito ya que su intención es mejorar su calidad de vida, el dinero del credito es para la compra de ropa de temporada ya que tine muchos pedidos, es muy trabajadora y responsable esta muy agradecida con la institucion por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Miss Marcela is a merchant. She lives in the Pura Pura zone of the city [La Paz, Bolivia]. Her husband is a carrier. They have 2 small children, which are her reason for living. She works, bringing merchandise to the villages in the warmer areas of the city and sells the merchandise wholesale and retail depending on the market that she is visiting. The clothing is of Chilean origin, of good quality and affordable. She is very happy to have gained access to this credit since her goal is to improve her quality of life. The money of this loan is for the purchase of seasonal clothing since she has many orders. She is very hard-working and responsible, and is very grateful to the institution for the opportunity that they are offering her.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Big Family Group

texts.en:
Meet with the members of the “Big Family” group from Waterloo, a small town in Western Sierra Leone. They are local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to apply for a loan of SLL 2,000,000. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

Francess N. (pictured on the right) is the leader of this group. The thirty-year-old is married with one child ands has been a businesswoman for five years now, selling medicines. She intends using her SLL 1,200,000 share of the loan to add more drugs to her pharmacy.

loans.use: To buy more medicines to add to her pharmacy

loans.name: Pagamsuren

texts.en:
Pagamsuren D. lives with her husband and two sons in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic dwelling, in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her husband works in a local market as a guard and they have been living in their current home, which belongs to her mother-in-law, since 1999. She started her grocery trading business at a rented space in Mon-Mandal, a local market in her town.

 Before beginning her business, she worked in a food store as a salesperson.  Her business operation has expanded by increasing the variety of products at her grocery shop. Her business has grown quickly over the years and her total turnover reaches 1,520,000 MNT today. Her average monthly sales profit is 120,000 MNT and she receives 36,3000 MNT as salary per month.

 In the future, she plans to expand her business by continuing to increase the number and variety of products she sells. She is a very  modest and optimistic businesswoman. Pagamsuren is requesting a 1, 500,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes to sell in her store.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes

loans.name: Roda

texts.en: Roda M. is from the village of Flores, Naguillan. She is 28 years old. Roda is married. To make a living, Roda provides manicure and pedicure services in the local community. Roda has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Roda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Roda is requesting another loan of 5,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional materials needed to provide service. This will be the second loan taken out by Roda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Viviano

texts.es: Viviano de 38 años, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijas en su casa propia, ubicada en el pueblo de Llanco. Desde muy niño sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra, le gustaba ver como crecían y maduraban. Su experiencia de 20 años en la agricultura le ayudó a conseguir muchas cosas como su casa en la que hoy vive muy feliz; actualmente se dedica a la siembra de papa y arveja en un terreno que alquila en el pueblo de Jachapata, donde pasa la mayor parte del día ya que tiene que cuidar su cosecha de las plaga de insectos que en este tiempo están asolando su siembra. Viviano se propuso una meta para este año, juntar capital para poder comprar su propio terreno en Llanco y estar más tiempo con su familia. Es el séptimo crédito con MFP, y esta muy contento de pertenecer a su banco comunal. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará remedios para la plaga de insectos, asimismo desea comprar abono para que su cosecha sea la mejor.
texts.en:
Viviano is 38 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and their 2 daughters.  They live in the town of Llanco.  At a very young age his parents taught him to farm the land and he liked to see how things grew and matured.  His 20 years of experience in agriculture have helped him to obtain many things, like his house that he very happily lives in today.  Currently, he is growing potatoes and peas on a plot of land that he rents in the town of Jachapata.  This is where he spends most of his day since he has to care for his crops in order to protect them from the insects that threaten to destroy them.  

Viviano's goal for this year is to raise enough capital to be able to buy his own land in Llanco so that he can be closer to his family.  This is his seventh loan with MFP and he is very happy to belong to his communal bank.  With the two thousand soles (Peruvian currency) that he is requesting, he will buy remedies to combat the insects and also fertilizer so that he will have a better harvest.

loans.use: To purchase bags of fertilizer and remedies to combat insects

loans.name: Geoconda Elizabeth

texts.es:
Geoconda Elizabeth C. S. tiene 20 anos. En Unión Libre vive con el compañero y un hijo, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo, Odalys, de 3 años.
  
Geoconda es una socia de la ventanilla rural La Esperanza, que está ubicada a 25 kilometres del Cantón de Ventanas. Es una comunidad que se dedica al comercio en mayoría este grupo se reúne cada mes en el sector del barrio San Vicente.

Geoconda trabaja en el comercio de venta de ropa, sabanas toallas por pedidos, realiza las comprar en Guayaquil en las vende en un local de su casa.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería para ampliar su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es ponerse un  local y comprar una casa.
En su tiempo libre le gusta jugar el indor fútbol y el volley.
texts.en:
Geoconda Elizabeth C. S. is 20 years old. She lives in a common law relationship with her partner and has one child.  She lives in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.  Her child, Odalys, is three years old.

Geoconda is a member of the La Esperanza (Hope) rural bank, located 25 miles from Ventanas Canton.  This is a community primarily devoted to commerce.  The group meets each month in the neighborhood of San Vicente.

Geoconda works in the business of selling clothing, sheets and towels ordered by her customers.  She purchases them in Guayaquil and sells them at her home.

She is applying for the loan to purchase merchandise in order to enlarge her business.  The loan would help her acquire her necessities by supporting her financially.  Her dreams are to have a shop and buy a house.  

In her spare time she likes to play indoor soccer and volleyball.

loans.use: To enlarge her business.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema C. is a thirty-seven year old charcoal dealer and landlady in Mikoroshoni, Mombasa. She is married to Festus Baya, who supports her income, and together they are blessed with three children. She has been in this businesses for the last four years and she has been doing well. 

Rehema is now requesting her second loan from KADET to renovate her rental houses and purchase sacks of charcoal to sell. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her businesses and in future she hopes to own more rental houses and succeed in life.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.ar:
سوسن في عمر 47سنة متعلمة ونشيطة تحب عملها وعائلتها متزوجة ولديها ولدان تسعى الى تعليمهم وتربيتهم بوضع مادي مريح      
فهي تعمل منذ اكثر من 10 سنوات محيطها يدعمها ويحبها كثيرا فهي ذات نشاط في العمل كبير تعمل في بيع الالبسة متجول زبائنها    يحبونها                                                                                                             
تريد طلب قرض من المجموعة بهدف شراء بضاعة جديدة لتكبير مصلحتها وهي لا تجد صعوبات تاريخها مع المجموعة جيد وكانت تتلقى دعم من عائلتها
texts.en: Sawsan is an educated 47-year-old wife and mother of two for whom she strives very hard to ensure a decent education and upbringing. Her family and friends in turn are very loving and supportive. Sawsan is very go-getting in her work as a street clothes vendor, which she has been occupied in for the past decade; her customers are very well disposed toward her. Given her good credit history with Al Majmoua, Sawsan is now seeking another loan to purchase more wares to further expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for business.

loans.name: Ramzana's Group

texts.en:
Ramzana is a resident of Kasur which is a small city located in Punjab province of Pakistan and famous for its tanneries industry. She lives there in the area named Basti baraat shah with her family in a 3 room brick house. She came here after her marriage with N. A. who is a black smith by profession. He also provides welding services to his customers. 

Ramzana supports her family financially by doing embroidery work. She learned this art before her marriage from her mother and now this skill gives hera  reward in a form of money. She has 2 daughters and a son. Her elder daughter is studying while others are very young and have not started attending school yet. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her embroidery business. With the loan, she will buy clothes, and embroider material such as beads, colored thread and sketches in bulk quantity that will help her fulfill orders on time and to offer more embroidery variety to her clients. She started this business for some time ago and she is confident that her business will flourish after a loan investment. 

She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application. She hopes it will be a good experience for her in improving her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes and material for embroidery business

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Fatmata D.. She is married and has two children, ages two and six. In 1990, Fatmata established her used clothing business where she sells trousers and shirts. She began her business because she wanted to generate income to help her husband. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about $97 every month. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL in order to add stock to her business to increase her profits. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 350,000 SLL. In the future, Fatmata plans to sell clothing in bulk and wants to travel internationally to buy additional items for her store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to add more stock of used clothing

loans.name: Irma Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER DEL CUSCO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Irma; ella tiene 53 años. La socia es soltera y trabaja en ESALUD, ella es empleada pública en esta entidad, la socia desea el crédito para comprar unas pastillas porque debe iniciar su tratamiento contra la gastritis y el seguro no le proporciona las pastillas blandas para ella poder tomarlas, también deberá comprar otros medicamentos que no tiene el seguro social, la socia se mostro un poco triste al respecto y solo manifestó que desea hacer su tratamiento con medicamento de mejor calidad para que no le afecte a sus riñones ni a su ya agravada gastritis. La socia solicita el préstamo para iniciar su tratamiento.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Irma belongs to the “Nuevo Amanecer Del Cusco” (Cusco’s New Dawn) Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Huanchac district in the Cusco province and department.

Irma is 53 years old.  She is single, and she works at ESALUD (Health Social Security).  She is a public employee in this entity.  

She wants the loan to buy pills because she needs to start treatment for gastritis.  The insurance does not cover the soft gel tablets for her to be able to take them.  Also, she will need to buy other medications that the social security does not have.

She was a little sad about this, and she expressed that she only wants to have her treatment with the best quality medication.  She wants this so that her kidneys are not affected, and her gastritis is not aggravated.  She is requesting the loan to start her treatment.

She is happy with the loan that was granted, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To start her treatment

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en: Herbert is a 36-year-old hardworking man who lives in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His goal is to build his own house in the next four years. Herbert transports stones for a living and has been in this kind of business, from which he reaps tangible benefits, for three years. He is requesting a loan to purchase fuel and more stones.

loans.use: To purchase fuel and more stones

loans.name: Hernan Roberto

texts.es:
Hernán hombre trabajador, casado, trabajo para una empresa privada desde hace tiempo, también recibe remesa familiares para ayudarse con los gasto. Tiene como proyecto mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda pero se le ha presentado las dificultades de financiamiento. 
El préstamo que solicitas es para la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, láminas de zinc, hierro, arena, tabla, reglas de madera, alambre, para la construcción de su muro. Obteniendo seguridad, protección y comodidad.
texts.en:
Hernán is a hard-working married man who has been employed by a private company many years.  He also receives help from family to cover his expenses.  He has a project to improve his home's infrastructure but has run into some financial difficulties.

He plans to use the loan to buy construction materials such as cement, zinc sheet, iron, sand, wood conglomerate, wood strips, and wire to build a wall.  His aim is to obtain safety, protection and comfort.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Francisco José

texts.es:
En el municipio de Granada, Departamento de Granada, labora el señor Francisco José V. G. , el cual tiene 3 años de laborar como Fontanero en una empresa ubicada en la misma zona. Es acompañado solo depende cuatro personas del cual está compuesto su núcleo familiar.

Actualmente tiene la necesidad de realizar mejoramiento de vivienda en su casa de habitación y por tal razón visita las oficinas de CEPRODEL para realizar dicho mejoramiento, considera que de esta forma estará dándole un hogar digno a su familia ya que quiere que ellos crezcan saludablemente.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco José V. G. has been working as a Plumber for a firm located in the town of Granada, Granada department for three years.  His nuclear family is composed of four dependents.

He needs to do some home improvements so he visits CEPRODEL’s offices to carry out said improvement.  He considers that this is a way to provide his family with a worthy home since all he wants is that they grow healthfully.

loans.use: For home improvements.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes P. is from the village of Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. She is 54 years old. Lourdes is married and has five children. To make a living, Lourdes owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & beverages in the local community. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lourdes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Lourdes from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: For 30 years, Efua E. has made and sold doughnuts and porridge at Korfofordo near Jukwa. She serves the porridge with milk and bread. Her husband is a farmer, and Efua uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and other household expenditures. Efua will use the loan to purchase more bags of maize in order to produce her wares in larger quantities for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of maize in order to produce her wares in larger quantities for sale

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten is a young woman from Ramallah city. Faten is married and a mother of one daughter and two sons. Faten's husband is a construction worker.

Faten took out a loan from FATEN to pay for house repairs. The house where the family lives is a small one. Faten wants to build an extra room attached to the house and paint the walls.

Faten's husband is photographed instead of her, as she is a conservative woman.

loans.use: to enlarge and fix the family house

loans.name: Pamba Group

texts.en:
Romana J. is in her early 30's and is married with 3 children. She has two businesses, a pool table (hall) and a cow for milk. She has had these businesses for 2 years. She works from 10:00am to 10:00pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Romana's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to go and collect her cow outside Dar es Salam. She also made some repairs on her pool table and has paid back her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to make some repairs on her house. Her dream is to one day buy more cows and sell a lot of milk.

Romana will share this loan with her loan group "Pamba", which has a total of 17 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Romana is in the second row, second from left in an orange dress.

loans.use: to make repairs to her house

loans.name: Sri

texts.en:
Sri K. is a rice farmer in the province of Kompong Cham. She and her husband always help each other to feed their two young kids who are still enrolled in a local school. The couple always uses their own farmland for planting rice, and they are able to use their land to cultivate different kinds of crops at least twice a year. From this rice crop-planting business, they can make around $3.75 a day to cover the family expenses. 

The heavy rainfall is the best sign for growing her crops, but she lacks capital to do so. In order to clear this situation, Sri K. will use her loan to rent a plot of farmland to enlarge her crop, and to purchase seeds, insecticides, and fertilizer for growing it.

loans.use: to rent a plot of farmland to enlarge her crop, and to purchase seeds, insecticides and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jhona Liza

texts.en:
Jhona Liza B. is from the village of Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 28 years old. Jhona Liza is single and has one school-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling colognes, deodorants, face powders and mouthwash in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $150 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Jhona Liza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She  is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional colognes and beauty products. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional colognes and beauty products.

loans.name: Elvira Sonia

texts.es:
Elvira  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Nuevo Amanecer”, ubicado en el distrito Juli, provincia Chucuito departamento de Puno, tiene 30 años de edad, es viuda y tiene dos hijos en edad escolar.  La señora estudió  educación superior (incompleta).
Hace ocho años que trabaja  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos,  su   préstamo inicial fue de  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que incrementó al capital de su negocio al cual se dedicaba anteriormente (venta al por menor de artículos artesanales), en la actualidad se dedica a la venta de abarrotes.
En la actualidad solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 1000.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar mercaderías como: arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, chocolates y golosinas.

Elvira nos cuenta que también realiza el servicio de recargas de celulares.  La señora trabaja sola en su negocio.
Su sueño es tener una tienda y ser mayorista  en abarrotes y golosinas en la localidad de Juliaca.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es  la ganancia del ahorro.
texts.en:
Elvira is a member of the communal bank "Nuevo Amanecer," located in the Juli district of Chucuito province in the department of Puno.  She is a 30 year-old widow who has 2 school-aged children.  Elvira has completed some college coursework.

She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization for 8 years.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles, money that she used as capital for her previous business selling handicrafts.  Now she has a business selling groceries.  She is requesting a new loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles that she will use to buy merchandise such as: rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil, chocolates and candies.

Elvira tells us that she is also in the business of selling cellular telephone minutes.  She works alone in her business.  Her dream is to have a store and be a wholesaler of groceries and candy in the town of Juliaca.  

What she likes about her communal bank is the earnings she gets on her savings.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as: rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil, chocolates and candy

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Evangeline requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her stall. She has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Evangeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Teresa tiene 51 años de edad, está casada con el señor Ricardo de 56 años, trabaja en la Ande hace 32 años, cuenta con tres hijos mayores, el varón estudia análisis de sistema y trabaja, las dos mujeres estudian periodismo y arquitectura respectivamente.
La señora la señora se dedica a la venta de ropas, con lo cual ha formado ya una clientela bien definida, ademas de eso vende productos Avon (cosméticos).
Con la ayuda del credito, podra ampliar la cantidad y variedad de sus mercaderias, ofreciendo asi mayor variedad a sus clienes y fortaleciendo asi su inversión.
Desea que sus hijos culminen sus respectivas carreras universitarias y contar con un negocio propio mas adelante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Teresa is 51 years old and is married to Mr. Ricardo who is 56 years of age and has worked in Ande (National Electricity Administration) for some 32 years. They have three adult children, the male studies systems analysis and works, the two women are studying journalism and architecture, respectively.

Mrs. Teresa sells clothing and has been able to have a steady customer base, she also sells Avon products (makeup).

With the help from the loan, she will be able to increase the quantity and variety of her merchandize and be able to give a greater variety of items to her customers, that will strengthen her investment.

Mrs. Teresa wishes that her children finish their respective degrees and be able to have their own businesses in the future.

loans.use: buy clothing to increase the variety of her merchandize.

loans.name: Rosa Isela

texts.es: Este cliente se desempeña como cocinera en un restaurante de masachapa desde hace más de doce años, madre de tres hijos, casado  actualmente tiene tres  hijo en edad escolar. Con la institución es el crédito numero tres y los ha solicitado para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación. Estos créditos tienen una gran importancia al desarrollo de la unidad familiar, permitiendo de esta forma tener una casa más digna.
texts.en: This borrower has been working as a cook in a restaurant in Masachapa for more that twelve years. She is married and she has three children who are currently attending school. This is the third loan she has requested to this institution: with it she will buy construction materials such as sand, cement, stone, piedrín (a type of building stone) and blocks that will be used to enlarge and improve her house. These loans are very important for the expansion of the family house, so that they can live in a more decent home.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to improve and enlarge her house.

loans.name: Vachagan

texts.en: Vachagan is 34 years old and he lives in Gagar village, Lori region. He is married and has two small sons. For more than 15 years, Vachagan has been engaged in farming. With his parents help he breeds cows and cultivates land. But the main line of Vachagan’s occupation and principal source of his family’s income is beekeeping. He likes beekeeping very much and he enjoys it.  As a result of his hard work, Vachagan always gets high quality honey in large quantities and he sells his production in Vanadzor city market. Vachagan needs a 900,000 AMD loan to buy a car, which will allow him to transport and to resell his honey in other cities of Lori region.

loans.use: to buy a car, which will allow him to transport and resell his honey in other cities

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth has been operating a general store for three years to help her husband earn income for their family. Her three children are all now married and living separately from them. She is now 48 years old and enjoying her activity in retailing. She sells different kinds of groceries where her family gets their source of income for a daily living. 

Elizabeth is asking for a loan amount of PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of groceries such as soft drinks and food snacks to maintain her retail shop business. For the three years she has been managing her store, she has had a net income estimate of PHP 1,000 each month. Using this, Elizabeth was able to provide most of their daily basic needs while saving a little amount for future use.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as soft drinks and food snacks

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es: La señora Andrea se dedica a la venta de medicamentos naturales, se dedica a dicha actividad desde hace tres años y con la tienda de su propiedad desde hace un año cuenta con buena clientela ya que las personas ahora quieren utilizar medicamentos que no tengan químicos, vive en domicilio de sus padres donde vive con  su esposo y su hija de tres años solicita el crédito para la  compra de  mercadería y de esta forma surtir su tienda e incrementar su capital de trabajo, le va muy bien con la venta de estos productos, es una persona joven con muchas ganas de superacion.
texts.en: Andrea has worked selling natural medicines for three years and has had a store for a year.  She has a good clientele, as people now want medications that do not contain chemicals.  She lives at her parent’s house with her husband and 3-year-old daughter.  She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise to stock her store, as well as to increase her working capital.  She does well selling these products and is a young woman with a great deal of desire to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines.

loans.name: Abner

texts.en:
Abner is 29 years old, married to Lydia and not yet blessed with children.

He runs three business at a go: a barber shop, a video library, and a chemist's in Kasarani Nairobi Kenya. He has been in these businesses for the last two years and gets an income of KES 15,000 per month.

He is applying for his second loan of KES 35,000 from KADET LTD which he plans to use to purchase more stock or equipment for his businesses like medicine and syringes (chemist's), CDs and DVDs ( video shop), and shaving machines (barber shop). He will use the extra profit to expand his business ventures, maybe buying a "bodaboda" motor bike for himself to try the transportation business.

he hopes to buy a plot of land and build a residential house. He is very hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase more stock or equipment such as medicine and syringes (chemist's), CDs and DVDs (video shop), and shaving machines (barber shop).

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es: La Sra. Fabiola  trabaja en su casa, elaborando papas fritas de manera artesanal, reparte en escuelas, colegios y tiendas en varias zonas de la Ciudad, tiene una experiencia superior a 3 años en el rubro y es conocida en el barrio. Vive en casa propia, tiene dos hijos pequeños, que los cuida con la ayuda de su mamá, la cliente esta sola, el papa de sus hijos se encuentra en Brasil. El crédito es para compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus productos, es una persona muy trabajadora se levanta a tempranas horas de la mañana para pelar las papas y freírlas esto de manera manual, después las embolsa para entregarlas en los distintos kioscos y escuelas y también ella tiene su puesto de venta donde las vende mas directamente.
texts.en:
Sra. Fabiola works at home preparing traditionally made potato chips. She distributes them in schools and stores in various areas of the city. She has had more than 3 years experience doing this work and is well-known in the neighborhood.

Fabiola lives in her own home and has two small children whom she cares for with her mother’s help. She is alone, since the children’s father is in Brasil.

This loan is to buy supplies to prepare her product. She is a very hardworking person who gets up during the early hours of the morning to peel and fry the potatoes by hand, afterwards packaging them to deliver to the various kiosks and schools. She also has her own stall where she sells directly to the public

loans.use: to buy supplies to prepare and sell potato chips.

loans.name: Ramón Leonardo

texts.es:
El señor Ramón es de la ciudad de Pilar. El es comerciante, tiene una pequeña despensa, está casado, tiene un hijo que ya es mayor de edad con una profesión, es Licenciado en Análisis de Sistema, tiene casa propia, vive con su señora, es una persona muy activa responsable y trabajadora con muy buenas referencias en el barrio ya que es una persona muy servicial.
Desea poder seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y de esa forma surgir generando ingresos para su familia, ya que se siente muy a gusto con lo que hace. Además de eso comenta que todo su esfuerzo siempre es para ayudar a su familia en todo lo que el pueda.
El solicita el préstamo para la compra de azúcar, harina, fideo, arroz para el abastecimiento de su almacén. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda, pues es una ayuda para su micro emprendimiento.
texts.en:
Señor Ramón is from the town of Pilar. He is a merchant and has a small store. He is married and has a son who is an adult and a graduate with a degree in systems analysis. He has his own house and lives his wife. He is a very active, responsible and hardworking person with a very good reputation in the neighbourhood as he is a very helpful person.

He wants to continue investing in his business and in this way generate a greater income for his family as he feels very comfortable with the work he does. In addition he says that all his efforts are to help his family in any way he can. 

He is asking for the loan to buy sugar, flour, noodles, rice to stock up his store. He thanks the Fundacion for the opportunity given him as it helps his micro enterprise.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, noodles and other products.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
María  de 34 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con sólo servicio de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Desde hace algunos años aproximadamente María se ha dedicado a la venta de golosinas, gaseosas, útiles de escritorio y otros artículos, su negocio lo ha colocado en un local propio pequeño con el que cuenta a unos minutos de su vivienda, con las ganancias que adquiera por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Para poder  ampliar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 800 nuevos soles para comprar más mercadería como productos de primera necesidad, con el único ideal de que su negocio crezca y tenga más productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes;  para cubrir su préstamo y sus obligaciones de su casa.  María es una persona responsable, dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por brindarle algunas mejoras económicas  a su familia.
texts.en:
34-year-old María lives with her family in her own home.  The only basic service her house receives is electricity.  Her home is located in Tambogrande district, in Piura department.  The people in this area farm, raise livestock and make handicrafts.

For some years, María has been selling candies, soda, stationery supplies and other products.  Her business is located in a small sales location that she owns, a few minutes from her home.  She uses the profits that she makes from selling her products to try and cover her expenses and improve her quality of life.

In order to expand her business, María has requested a loan for 800 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more merchandise such as basic household products, with the aim of growing her business, having more products to offer her customers, repaying her loan and meeting her household responsibilities.  María is a responsible, committed and hard-working person who works hard to improve her family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as candies, soda and stationery supplies to stock her business

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is 36 years old and is engaged in a hog raising business as one of her sources of income. She has been doing this for over two years and has been earning 3,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) per piglet. She hopes that she can get the loan she requested to further develop her business. 

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP to buy feed and vitamins for her hogs and to use in her hog raising business. She hopes this will lead to growth in her business. 

She devotes herself to working hard in order to support the needs of her family as well as to pay for her child's education. She hopes to provide for her child so that she can finish her education and become a degree holder someday which would help to lift their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her hogs

loans.name: Batgerel

texts.en: Batgerel is 39 years old and lives with her son in an apartment in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her son is a college student. She started her women's garment retail business in 1994 by renting a counter in a local market. She is very well experienced in her field and she is known for her fashion sense. Now that winter is arriving, she needs warmer clothes to sell. She is a strong and hard working woman who says, "Now that my son has joined a college, I am short on cash to run my business." She is requesting 2,500,000 to buy more garments to sell.

loans.use: To buy more garments

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is 47 years old, married, and has five children.  To earn a living, he practices farming.  He also does a motorbike transport business to earn a living.  He has employed one person in the business.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access business loans.  This has helped him to boost his business.

Jonathan hopes to grow his business in the future.  He has requested 70,000 Kenya shillings to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa sells cooked rice and stew at Eguafo. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a carpenter. Adjoa has been selling rice and stew for 7 years. She assists her husband in paying the utility bills.  She will use her loan to buy bags of rice and food items. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: buy bags of rice and food items.

loans.name: Marame-Fall

texts.fr:
Marame-fall est une femme mariée âgée de 59 ans et mère de 3 enfants , elle est membre du banc villageois depuis 01/09/2008 ou elle a de bonnes relations avec ses camarades. Elle fait partie du groupe de solidarité Sope Malick.

Elle fait du petit commerce dans la vente d'arachides et des fruits saisonniers.
Elle dispose d une bonne expérience dans son domaine d activité.

Avec son nouveau prêt de 400000 franc Cfa elle va acheter des arachides et des paniers de fruits destinés à la revente.

Les bénéfices qu'elle va réaliser lui permettront de payer du riz du lait du sucre pour ses enfants à la fin de chaque mois mais également de payer leurs fournitures scolaires.
texts.en:
Marama-fall is a 59-year-old married woman, mother of three. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" association since 1 September 2008 and entertains good relations with the other members. She is part of the Sope Malick solidarity group.

She is a retail merchant dealing in peanuts and seasonal fruits, with good experience in her field of activity.

With her new loan of 400,000 CFA francs she will buy peanuts and fruit baskets intended for retail sales.

The profits she will achieve will enable her to pay for rice, milk, and sugar for her children on a monthly basis, but also to pay for their school supplies.

loans.use: buy peanuts and fruit to retail

loans.name: Aneesa

texts.en:
Aneesa is a 36-year-old woman from Madaba, Amman, Jordan. She is the mother of six children.

Aneesa is trading in clothes from her home. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase more clothes.

Aneesa is looking to improve her family's life conditions and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for trading purposes

loans.name: Bright

texts.en:
Bright is a determined young man of 25 who has been running his money transfer business since July 2011. He wants to use his loan money to purchase a small computer to speed up his transactions and to employ two people in his shop so that he can serve his customers faster. He also wishes to use the money to increase his working capital. 

Access to financial services in Zambia is both scarce and expensive. Close to 10 million Zambians, 80% of the population, do not have bank accounts. As most Zambians live in rural areas, distance and transportation factors hinder access to available financial services. Mobile Transactions Zambia Limited (MTZL) is an early stage company that specializes in low-cost mobile money and other financial transaction services by propagating an open network using small businesses called Champion Agents. Bright is one of the champion Agents. This is his story. 

When Bright first started his business his main focus was to get people in his community to know about the service that he provides. He started off by doing direct sales to customers in his community by distributing flyers and explaining his business to them in person. His strategy paid off because barely a month later his transactions had increased from a mere 10 transactions a day to 48 transactions a day. Because of the quick growth of his business he faces the challenge of working float (electronic and cash value of his working capital) which means he does not have enough working capital to satisfy his customers from time to time. He frequently has to close his shop and make trips to the bank to convert his electronic money to cash and vice versa. 

Bright is currently living with his grandmother who is taking care of five other people. He continues to work extra hard so that he can be able to move out of his grandmother's house and get his own place. In the next five years, Bright sees himself as a full blown businessman. He plans to open money transfer shops in two new locations. 

In Bright's video, the interview is conducted by a representative of Mobile Transactions.

loans.use: To purchase a small computer to speed up his transactions and to employ two people in his shop so that he can be able to serve his customers faster

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim, 58, is married and lives with her husband and four children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is an A Kor vendor. Her husband is a rice farmer. Two of her children are employed at the garment factory. 
Kim is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase tarantulas to sell to customers. By doing so, she can generate more income to financially support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business of buying and selling tarantulas and run a new business breeding crickets to sell.

loans.use: to purchase tarantulas to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 21-year-old married man with one child who is still too young for school. His wife is a farmer who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.

Peter has operated a car wash business for the past two years; his potential clients are the local area taxi drivers. He faces a major challenge of water storage. He dreams of expanding his business.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase a car washing machine (a pressure water pump) for his business. He decided to join Yehu to access capital to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase a car washing machine (a pressure water pump) for his business.

loans.name: Sowed

texts.en: Sowed lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is married with eight children and four of them attend school. He deals in a motorcycle spare parts business that is supplemented by farming. He has expectations of expanding his business and paying school fees for his children. His main challenge is inadequate capital and he will use the loan facility to buy more spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on business

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.en:
Born April 26th, 1968 in Evou-Apegame (d’Amou Prefecture), Mr. E. Yaovi is married with eight people in his household, five of whom are his own children. After his training, he got a job as a laboratory technician at the Tsevie General Hospital. His salary is barely enough to cover his family expenses, which forces him to work as a moto-taxi driver sometimes. Working for a third party who is very exploitative, he has decided to buy his own motorcycle which will give him financial stability for the needs of his family. His wife’s restaurant brings in very little profit so she isn’t often able to help with the household spending. This energetic man is seeking a $1000 loan to buy a motorcycle so that he can work independently. This project will allow him to increase his income so that he can improve his family’s standard of living.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 26 avril 1968 à Evou-Apégamé (P/d’Amou), Monsieur E. Yaovi est marié et a en charges huit (08) personnes dont ses cinq (05) enfants. Après sa formation, il est employé comme technicien de laboratoire à la Polyclinique de Tsévié. Son salaire suffit à peine à couvrir les dépenses de la famille ce qui l’a poussé à faire de temps en temps le taxi moto. Travaillant pour une tierce personne qui ne fait que l’exploiter, il décide d’acquérir sa propre moto qui lui permettra d’avoir une stabilité financière pour les besoins de la famille. La cafétéria de son épouse est peu rentable ce qui fait qu’elle ne l’aide pas souvent dans les dépenses du ménage. Dynamique, il sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour acheter une moto et travailler en son propre compte. Ce projet lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus pour une amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: purchase of a motorcycle to drive as a moto-taxi

loans.name: Xu

texts.en: Xu 47 years old, and her husband was killed in a traffic accident a long time ago. She has a grocery store at home to support an eldest son and youngest daughter. Her son stopped going to school to be able to earn money. Her daughter is attending grade 7. Their income is $10 per person/month. Xu wants to get a loan of $75 in order to supply her grocery store. They will repay monthly.

loans.use: To supply the grocery store.

loans.name: Hun

texts.en: Mr. Hun H. is 27 years old, and lives in a part of Siem Reap province, Cambodia. He is talented and has experienced several years in electrical supplies, so he now operates an electrical store in his area, where he can typically makes around 5 USD a day in revenue. Currently, Hun H. has managed to increase the number of his clients, but he is not able to meet the high demand, which is why he needs the loan to help him provide for his customers.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical supplies for his invetory.

loans.name: Chude

texts.en: Chude is a 29-year-old resident of the Buguruni area in Ilala District, Dar Es Salaam region. Chude operates a 60-seat video hall in the Bugururni area, a business he has been doing for the past six years. He is grateful to this business; with the profits, he has been able to construct a house, send his kids to school, and support his family. Chude wants to make renovations to install up-to-date structures in the hall. His dream is to turn the hall into a modern theatre. He is in need of USD 550 to help him accomplish his mission.

loans.use: Expand his video hall

loans.name: Alberto Ribeiro

texts.pt:
Alberto Ribeiro M. is married and has 5 children. He lives in Maputo, Mozambique and owns an upholstery shop where he upholsters buses and vans' seats, as well as chairs and sofas. Having paid his first loan in full, he is requesting a second one, which he will use to buy fabric, padding and other materials for his business.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer.

Alberto Ribeiro M. é casado e pai de 5 filhos.Vive no bairro 3 de Fevereiro em Maputo.Tem uma Estufaria e uma barraca na mesma zona. Faz cadeiras para meios de transporte semi-colectivo e mobília de sala de visita.Está no 2º ciclo, no primeiro ciclo tomou 6.000MT e pagou em 6 meses sem problemas. No 2º ciclo vai tomar 9.000MT também pagáveis em 6 meses.

loans.use: To buy fabric, padding and other materials for his upholstery business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stock up on more merchandise for the upcoming holiday season

loans.name: Confianza Group

texts.es:
The Communal Bank Confianza (Confidence) began 12 years ago. Currently it has 20 members and they have been through 38 repayment cycles together. The members tell us that in their Communal Bank they have learned to be responsible, punctual, and to invest in their businesses. They also note that the Communal Bank allows them to save money, which is not possible at home.

The women operate varied businesses selling meat, cheese, chicken, sausage, clothes, snacks, cosmetics, small animals and grains. Some also make breads, proviD. taxi service, and make clothing as well as beautiful woven crafts.

Each member of the group has a different story to tell, as in the case of Rene. Rene makes curtains, liners, sheets and clothing, skills that she learned from her parents. Rene began this business with a machine that was her parents; she maD. small items but did not have adequate space. Currently she has a store and uses industrial sewing machines, enabling her to proviD. different services. Rene mentions that the secret is to treat customers well, give them good prices, and be punctual with orders.

Nancy provides a different example. She sells Omnilife products, and began her business selling to family and friends. With the loan that she received from the Communal Bank, she opened an office. Currently she has promoters and ads on the radio. Her business has grown, but her hope is to reach out to the provinces.

The Communal Bank members need different sized loans; some need 200 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles, 800 soles, or 1000 soles, making a total of 11,600 soles in loans.

The loans will be used to purchase chickens, pigs, turkeys, milk, sugar, rice, shirts, pants, jerseys, blouses, wool, thread, flour, cosmetics, corn, wheat, beans, peas, fabric, and other natural products. The earnings will be used to purchase a house, furnish a home, increase capital and contribute to the education of their children. The group members dream of buying their own land, building a house, growing their businesses, adding branches, buying cars, and seeing their children become professionals with economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

El Banco Comunal Confianza se inició hace 12 años. Actualmente son 20 socias y ya tienen 38 ciclos juntas. Las socias nos dicen que en su Banco Comunal han aprendido a ser responsables, puntuales, cómo invertir en su negocio y han podido ahorrar porque dicen que en L. casa no se pueD. ahorrar. Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como venta D. carnes, queso, pollo, embutidos, ropa, abarrotes, cosméticos, animales menores, cereales, elaboración D. panes, y también servicios D. taxi y confección D. prendas D. vestir, además D. realizar bellos trabajos D. artesanía en telar. Cada socia tiene una historia diferente que contar, como es el caso D. Rene, que hace trabajos D. confección D. cortinas, forros, sábanas y prendas D. vestir, actividad que aprendió D. sus padres. Rene inició con este negocio con una máquina que era D. sus padres; hacía trabajos pequeños y no tenía un local adecuado. Actualmente tiene una tienda y cuenta con máquinas industriales, realizando diferentes servicios. Rene menciona que el secreto es atender bien al cliente, darles precios cómodos y puntualidad con los trabajos. Por otro lado Nancy que venD. productos Omnilife, inició su negocio vendiendo a sus familiares, amigos y con el préstamo que saco D. su Banco Comunal implementó una oficina. Actualmente tiene promotores y hace publicidad por radio; su negocio ha crecido, pero su deseo es llegar a más provincias. Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos; algunos montos son D. 200 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles, 800 soles, 1000 soles, haciendo un total D. 11,600 soles D. préstamos. Los préstamos los invertirán en L. compra D. pollos, lechones, pavos, leche, azúcar, arroz, polos, pantalones, chompas, blusas, lana, lana, hilos, harina, cosméticos, maíz, trigo, haba, arveja, telas, productos naturales, etc. Los ahorros los utilizarán para comprar una casa, artefactos para el hogar, aumentar su capital y para L. educación D. sus hijos. Los sueños D. las socias son comprar su terreno, construir su casa, ampliar su negocio, tener sucursales, comprar un carro, que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener estabilidad económica.

loans.use: The loans will be used to purchase chickens, pigs, turkeys, milk, sugar, rice, shirts, pants, jerseys, blouses, wool, thread, flour, cosmetics, corn, wheat, beans, peas, fabric, and other natural products.

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es:
María Guadalupe knew that she had a knack for making friends and for talking with people. For this reason, she determined that sales would be the best way to augment her husband’s income as a driver. She started to obtain beauty product catalogs, to slowly grow a customer base, and to start including in her catalog product line other items such as shoes and some clothing. Currently, she has an established book of clients.

Regardless, she needs to increase the products she currently carries for her customers. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of $325USD to be repaid over a period of five months, to use to enhance her product line. With your support, María will be able to save money to pay for her children’s expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

María Guadalupe, sabía que tiene la capacidad para hacer amistades, así como de hablar con personas. Fue por eso que se dio cuenta que las ventas sería la mejor opción para obtener ingresos extras a los de su esposo puesto que el es chofer. Fue así como comenzó a conseguir catálogos de cosméticos, poco a poco se fue haciendo de clientes y comenzó a incluir en su repertorio catálogos de zapatos, y un poco de ropa. Actualmente ya cuenta con una cartera de clientes.

Sin embargo los productos con los que cuenta actualmente, no son suficientes para poder llegar con un cliente para ofrecérselos. Es por eso que María Guadalupe está solicitando un crédito de US $325 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses. Con este dinero María podrá comprar más mercancía para poder ofrecerles a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda María podrá juntar dinero para pagar los gastos de sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Mery Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mery Elizabeth is 42 years old and studied to work in a clinic. She was not able to pursue her career because there were not many jobs available, and also because she got married and had children. She has 3 children who depend on her. They live in the Trujillo district, in La Libertad.

She began selling beauty products, having previously worked as a teacher. With the money she earned she bought a small cart and began to sell prepared meals from in front of her house. She stopped this business because she wasn't earning enough money. She eventually took a class near her home where she learned how to sew various pieces such as furniture covers and tapestries. She also began to buy small appliances from wholesalers which she sold at a better price.

She is part of the communal bank called Mujeres del Milenium, from whom she received her first loan to help her business. With the new loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase school supplies to sell, taking advantage of the beginning of the school season, as well as travel to Huamachuco to sell her appliances.

Her dream is to one day have a store in the center of Trujillo where she can sell all kinds of appliances.

La señora tiene 42 años de edad, estudio la carrera técnica de laboratorio clínico, no ejerció su carrera por motivo que por ese tiempo no había mucha demanda de trabajo para su especialidad y también porque estaba comprometida con el que actualmente es padre de sus hijos. Tiene tres hijos que aun dependen de ella. Vive en el distrito de Trujillo provincia de la misma, en el departamento La Libertad.
