Ella se inicia vendiendo productos de belleza, posteriormente trabajó como profesora en el magisterio del distrito de Virú, con el dinero que ganó compro su carrito sanguchero el cual hacia algunos preparados y vendía fuera de su casa, pero cerró porque no le era muy rentable. Estudio un curso de manualidades cerca de su domicilio en el que aprendio a realizar diversos trabajos como: coronas de tela que se utilizan para los difuntos además en una maquina de cocer elabora forro para muebles y edredones, teje tapetes y fundas. Así también compra artefactos al por mayor el cual lo vuelve a vender a mayor precio, algunos de éstos los envía a la sierra liberteña especialmente a Humachuco. Ella integra el banco comunal “Mujeres del Milenium” en el que le dieron su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compró útiles escolares para vender a sus amistades y conocidos que le hacían pedidos. Con el préstamo de S/. 1500.00 que cancelará en cuatro meses comprara útiles escolares ya que aprovechara la campaña escolar, viajará a Huamachuco a ofrecer estos productos además de artefactos como microondas y una olla arrocera. La señora Mery es presidenta del vaso de leche “Zoila Victoria de la Torre de la Haya” ubicado en su distrito. Ella sueña con acondicionar un local en el centro de la ciudad de Trujillo en el que venda todo tipo de artefactos.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE SCHOOL SUPPLIES WHICH SHE WILL SELL, AS THE SCHOOL TERM IS BEGINNING, AS WELL AS SMALL APPLIANCES SHE PURCHASES WHOLESALE TO LATER SELL AT A BETTER PRICE.

loans.name: Soklim

texts.en: Mrs. Soklim L. was born in 1977 and now lives in Kompong Por Village, Cambodia.  Married with five children, three of whom attend school while the others stay at home, Soklim works as a fish seller in a local village. Mr. Chamreon, her husband, is a fisherman and works with her. She now hopes to purchase a motorbike to travel to the next village to sell fish. In order to buy it, however, she needs a loan of $425.  Soklim thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Ssekabira Ismah, Kavule Effort Group

texts.en: David K. and Ismah Sekabira joined Kavule Effort together and this is their first year with the group. David sells green bananas from Mukono Central market and he would like to buy more to sell in his stall with the loan. Ismah is a motorcyclist locally known as "boda boda" at Nabuti stage in Mukono and he is the group's chairman. He plans to repair his motorcycle and also to partly complete payment on his children’s school fees.

loans.use: Ismah would repair his motorcycle and pay his children’s school fees. David would buy more green bananas for his stall.

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
Maher is a 44 year old father of 5. He lives and works in southern Lebanon, in Saida. Maher is a car blacksmith.

This is the second time he is applying for a loan at Al Majmoua because he needs to buy materials to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: To buy materials for his car business

loans.name: Al Malak Group

texts.en:
The A. Malak group includes three women. The group’s name means Angel in Arabic. These women live in a village in the Bekaa Valley of Lebanon. For some time now, they have been working in different businesses. Fawzieh, 23 years old, who is single, and Fatmeh, 24, who is married, trade goods. The third member of the group, Sahar, 19 years old, is married and owns a grocery shop.

The group is requesting a loan for USD 900 to share equally among the members. Each member of the group is requesting a loan to use as working capitA. to improve their business. This is the first time that the A. Malak group is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua.

The young woman wearing a green outfit in the picture (3rd from left) is the A. Majmoua credit officer who monitors the A. Malak group.

loans.use: For working capital to improve each group member's retail business.

loans.name: 6 De Julio Group

texts.es:
This group from the San Pedro Neighborhood was formed through another group formed in the same neighborhood. All the women participate in business; selling merchandise on the international bridge (oils, flour, sugar, detergent, pastas and other foodstuffs), also selling cosmetics, cell phones, clothing, sheets and towels. A woman works raising chickens, and other have their own businesses at home (store, hair salons, tailoring). The amount of money that each woman receives varies from 300,000 to 1,000,000 guaranies( Paraguayan currency, $75-$250), the all use the loan to buy merchandise for their current businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

Este grupo del Barrio San Pedro surgió por medio de otro comité formado en el mismo barrio. Todas las señoras realizan actividades productivas venta de mercaderias en el puente internacional (aceites, harinas, azucar, jabon en polvo, fideos y otros productos comestibles) tambien venden cosmeticos, telefonos celulares, ropas, sabanas y tohallas, Una señora tiene negocio de cria de pollos y otras negocios propios en su domicilio( despensa, peluqueria, y modista). El monto que recibe cada señora varia de 300.000 a 1.000.000 gs (~$75-$250), todas las señoras destinan el crédito para comprar mercaderias para las actividades que ya estan realizando actualmente.

loans.use: To buy eggs, oil, wine, powdered soap, sugar, pastas, rice, flour and milk products, chickens in order to raise them, clothing, lingerie, sheets for further sale

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
La Sra. Catalina S. tiene 37 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 2 hijos menores, ambos estudiantes de la educación primaria.
La Sra. Catalina es propietaria de un vivero hace más de 10 años, se inició con esta actividad gracias al amor que tiene hacia las plantas, las flores, en la naturaleza en sí, gracias a su suegra por la donación de un terreno empezó a realizar sus primeras compras de diferentes plantas de estación, asi también, como árboles frutales y para reforestar la tierra.
Sus clientes fueron sumando al correr del tiempo y su terreno fue quedando cada vez más pequeño para la gran cantidad de mercaderías, a la que se fueron sumando los productos de alfarería y adornos de jardín, como cántaros, imitación de aves y otros.
Compró otro terreno y así fue creciendo, actualmente cuenta con 4 terrenos explotados como vivero.
Comenta que la paz de estar rodeada por la naturaleza le ayuda a seguir cada día ofreciendo un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías tales como: Plantas diversas, flores de estación, árboles frutales, plantas ornamentales y otros.
texts.en:
Catalina S. is 37 years old, is married and has 2 children who are currently in primary school.

Catalina is the owner of a greenhouse and has been so for more than 10 years. She started her business thanks to a love she felt for plants, flowers, and all of nature. Her mother-in-law gave her the land she needed and soon after she started to make her first purchases of perennial plans, as well as fruit trees and trees for reforestation.

Her clientele started to grow with time and her plot of land seemed to be getting smaller but only because she had so many plants. She sarted having more and more alfalfa products and garden decorations, such as water jugs, bird statues and others.

She purchased another plot of land and so it kept on growing, and today she has 4 plots of land where she grows her plants.

She feels enormous peace when she is surrounded by nature and this helps her to make each day a better one offering the best service to her clients.

She requests a loan to purchase merchandise items such as: various plants, flowers that are in season, fruit trees, ornamental plants, and others.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise items such as: various plants, flowers that are in season, fruit trees, ornamental plants, and others

loans.name: Masheli's Tuamkeni Group

texts.en:
Masheli, 43, is married and has six children between the ages of 4 and 15. She sells fish and bites (snacks). Every day, she works from 6am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $280 from her sales.

Masheli needs a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mtumwa, who sells firewood and fish.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Thida's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan group with three members led by Mrs. Thida S.. She is 39 years old and makes a living selling fish which she buys at Tonlesap Lake. She earns about $5 per day. She has a motorcycle which she uses for her business. The family lives in Prek Khpous Commune, Battambang Province. Mrs. Thida has seven children, all of whom live home; one is employed by a private company. Mrs. Thida would like to grow her business and is applying for a loan of $250 to buy more fish to sell. The other two members of her group are:

1- Len H., who is widowed and breeds pigs for sale. She needs a loan of $250 to buy more pigs to breed.

2- Thoun K. is widowed and makes a living selling a local delicacy known as Khmer cake. She needs a loan of $50 to buy ingredients to make additional cakes to sell.

The group people lives in Prek Khporb Commune, Battambang Province.

loans.use: to buy supplies for three small businesses

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David M. is a 50-year-old carpenter, hardworking, and married with 3 children. His wife is a committed lady who owns a cattle farm in their locality. David operates Ruhaama Trust Workshop in Ntungamo on a retail basis. The success of his business is attributed to his 16 years of experience.

To meet the rising customer demands as the festive season draws near, he is using the loan to purchase timber, sofa fabrics, cushions/foam, and tools for his business. He intends to inject the profits back into the business so as to move it to a level of financial sustainability. With the continued growth of his business, David looks forward to successfully seeing his 3 children through school.

loans.use: To purchase timber, sofa fabrics, cushions/foam, and tools for his business

loans.name: Ablaye

texts.fr: Ce jeune homme tient une alimentation générale prés du stade Néma. Il soutient activement sa famille grâce à son commerce; Il sollicite un crédit pour renforcer son stock et augmenter ses ventes.
texts.en:
This young man has a grocery store near Néma Stadium. He actively supports his family, thanks to his business. He is requesting a loan to bolster his inventory and to increase his sales.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Felix Alejandro

texts.es: Felix Alejandro  esta solicitando su 7mo crédito a la institución de AFODENIC para comprar ceramica y pintura para mejorar las condiciones del hogar, tiene 5 años de desempeñarse como gestor de cobro de la Curacao, se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy responsable, trabajador y ha a demostrado  buena conducta en el municipio, todos los dias don Alejandro tiene que viajar a las diferentes colonias del municipio a ejercer su trabajo,  este cliente tiene una hija  de 17 años de edad que actualmente acaba de terminar su bachillerato, su esposa trabaja y ambos comparten con los gastos familiares y los pagos de los compromisos adquiridos, ya que son una familia que dependen de un salario  pero que son muy responsables.
texts.en:
Felix Alejandro is asking for his seventh loan from AFODENIC to buy ceramics and paint to make home improvements. He has been a collections manager with Curacao for five years and is a very responsible man, hard-working and conducts himself well in the municipality. Every day, Alejandro must travel to different neighbourhoods in the municipality for his work. This client has a 17-year-old daughter who was recently awarded her baccalaureate. His wife works and both share in the household expenses and in paying their debts as they are salaried, but very responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ceramics and paint.

loans.name: Mavlyuda

texts.en:
For the past twelve years, Mavlyuda has sold men’s clothing at the “Ganjina” market in Dushanbe. Mavlyuda is a married mother of four children. She is determined to provide a better life for entire family. Mavlyuda is hard working and kind, giving her the ideal blend of entrepreneurial determination and service. Skilled in trade and abounding in character, Mavlyuda has both a strong business base and a perfect credit history with IMON International. Currently, she is seeking a loan of $600 to purchase a new vending facility and expand her business. With this increased income, Mavlyuda plans to continue her business growth and to improve the financial situation of her family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and its famous thinkers and philosophers. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BCE. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is the poorest of the former Soviet republics. When the nation declared independence from the U.S.S.R., a civil war ignited and further damaged an already weakened economy. 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These difficult conditions have resulted in high levels on unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, such as Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To improve and expand her business

loans.name: Jenty

texts.en:
Jenty J. sells tomatoes at the market and has applied for this loan in order to expand her business.  Jenty is 50 years old and married; her husband is a security guard. They have one child who goes to school. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. These programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which targets returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: expand her business selling tomatoes

loans.name: Murod

texts.en: Murod U. lives in Khujand. He has been engaged in commercial service and trade for 7 years. He sells eggs and has the trade outlet in his home area. Murod works in the bird farm and sells eggs in his free time. It is an additional business so he trades in small wares at a home trade outlet. Murod is applying to Kiva with the request of a business development loan of $275 (1000 TJS) for 4 months for eggs to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy eggs and expand his business.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Estela es socia del Bancomunal  Las Surcanitas.
Estela es separada tiene 60 años,  tres hijos mayores que están casados.
Estela estudio chocolatería – tejido – bisutería en la municipalidad de su distrito, aprendió  que hace nueve años se dedica a la  venta de choco tejas –bisutería-tejido en el parque principal de su distrito, todos los días sale a vender, le gusta trabajar se distrae.
Necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de insumos para la preparación de  choco-teja, también  va comprar una mesa y una sombrilla para proteger sus productos del sol.
Desde que está en Finca, se siente más tranquila tiene para invertir gracias a los prestamos   y puede cumplir con los pedidos que le hacen.
El sueño de estela es tener un negocio de un  restaurante.
texts.en:
Estela is a member of the Las Surcanitas Communal Bank. She is 60 years of age and separated with three grown children who are married. Nine years ago, Estela took courses in chocolate-making, weaving and jewelry-making offered through her district municipality. Since then, she has been selling choco tejas (a sort of Peruvian chocolate truffle) in the central park of her district. Every day she goes out to sell. She likes working; it keeps her entertained. She needs a loan of 1,000 Sols in order to buy the ingredients for making choco tejas. She is also going to buy a table and an umbrella to protect her products from the sun. Since she has been with FINCA Peru she feels more confident. Now that she has the working capital from her loans, she will be able to fill the orders that she has. Estela's dream is to have a restaurant business.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients, a table and an umbrella.

loans.name: Kaka

texts.fr: Madame Kaka F. est une femme Sénégalaise qui fait le commerce du tabac.  Elle vend le tabac dans son quartier à Diourbel, une petite ville rurale située 150 kilomètres de Dakar, la capitale de Sénégal.  Elle sollicite ce crédit chez l’IMCEC pour reconstituer son stock pour mieux servir ses clients et réaliser un profit.  Elle est mariée, et elle espère d’utiliser les profits pour se soutenir et pour aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Ms. Kaka F. is a Senegalese woman who is in the tobacco business. She sells tobacco in her district in Diourbel, a rural town located 150 km from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. She’s requesting this loan from IMCEC to replenish her stock in order to serve her customers better and to realize a profit. She is married, and she hopes to use the profits to support herself and to help her husband with family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tobacco

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 33 year old Nuri U. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with no children, but she is responsible for supporting one dependant because he is an orphan. Nuri has been running a beauty salon business since 1999. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, six days per week. Nuri currently earns about 120 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase a hair steaming machine. In the future, she plans to open another business. Nuri thanks you for your support!
	
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a hair steaming machine

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina G. is from the village of Unidos. She is 36 years-old. Gina is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Gina owns and operates a business selling bedding and bedding supplies to tourists and local community members. Gina has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

Gina joined PMPC in 2007 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC of 15,000 PHP which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Gina is now requesting her 8th loan from PMPC in the amount of 20,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Achork

texts.en:
Achork M. is currently in the business of selling water pipes and taps. She is requesting a loan to purchase more pipes to sell. Achork is thirty years old and married with two children who both go to school. Her husband is a plumber. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a big tank that will store water to sell.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more pipe to sell

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
“Life without hope is a life without meaning.” This is the passage that Marivic loves to share with her neighbors and friends. She is 42 years old, married, and blessed with five children: Mark Jason, who is 22 years old and a high school graduate; Mario, who is 20 years old and a fourth-year college student; Marlon James, who is 17 years old and a college freshmen; and Maryjones, who is 12 years old and a high school student.

Marivic's husband is working as a farmer while she operates a sari-sari store (community-based store) for additional income. She is requesting a loan of PHP10,000.00. She plans to use the loan to expand her business and sell more commodities. According to Marivic, her income from her business will be invested for the education of her children.

loans.use: To expand her general store

loans.name: Irma Margoth

texts.es: Irma Margoth R. M. de 38 años de edad  reside Cantón Maquilishuat, Ilobasco; Irma vive en casa propia con su mamá y su hijo Nelson de 9 años de edad actualmente está cursando el 3er grado, Irma se dedica a la confección de ropa a la medida pero también para generar mayores ingresos ahora está comercializando productos de una revista la cual lleva de visita a la casa de todos clientes para que pueden comprar cualquier producto que se encuentre en  la revista, esto benefia a Irma ya que obtiene una comisión por venta, pero ahora Irma solita un crédito por que tiene muchos pedidos en ropa que sus clientes le solicitan  y desea comprar la tela para poder sacar dicha producción, ayudando a Irma a obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Irma Margoth Rodriguez M. is 38 years old and lives in Canton Maquilishuat, Ilobasco. She has her own home which she shares with her mother and her 9-year-old son, Nelson, who is currently in 3rd grade. Irma custom makes and sells clothes but she has added catalogue sales of a variety of items which she offers door-to-door in order to increase her profits. This is beneficial to Irma since she earns a comission on every sale. However, she now has several back orders for custom-made clothes and she is requesting this loan to purchase the fabric she needs to manufacture these items thereby increasing her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric for clothing manufacture.

loans.name: Annet's Group

texts.en:
Annet M. is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is a 43-year-old lady with two businesses. She sells spare parts for wood cutting equipment and she runs a poultry business. She has been raising layers and selling eggs on a large scale for 18 years. 

She says that the secret to her success is the good customer care, marketing skills and loans that add capital every 4 months, enabling her to care for her children and pay their school fees. 

Annet is able to make 300,000/= (300,000 Ugandan shillings) in profits every week and she would like this to increase even more. She needs a loan to help restock her retail spare shop with more equipment and to buy more feed for her chicks.

Annet is a married lady. She has 7 children, ages 13 - 22 years, including orphans that she cares for. All of her children are in school and she helps to pay for all of their school fees.

loans.use: Buying chicken feed and spare parts for business expansion.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Renforcer son activité de commerce de porcs

loans.name: Rawad

texts.en: Rawad is a 23-year-old married man living with his parents. He has owned a flower shop since 2004 with a previous 8 years of experience. In order to develop his work, Rawad is requesting to borrow $1,000 to purchase additional preparation tools.

loans.use: purchase additional preparation tools

loans.name: Kudratullo

texts.ru: Кудратулло Нозимов проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст 27 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Кудратулло по специальности "фармацевт". Он имеет аптеку, где уже более 5 лет занимается торговлей. Жена "домохозяйка". Кредит просит для пополнения оборотных средств.
texts.en:
Kudratullov N. lives in the Vahdat region. He is 27 years old. He is married and has two children. Kudratullo's profession is a pharmacist. He has a pharmacy where he has been selling for more than five years. He is asking for a loan to increase his working capital.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Benidit

texts.en: Benidit is a farmer. He plants yams, plantain, and cassava on his farm. He is 45 years old and married with 4 children. He is hoping for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase yam seedlings to plant. He says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more yam seedlings

loans.name: Aracelly

texts.en:
Aracelly M. M. is a 51-year-old married woman with thirteen grown children who are her first priority. Their ages range from 17 to 34. She lives with her husband and youngest daughter; her other children have moved to villages nearby. Her husband has a small farm where he grows coffee and raises pigs.

Aracelly runs a general store with her youngest daughter and needs a loan to buy more stock, specifically household basics. The store is located in a room in her house facing the street and she has had the business for two years. This is her second loan with FUDECOSUR and she hopes it will help her grow her business to support her youngest daughter's education.

Aracelly dreams that her children will be healthy and her youngest daughter will continue studying and learn English.

loans.use: To buy more stock, specifically household basics

loans.name: Aminatou

texts.fr: B. Aminatou est née le 04 Octobre 1955. Mariée à BOUCARI Djibrill, un agent retraité de la Société Béninoise de Brasserie, Aminatou est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés, dont un est à sa charge. Aminatou vit seule avec ses enfants au quartier Zogbohouè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis cinq ans. Les charges de la famille sont supportées par Aminatou seule. N'ayant jamais été à l'école, Aminatou mène comme activité depuis une trentaine d'année, la vente d'encens, de parfums, pommades et d'articles religieux (chapelets, livrets de prières, etc.). C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé ayant déjà bénéficié de deux crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Aminatou désire accroître son capital et créer plus tard sa propre boutique pour la vente de ses produits. C'est pourquoi Aminatou sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Aminatou B. was born on October 4, 1955. She is married to Djibrill BOUCARI, a retired employee of the Benin Society of Brewery. Aminatou is the mother of two children, both in school, and she supports one of them. For the last five years, Aminatou has lived alone with her children in the neighborhood of Zogbohouè in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Aminatou is the sole provider for the family's expenses.

Aminatou never attended school, for the last thirty years she has been selling incense, perfumes, ointments and religious items (rosaries, prayer books, etc…). She is a long time member of ALIDé, having already obtained two loans that were paid back in full. Aminatou would like to increase her capital, and later on she would like to develop her own store to retail her products. For this reason Aminatou is requesting a third loan from ALIDé.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of incense, religious items, perfumes and ointments.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Mrs. Lydia V. is from the village of Mauswagon in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old. She is married and blessed with 8 adult children.To make a living, Lydia raises and sells pigs in the local community. She earns 1,700.00 monthly from her business. 

In 2009, Lydia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 5,000.00 PHP to repair her motorcycle.This will be Lydia's 11th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Tukole Namanyi Group, Mukono

texts.en: K. S.  Hellen is a determined and friendly lady. She is 32 years old and married with 3 children aged 10 – 2 years, and she takes care of her parents back in the village. She has a hardware shop in Nabuti and although her business is still small, debtors come in hence affecting her cash flow. She ensures that she has the necessary materials for sale, hence making some good profits, however she hopes to expand her business further and build rentals for increased income. Hellen needs a loan to help stock more building materials like iron sheets, iron bars, nails, cement and so on.

loans.use: Buying iron sheets, iron bars, nails, cement and so on for her hardware shop

loans.name: Mendbayar

texts.en:
Mendbayar operates a mobile grocery trading business in her province with the help of her husband. She purchases groceries from the Narantuul and Bars markets, the two largest markets in Ulaanbaatar, and sells them to herders in the countryside for a profit.

Mendbayar is 35 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. Her two children, ages 11 and 7, are in a local secondary school. Mendbayar and her husband are a very hardworking couple who have managed to build their own customers and suppliers. She is planning to continue and expand her business in the future. Her dream is to open her own grocery shop one day. Mendbayar is requesting a 600,000 tugrug loan to purchase New Year cakes to sell to countryside residents.

loans.use: To purchase New Year cakes

loans.name: Francisco Martin

texts.es:
Francisco R. es un caballero muy trabajador el cual tiene su propio negocio de venta de joyas como aretes, pulceras, anillos, cadenas y otros ofrecidas en su establecimiento en el municipio de Somotillo de Chinandega. 
Él se ha caracterizado por ser muy eficiente en su trabajo y siempre ha llevado el sustento a sus tres hijos en edades escolares.
El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de prendas de oro para comercializarlas y así obtener los ingresos necesarios para el mantenimiento de su hogar. Es de importancia destacar que él también se ha dedicado a la venta de discos compactos de música y películas por lo que el crédito también lo utilizara para comprar algunos discos en conjunto con las joyas.
texts.en:
Francisco Rios is a very hardworking gentleman. He has his own business selling jewelry such as earrings, bracelets, rings, chains and more offered at his establishment in the town of Somotillo de Chinandega. He has been described as very efficient at his job and he has always supported his three schoolage children. The loan he is asking for is for the purchase of gold jewelry items in order to sell them and in this way get the necessary income to support his home. It is important to point out that he also has sold musical compact disks and movies and so the loan will also be used to purchase some disks together with the jewelry.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of jewelry for sale

loans.name: Fatuma Adongo

texts.en: Fatuma, a 41-year-old married lady with five children, has been running a fish supply business for the last eight years.  She earns extra income  by running a retail shop. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to plan for her business, and she is now requesting a loan of Kes.20,000 to buy additional fish.  Fatuma describes herself as hardworking and determined as she works to establish a stable business for her family's needs.

loans.use: Purchase an additional stock of fish

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 50 años, es una mujer luchadora y trabajadora; vive en su casa propia junto a su hija Betsy de 17 años y su esposo Abel de 54 años, quien trabaja junto con ella en la chacra, y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.

Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, María pastea su ganado por las cumbres de los altos y verdes cerros de su poblado, gracias a este esfuerzo que diariamente realiza, su ganado está muy bien alimentado, motivo por el cual cuando los lleva a vender a la feria, son rápidamente comprados.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar a sus animales y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es trasladar su ganado hasta la ciudad, ya que sus animales son muy grandes y pesados. Para más adelante, desea incursionar en la agricultura, para así poder mejorar sus ingresos económicos.

Este es el primer préstamo de María en MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, si desea acceder a otro crédito en el futuro, en su banco comunal, es una socia muy responsable y siempre esta al tanto de todos los acuerdos a los que llegan en sus reuniones. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará forraje (pasto) para sus animales, con lo cual espera que puedan estar más sanos y fuertes.
texts.en:
María, age 50, is a tenacious and hard-working woman. She lives in her own house with her 17 year old daughter, Betsy, and her 54 year old husband, Abel. She and her husband work together on the farm. What she wants most is to improve their quality of life. Everyday, very early in the morning, María takes the livestock to graze in the green hilltops of her village. Thanks to this daily effort, her livestock are very well fed. She does this so that they are rapidly purchased when she takes them to sell at the fair. What she likes most about her work is taking care of her animals, and she does this with great care. She has been doing this for 20 years. The most difficult part is transporting the livestock to the city because her animals are very large and heavy. In the future she wants to venture into agriculture in order to be able to improve her income. This is María’s first loan with MFP. She knows that she has to make all of her payments on time if she wants to have access to another loan in the future. She is a very responsible member of her communal bank and she's always well aware of the agreements reached by the group. She will use the 800 PEN that she has requested to buy grass for her animals, which she hopes will make them healthier and stronger.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food for her animals

loans.name: Amalia Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. Amalia, esta casada y tiene hijos pequeños, es hija de una cliente muy buena y antigua de la institucion, ella se dedica administrar la movilidad de su propiedad y que la maneja su esposo, ella tiene tres hijos pequeños, dos estudian en la escuela y otro es bebé, ella durante el día trabaja junto con su suegra en la venta de abarrotes en el mercado de Achumani,la suegra le paga un salario de 500 Bs. al mes y además le paga el almuerzo diario de ella y de sus hijos, es una mujer joven y trabajadora, por lo que se ve conveniente favorecerla con esa tasa preferencial. Con el dinero del credito comprara repuestos para su movilidad  y unas llantas nuevas.

Uno de los deseos de la Sra. Amalia es el de comprarse una casita y de ver a sus hijos profesionales, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindad en la otorgacion del credito
texts.en:
Amalia is married and has young children. She is the dautgher of a good and long-standing client of the institution. She administers and her husband drives their vehicle. She has three young children; two are in school and the third is still a baby. During the day, she works with her mother-in-law selling groceries in Achumani's market. Her mother-in-law pays her a salary of 500 Bs. a month; she also buys daily lunch for her and her children. She is a hard-working young woman so it would be advisable to grant her the preferential rate. She will use the funds to buy replacement parts and new tires for her vehicle. One of Amalia's wishes is to buy a little house and see her children become professionals. She is very grateful to Empreder and to Kiva for the trust placed in her by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires and for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: EL SEÑOR FRANCISCO ESTA CASADO Y TIENE UN HIJITO PEQUEÑO, SE DEDICA A LA FABRICACION DE BUJES DE GOMA PARA MUELLES Y AMORTIGUADORES DE LOS AUTOMOVILES, EL SEÑOR FRANCISCO YA LLEVA EN LA PROFESION MAS DE 6 AÑOS. VIVE EN CASA DE SUS SUEGROS, Y POR LO GENERAL RECIBE CONTRATOS DE EMPRESAS MECÁNICAS POR SER EXELENTE EN SU TRABAJO, EL SEÑOR ACCEDIO AL CREDITO CON TASA PREFERENCIAL POR SER UN CLIENTE BUENO Y RESPONSABLE CON EL PAGO DE SUS CUOTAS. EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO ES PARA COMPRAR MAS LLANTAS Y PODER PRODUCIR MAS BUJES. ANTES EMPEZO COMO AYUDANTE DE BUJES, Y POCO A POCO SE HIZO DE CAPITAL PROPIO Y ABRIO SU TALLER DE BUJES. EL DESEO DEL SR. FRANCICO ES TENER SU CASA PROPIA, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco is married with a small son. He is dedicated to the manufacturing of rubber bushings for docks and shock absorbers for cars. He has been in this profession for over 6 years. He lives in his parents in law’s house, and in general he wins contracts from mechanical companies because he excels in his work. He has agreed to the loan with a preferential rate since he is a good client and responsible with his payments. The proceeds of the credit are for purchasing more tires to make more bushings. First he started as a bushing assistant, and slowly he got his own capital and opened his own bushing shop. Mr. Francisco’s wish is to have his own home. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence in providing her with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires for rubber bushings used in docks

loans.name: Tessy

texts.en:
Tessy sells groceries and food items. She buys goods in large quantities from the market once a week, except on special demands. Tessy has been in business for close to eight years. She assists her husband with the profit from the business and she is a good help mate.

Tessy is requesting for a loan of NGN 170,000 to enable her to increase the quantity of goods that she buys and sells; this in turn will lead to price reduction, meet customers demands and maximize profit.
 
She is 50 years old, married and has four children. With the increase in profit, as a result of this loan, her family's needs will be better fulfilled. She says thank you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and food items to sell.

loans.name: Assanatou

texts.fr:
Madame  Assanatou    D.  est âgée de 43 ans,  mariée et mère de 7 enfants, elle vit dans une famille polygamique avec son mari, sa coépouse et leurs enfants au quartier Darsalam de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Assanatou a abandonné l’école en classe de 3ème année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien) pour faire le commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait de l’arachide. Après plusieurs années passées à côté de cette dernière elle a pu maîtriser le commerce. Elle finit par évoluer seule, en menant le commerce d’articles divers tels la  vente de produits de beauté, le savon local, les chaussures etc. Elle jouit d’une grande clientèle et réputation qui dépasse le cadre de son quartier de résidence.
Dans l’intention de faire face à la demande clientèle,  elle a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est en relation depuis 54 mois et a déjà bénéficié de 5 prêts solidaires et 2 prêts individuels, tous remboursés sans difficulté. 
Elle est à son 3ème prêt individuel qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 250 paires de chaussures. Elle s’approvisionne au Togo.
Madame Cissé  Assanatou    D.  vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA,  ce qui lui permettra de prendre certaines charges familiales surtout les dépenses des enfants. 
Son ambition est de faire l’embouche bovine comme son mari.
texts.en:
Madame Assanatou D., 43, is married and the mother of 7 children. She lives in a polygamous household together with her husband, her co-spouse, and their children, in the Darsalam district of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Assanatou left primary school in the third grade (Malian educational system) to work together with her mother who sold peanuts. After working with her for several years, Assanatou had mastered the art of commerce. She went out on her own, selling various items such as beauty products, local soap, shoes etc. She has a big clientele and a reputation that extends even beyond the area she lives in. In order to cater for her clientele, she came to Soro Yiriwaso with whom she has been working for 54 months. She has already had 5 solidarity loans and two individual loans, all reimbursed without difficulty. She is on her third individual loan which will be used to buy 250 pairs of shoes. She buys her inventory in Togo. Madame Cissé Assanatou D. sells for cash and credit to a clientele composed mostly of women. She expects to make a monthly profit of 150,000 F CFA which allows her to cover certain family expenses, especially those relative to their children. Her ambition is to raise cattle as her husband does.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying shoes for resale

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic D. is from the village of Loquias East Pob. She is 39 years old. Marivic is married and has 6 young children. To make a living, Marivic owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing hairdressing & beauty services to local community members. Marivic has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately average of 3,000 PHP per month for these activities.

In 2009, Marivic joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marivic has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Marivic is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used additional capital for her parlor. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Marivic from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for her parlor

loans.name: Sahib

texts.en: Sahib A., 36 years old, has his own barber shop, which he opened in 2009. He is married and has three children. He is a professional barber who used to work in a large barber shop before deciding to open his own business. Sahib has applied for a loan in the amount of 1,000 AZN in order to purchase more barber's tools and to improve his working conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more barber's tools and improve his working conditions

loans.name: Mr. Saveoun Kae Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has nine people who live in Roluos village in Kandal province. Mr. Saveoun K. has been selected by the other members to be the  village bank president. Each member will use a small piece of the loan to buy something that will better their family's standard of living.

Mr. Saveoun K. was born in 1950. He is a teacher in a local school.  He is also a farmer who owns two hectares of land to cultivate rice to sell to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Sambour Phem, is rice a middleman who can earn some money to support the family. Now his wife’s business is going well so she wants to expand it. Mr. Saveoun K. is therefore asking for a loan to buy more rice to resell. He is a father of a child who is attending a local public school.

loans.use: to buy more rice for resale

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando H. is from the town of Niño. He is 58 years old. Rolando is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Rolando owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Aside from that, he also grows hogs for fattening and sale. Rolando has been engaged in his business for over 26 years.

Rolando joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rolando has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Rolando is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Rolando from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients, but additionally savings, insurance, and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Hard working R. Jackson, aged 67, has managed to invest in the timber sector for close to 10 years, after exploring the potential of the trees he had planted himself. He went into this because of the high demand in Nyakabirizi, Bushenyi where he does his business. He has the support of his spouse, and their sale of milk, charcoal and firewood, earns them good profits in Ugandan shillings. With a lot of work requiring timber as raw material — furniture workshops, building and construction — Jackson hopes to expand his business with this loan and open stores in other locations. This will enable him to earn more revenue, maintain a self-sustaining life, and meet his long-time dream of educating his children.

loans.use: Business expansion of restocking more timber

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
La señora Doris P., tiene la edad de 49 años vive en el Barrio La primavera, es casada y su esposo es jubilado, ellos tienen 3 hijos mayores de edad, que trabajan  y el menor de 18 años estudia  la universidad, la señora Doris tiene un comidería que reparte su venta en las horas de almuerzo a las empresas o casas particulares, tiene 16 años de laborar de esta manera.

Fue gracias al apoyo de su esposo que logro la apertura de este negocio, siendo el día de hoy el sustento más importante de sus vidas, a futuro espera tener los recursos necesarios para comprar unas mesas y sillas con el objetivo de poner un comedor de venta de comida, por ahora solicita un préstamo para la compra de frutas, verduras, carnes, en sí materia prima con el fin de tener un  inventario amplio y aprovechar la demanda de consumo que se acerca para las fiestas en celebración  de los patrones de la ciudad capital Managua, la recuperación del capital será inmediata por  las fechas que se aproximan permitiéndole mejores condiciones económicas para la inversión a su negocio que ha futuro traerá bienestar socio-económico a la familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Doris P. is 49 years old, lives in the La Primavera neighborhood, is married, and her husband is retired. They have 3 grown children who work; the youngest is 18 and studies in the university. Doris has a catering business where she serves meals over the lunch hours to businesses or private homes. She has done this for 16 years. Thanks to her husband’s support she was able to open this business which today is the most important source of income for them. In the future she hopes to have the necessary resources to buy some tables and charis with the objective of opening a dining room and selling food. So she is seeking a loan to buy fruit, vegetables, meats and ingredients in order to have a broad inventory and take advantage of the demand for food as the holidays are approaching in the city of Managua. The recuperation of the money will be immediate because the upcoming holidays provide the best economic conditions so that the investment will bring economic well-being to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruit, vegetables, meats and ingredients in order to have a broad inventory

loans.name: Abel

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Abel pertenece al Banco Comunal “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA de la Asociación Arariwa y tiene 40 años.  Abel nació en la ciudad del Cusco y actualmente vive en la misma ciudad.  
 
Abel tiene un pequeño taller de carpintería en el distrito de San Sebastián en la urbanización de Cachimayo de la ciudad del Cusco. Abel viaja a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado del departamento de Madre de Dios a comprar madera. Le pueden encontrar en el taller, los 6 días de la semana de lunes a viernes, desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. Ya son 13 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar madera. 

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our member Abel belongs to the communal bank “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA" of the Asociación Arariwa. He is 40 years old. Abel was born in the city of Cuzco and he lives in the same city at present. Abel has a small carpintry workshop in the San Sebastián district in the Cachimayo sector of the city of Cuzco. Abel travels to the city of Puerto Maldonado of the Madre de Dios department to buy wood. He can be found at the workshop 6 days a week, Monday through Friday, from 7 in the morning until 7 at night. He has been working in this business for 13 years and it is going very well for him, thanks to the dedication he brings to his work. The member needs the loan to buy wood. The member is grateful for the opportunity offered in this way and he is committed to making the payments according to schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice S. is currently in the business of selling green vegetables and fruits such as oranges, passion fruits, etc. She is requesting a loan to stock dried and fresh fish to sell.

Joice is 31 years old and is married to a peasant. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop.

loans.use: To stock dried and fresh fish to sell

loans.name: 030410- Lien Ha- Hoang Thanh Group

texts.en: Tuyet L. T. (103) is a 46-year-old femaL. living in the town of Hoang Hoa. Tuyet is the group leader of this four-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 030410- Lien Ha- Hoang Thanh (030410- Lien Ha- Hoang Thanh). Tuyet is married and has two adult children. She operates a family member's business venture selling lighting products to tourists and local community members. She has been engaged in this business for over sixteen years and earns approximately 6,000,000 VND a month. In 2006, Tuyet joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Tuyet is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 VND which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 6th from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. L. T. Tai (107) is a 55-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 2. N. T. Hoa (108) is a 43-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising crops. 3. N. T. Can (117) is a 63-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Tuyet L. T. (103) là 46 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang Hoa. Tuyet là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 030410- Lien Ha- Hoang Thanh (030410- Lien Ha- Hoang Thanh). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán các sản phẩm chiếu sáng cho du khách và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. Tuyet thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 16 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Tuyet kiếm được khoảng 6,000,000 VND. Vào 2006, Tuyet đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Tuyet đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,000,000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 6th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. L. T. Tai (107) là 55 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. N. T. Hoa (108) là 43 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là trồng cây lương thực. 3. N. T. Can (117) là 63 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rodecinda

texts.es:
Rodecinda es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy.
Rodecinda es casada y tiene 10 hijos y solo uno estudia, Rodecinda se dedica a la compra D. cochinilla, tara, actividad que realiza todos los días en el mercado Magdalena en donD. compra los productos, después D. acopiar los lleva a la ciudad D. Lima con la ayuda D. su esposo.
Rodecinda necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles para la compra D. cochinilla.
Los sueños D. Rodecinda son construir su casa D. material noble en el Distrito D. Huamanguilla.
texts.en:
Rodecinda is a member of the Tarpuy Communal Bank. She is married and has ten children, but only one of them is still in school. Rodecinda buys cochineal and tara (natural sources of dye). She engages in her business every day at the Magdalena Market where she buys her products. Afterwards, she carries her products to the city of Lima with the help of her husband.

Rodecinda needs a loan of 3000 PEN to buy cochineal. Her dreams incluD. building a house of solid materials in the District of Huamanguilla.

loans.use: Purchase cochineal

loans.name: Geomar Leonor

texts.es:
Geomar Leonor  C. P. tiene 43 años. Es casada vive con el esposo y los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos. 
 
Geomar es una socia de la ventanilla rural La Esperanza, que está ubicada a 25 kilometres del Cantón de Ventanas. Es una comunidad que se dedica al comercio en mayoría este grupo se reúne cada mes en el sector del barrio San Vicente.

Geomar trabaja en el comercio de venta de bloques para la construcción de viviendas,  realiza las comprar en Guayaquil en las vende en un local de su casa.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería para ampliar su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es tener dinero para hacer su casa y viajar a España donde están sus familiares.
Le gusta levantarse temprano para empezar a trabajar.
texts.en:
Geomar Leonor C. P. is 43 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and two children in the canton of Ventanas, located in the Los Ríos province.

Geomar is a member of the La Esperanza communal bank, which is located 25 kilometers from the canton of Ventanas. It is a community dedicated primarily to commerce. The group meets every month in the San Vicente neighborhood.

Geomar works selling blocks for housing construction. She makes her purchases in Guayaquil and then sells them from a business in her house. She likes to get up early to start working.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of merchandise to expand her business. The support of the loan would help her financially to meet her needs. Her dream is to have money to make her house and to travel to Spain where her relatives are.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to expand her business.

loans.name: Justina Mutheu

texts.en:
Justina Mutheu, aged 23, is married to Alexander, who is a driver, and together they have one child, a daughter aged 5. She lives in Tala and her business is in the same place. 

Justina has been running a retail shop for 2 years and her monthly profit is Kshs 15,000, which she uses to cater for the basic needs in the house to assist her husband in the daily running of the home. She was introduced to KADET by the loan officer in charge of Tala office, and she has applied for a loan which she intends to use to buy stocks of cooking oil and fat, sugar, rice, and flour to uplift her business so as to increase profit.

If the loan boosts the business, Justina plans to use the extra income to buy more stock and grow her business into a wholesale business. Justina has very happy customers, because she treats them with respect, is hardworking, and has big dreams for the future.

loans.use: To buy stocks of cooking oil and fat, sugar, rice, and flour.

loans.name: Manga

texts.en:
Manga is a single woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is rent bills and food for the family.

She has operated a food stall business for five years, selling to her neighbours and passers-by. Manga faces a major challenge of theft in her business. She hopes to establish a restaurant in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bags of maize flour, wheat flour and beans for her food stall business.
She decided to join Yehu because its near her place of operations.

loans.use: To purchase bags of maize flour, wheat flour and beans for her food stall business.

loans.name: Grupo Unido 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Moraima is the coordinator of her group Grupo Unido 1 & 2 (United Group). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her parents. She says that her most difficult challenge is to have a partner or a husband. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying the kitchen. She likes to cook; that's why her business is a place where you can find different and good dishes.

Moraima is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for about five years, starting with savings. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying vegetables, meats, rice, flour, oil, etc. She will use the profits to invest in her business. 

This associate began with Esperanza because she heard about the loan and found it very attractive as some of her friends are doing business with this loan. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti.  Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a port town on the north coast where the economy is based on tourism. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water, none of which is potable.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, meats, rice, flour, oil, etc.

loans.name: Adamsay

texts.en:
This is 21-year-old Adamsay K.. She is married and has two children ages two and five. In 2003, Adamsay established her assorted pans and plastics business. Working six days a week and seven hours a day, she earns about $169 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL in order to add stock to her business to increase her profits. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 600,000 SLL. In the future, Adamsay plans to sells items in bulk. She wants to travel internationally to purchase more stock and would like to hire additional workers. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en: Innocent is 31 years old and single. He has been selling cement and foodstuffs for seven years. Innocent will use this loan to purchase more cement and foodstuffs to sell. With the new profits from his expanded business, he plans to build a house. In the future, he would like to become a sole distributor of cement.

loans.use: to buy more cement for sale

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC WATA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marina; ella tiene 56 años de edad y es viuda y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de fruta, ella vende en el mercado de SanSebastian, ella vende diferentes variedad de fruta como manzanas, naranjas, platanos, uvas y naranjas, ella tiene un pequeño puesto donde atiende desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de fruta. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar fruta al por mayor.  
                                 
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Marina belongs to the Sumac Wata Communal Bank.  This bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Marina is a 56 year old widow, and she has four children.  She alternates her daily activity with her business of selling fruit.  She sells at the San Sebastian market.  She sells different varieties of fruit like apples, oranges, bananas, and grapes.  She has a small stand where she sells from 7:00 a.m until 6:00 p.m.

She wants to expand her fruit selling business.  She is requesting the loan to buy fruit wholesale.  She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy fruit wholesale

loans.name: Francinie

texts.es:
Francinie C. Rodríguez  quiere convertirse en toda una microempresaria por medio de su taller de Costura.
Ella vive en la Trinchera de Alajuela, desde hace tres años ella se dedica a la confección de ropa. Con sus ventas a logrado hacer que su negocio sea reconocido en toda su comunidad, por eso ella quiere un préstamo de ¢500 000 (quinientos mil colones)  para comprar una máquina de coser Overlock y demás materiales que necesita para lograr una mayor producción en su taller y convertirse al fin en una microempresaria.
Ella  es socia de la Empresa Comunal de Mujeres al Éxito de la Trinchera de Pital, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica
texts.en:
With her sewing workshop, Francinie C. Rodríguez wants to become a businesswoman.  She lives in Trinchera de Alajuela, where for 3 years she has been making clothing.  As a result of the sales she has made, her business is now recognized in her community.  For this reason, she wants a loan of 500,000 colones to buy an Overlock sewing machine and other supplies that she needs so that she can increase production in her workshop and become a more accomplished businesswoman.  

She is a member of the "Empresa Comunal de Mujeres al Éxito de la Trinchera de Pital," one of the 100 organizations that are members of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita O. is from the village of Maranding, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 46 years old. Teresita is widowed and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Teresita sells seafood products, including fish like sardines, milk fish, and mackerel, in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Teresita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell, like sardines and salmon. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Teresita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell like sardines and salmon

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is a married woman who lives in Valladolid, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a vegetable farming and vending business. Her husband Samuel, who is 45 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living.  They have two children who are 23 and 25 years old. Juanita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past seven loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Juanita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her eighth loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 to fund her vegetable farming business so that she can continue to save up for future house repair and house improvement. Juanita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To fund her vegetable farm

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua B. is married and has three children.  She is married to a farmer and makes her living by preparing and selling corn dough and kenkey. Corn dough is usually used for the preparation of kenkey, a popular staple in the Ghanaian diet. The money she earns goes towards school fees. 

To improve her earnings, Efua wants to grow her business. She requires a loan to purchase larger quantities of corn to prepare the kenkey. The extra income from the additional sales will be reinvested into her business.

loans.use: To purchase corn to make food for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rooftop-repair tools

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Juan Carlos se dedica a la elaboración de salteñas  y venta de comida.  El crédito lo necesita para adquirir más insumos, como fideo, arroz, verduras y condimentos para elaborar  mayor cantidad de platos a la carta. 

Vende las salteñas y la comida en un ambiente que se encuentra en alquiler. Vive  en el domicilio de sus padres  ubicada en la zona Norte de la ciudad de La Paz. Es soltero y  no tiene hijos. Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO.
texts.en: Juan Carlos prepares and sells food and popular dishes.  He seeks this loan to buy ingredients (such as rice, pasta and vegetables) to prepare and increase the number of menu options in his restaurant, which is located in a rented space.  Juan Carlos lives with his parents in the northern area of La Paz. He is single, has no children, and this is his first loan with IMPRO.

loans.use: To buy ingredients (rice, pasta, vegetables) to prepare food

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia B. is from the village of Cabisera 9-11, San Antonio, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 40 years old. Celia is married and has two school-aged children. 

Celia raises pigs for fattening and sale to finance the education of their children and the daily needs of her family. Celia has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP whenever she sells her raised animals.

In 2007, Celia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Celia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. 

Celia is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Celia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise.

loans.name: Saparkul's Group

texts.en:
Saparkul A. is the leader of this group. She is 33 and married to a taxi driver. Together they are bringing up five children: three daughters and two sons. All the children study at school. In order to earn additional money for the family budget the family breeds livestock. They make money by reselling livestock animals after fattening. In this way the family earns additional 7000 soms per month. 

With money received from the loan. Saparkul wants to increase the number of livestock and purchase more sheep for breeding. In the future she wants to improve the family living conditions and build a big house for the family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

loans.name: Rosario Del Pilar

texts.es:
Pilar es una madre de familia de 39 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres con sus 2 hijos, la cual cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en  9 de Octubre que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Los pobladores de éste distrito se dedican al comercio y a manejar transporte publico (taxi y mototaxi).

Pilar  se dedica a la compra y venta de pescado fresco al por menor para el consumo de las personas y los vende en el mercado de 9 de octubre en su propiopuesto que tiene, este trabajo lo realiza todos los días por las mañanas desde muy temprano, con la finalidad de tener todo listo una vez que abren el mercado y así podrá atender a su clientela sin demorá, para que al final de de su jornada tenga los ingresos necesarios para solventar sus obligaciones familiares.

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 2800 nuevos soles y su destino será para comprar de una computadora para que sus hijos puedan tener un mejor desarrollo académico, ya que les va ayudar a resolver sus tareas del colegio. Toda la dedicación a su trabajo lo hace por el simple hechoque sus hijos puedan tener lo ella no pudo y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida que es lo que toda madre desea para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Pilar is a 39-year-old mother who lives in her parents' home with her two children. Their home, which has all the basic services, is located in 9 de Octubre which is in the province of Chiclayo. The people in this district are merchants and public transportation workers (taxi and mototaxi). 

Pilar buys and sells fresh fish for personal consumption. She sells them in the market in 9 de Octubre in the stall that she has. She works every day beginning early in the morning, with the goal of having everything ready when the market opens so that she can attend to her customers without delay. That way by the end of her shift she will have the money she needs to cover her family's obligations.
