The loan that she has requested from Edpyme Alternativa is for 2800 nuevos soles and she will use it to buy a computer so that her children can better their academic development. The computer will help them to complete their high school assignments. All of the dedication that she puts into her work is for the simple goal that her children can have what she couldn't and that they can have a better quality of life, which is what every mother wants for her kids.

loans.use: to buy a computer for her children's studies.

loans.name: Koeun

texts.en: Koeun is a weaver, while her husband, Son, is a farmer. The couple has been married since 1978 and has 8 children — six sons and two daughters. They live on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Koeun is requesting another loan of $1,000 to help her husband’s farming business by purchasing another ox.

loans.use: To help her husband’s farming business by purchasing an ox.

loans.name: Abd Al Razak

texts.en:
Abd al razak is a 54-year-old married man and the father of four children. He has worked at repairing cars for 36 years. He was young when he started in this activity, but he opened his own garage in 1980. His prices are affordable for anyone and his work is perfect.

He is a first time borrower with Al Majmoua. He is requesting a loan in order to do necessary maintenance to his garage, which is his main source of income. He hopes that one day he'll be capable of buying a special car paint oven that gives the car's color a perfect final touch.

loans.use: to do necessary maintenance on his garage.

loans.name: Larry Donald

texts.es: En la ciudad de granada, reside el Señor Larry Donald, quien labora para la institución de Enacal, como operador de pozo, se acerco a las oficina de Ceprodel  para solicitarnos un crédito para hacerse una cirugía menor en la nariz ya que se le dificulta respirar, el es soltero de él depende solamente su mamá, y diario  él se esfuerza trabajando con el propósito de que no le falte nada y para darle una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Larry Donald lives in the city of Granada and works for the institution of Enacal as a well operator. He came to the Ceprodel office to request a loan so that he can have minor surgery on his nose, since it is difficult for him to breathe. He is single, and his only dependent is his mother. He works hard every day with the aim of ensuring that all her needs are fulfilled and to give her a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for minor surgery to his nose.

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May is 55 years old and married. She has three children, two sons and a daughter. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is retired and has been helping her to run a business of selling instant noodles. They started this business five years ago.

May requires a loan to purchase a greater quantity and greater variety of instant noodles to stock her store. She hopes that this will enable her to better meet the needs of her current customers and increase the turnover of her business. She also hopes that this will enable her family to increase their income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of noodles to stock her store.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Phnom Penh is the city of Cambodia which has many kinds of jobs for people looking for work.  Mrs. Heng often thinks about how to make a profit for her family to feed and send her children to school and live a suitable lifestyle.  She works as a vermicelli noodle seller at the market and around her community.  She earns about $4 per day. To make more money, Mrs. Heng wishes to borrow loan in the amount of $1,000 in order to purchase a motorbike to  transport vermicelli in time to her customers.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle to deliver vermicelli to customers

loans.name: Elio

texts.es: Elio es un joven trabajador  y responsable vive en la urbanización virgen de la merced, vive con su papá y su hermana   y su mamá que  se encuentra por razones de trabajo en España hace poco retorno, pero por trabajo tuvo que retornar, Elio ya tiene su propio vehículo con el cual trabaja en una línea de taxi trufis, anteriormente estaba trabajando en el radio taxi por ser mas conveniente cambio, de línea el ayuda económicamente a su hermana que estudia en la universidad católica  por otro lado el también pasa clases por las noches, actualmente el solicita el crédito para el cambio de caja para su vehículo, el deseo del Joven Elio es el de terminar sus estudios.
texts.en: Elio is a hardworking and responsible young man.  He lives in the Virgen de la Merced housing development with his father and sister.  His mother is currently working in Spain.  She returned shortly ago, but had to go back for work.  Elio has his own vehicle which he uses as a ‘trufi’ (a taxi with a fixed route).  He previously worked as a radio taxi but changed companies due to convenience.  He helps his sister out financially who is a student at Universidad Católica, and he also takes classes at night.  He is currently requesting a loan for a gearbox for his car.  Elio wants to finish his studies.

loans.use: to buy a gearbox for his car.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man with 5 children. He lives in the Kyenjojo district and has been in the cattle farming business for 2 1/2 years. Due to the increased demand for beef, he says customers for his cattle are always available. John earns about UGX 40,000 weekly. He also grows and sells bananas and other crops as additional income. He says this gives him good income to maintain his home and to pay his 2 children's school fees.

John is a very hardworking and social man who values his customers. He intends to use this Kiva loan to buy more cattle to resell.

loans.use: To buy more cattle to resell.

loans.name: Dolores Patricia

texts.es:
Dolores, se dedica a la venta D. ropa variada, vive con su esposo y sus hijos, tienen casa propia, el negocio lo instalo hace 3 años y medio, ofrece todo tipo D. ropa, cómoda y casual.
Ella solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en mercadería, obteniendo mayor variedad para jóvenes en prendas como: blusas, faldas, camisas, ropa D. niño e interior, espera que esta inversión le ayuD. para mejorar las ventas.
Las aspiraciones D. Dolores es tener un negocio surtido, contar con clientes y generar ganancias, también apoyar a su esposo y sus hijos en todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Dolores sells a variety of clothes.  She lives with her husband and children in their own home.  She set up her business three and a half years ago and sells all kinds of clothes, comfortable and casual.

Dolores is requesting this loan to invest in merchandise, obtaining a wider range of clothes for young people such as blouses, skirts, shirts, children's clothes and underwear.  She hopes that this investment will help her to improve her sales.

Dolores' aspirations are to have a well-stocked business, to have more customers and to make profits.  She also hopes to support her husband and children in everything they need.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (blouses, skirts, shirts, children's clothes and underwear)

loans.name: Beatriz Maura

texts.es:
Beatriz Maura tiene 37 años de edad es soltera vive con la mamá y con los dos hijos de cuatro y dos años de edad en Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Descripción de la Ventanilla  VRC Luchar para triunfar, se encuentra ubicada en el sector la poza, perteneciente a la ciudadela 10 de noviembre  Cantón Ventanas, Los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a diferentes labores tanto Agrícola como comercial.

Beatriz se dedica a la  venta de bisutería la mercadería lo compra en Guayaquil y los vende en Ventanas. Solicita el crédito para ampliar el negocio, para  el arreglo del local y adquirir más mercadería. 

El crédito le será de mucha ayuda para poder adquirir fácilmente la mercadería y realizar los arreglos del local.
Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentemente es la competencia. El sueño  es poder apoyar a la familia económicamente y llegar hacer una  buena comerciante.

En los tiempos libres le gusta  practicar el deporte en especial el vóley.
texts.en:
Beatriz Maura is 37 years old and single.  She lives with her mother and her two children, ages four and two.  They live Ventanas, a province of Ríos.

The “Luchar para Triunfar” (Strive for Triumph) Communal Bank is located in the La Poza sector of the 10 de Noviembre housing community in the Ventanas canton. The members of the group earn their living in a variety of areas from agriculture to commerce. 

Beatriz sells costume jewelry.  She buys the merchandise in Guayaquil, and she sells it in Ventanas.

She is requesting the loan to expand her business, to fix up the place where she sells, and to get more merchandise.  The loan will be very helpful to her in order to easily be able to get more merchandise  and to make the repairs on her place.

The challenges that she frequently faces are the competition.  Her dream is to be able to support her family financially and to come to be a good merchant.

In her free time she likes to play sports, especially volleyball.

loans.use: to expand her business, to fix up the place where she sells, and to get more merchandise.

loans.name: Takku Ligguey 1 Group

texts.fr: Yacine habite dans une ville qui se trouve prés de la capitale du Sénégal, son activité principale est le commerce. Elle est le chef de ce groupement qui s'active dans le domaine du commerce et elle fait aussi du commerce depuis plus de 10 ans. L'usage de ce prêt est destiné à l'achat  de marchandises pour renforcer son stocks en achetant des produits comme (des tissus, des chaussures et d'autres marchandises). Ce crédit a pour but aussi de renforcer son activité et d'augmentation de sa marge bénéficiaire. Parce qu'elle souhaite dans le future acheté un magasin qui sera à sa propriété, de même elle veut aider son mari qui habite dans le milieu rural aux taches ménagères.
texts.en: Yacine lives in a town near the capital of Senegal, and her primary business is trading. She is the leader of this group, whose members all work as traders, and she has been a trader for the past 10 years. The purpose of this loan is to buy products to reinforce her stocks of fabric, shoes, and other merchandise. This loan is also meant to increase her profit margin because she would like to buy her own store in the future. At the same time, she would like to help her husband, who lives in a rural area, with household tasks.

loans.use: to buy fabric, shoes and other products for resale

loans.name: Sam At

texts.en:
Sam at (in the photo), 38, is a motor taxi driver. His wife, Channa, 35, is a garment worker. They have been married since 1998 and have three children-one son and two daughters. Two are in school and another one is still young. The family lives in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sam at wants to supplement new business investing with his neighbor to grow rice, so he is asking for his first loan $500.The money will go towards buying seed fertilizer and pesticide to maintain the rice farm.

loans.use: to buy seed fertilizer and pesticide to maintain the rice farm.

loans.name: Feluchie

texts.en:
Feluchie is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 6 children. 

Feluchie has a retail shop that sells bananas & coconut for copra. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy coconut & bananas to sell. 

Feluchie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy coconut & bananas

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Elxan

texts.en:
Savalan is 45 years old and married with three children.  He owns a small store and sells tea, water, drinks and more.  He has five years of experience. 

His business is well organized and he works from early morning until 10:00 p.m. every day.

Savalan has requested a loan from Kiva, via AqroInvest CU to purchase more items for his store.  He plans to reinvest any profits and to build his own house.

loans.use: to purchase more items.

loans.name: Las Yungueñitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS YUNGUEÑITAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Juan Pablo, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Yessica. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: servicios, comercio, iniciación de negocios y producción de comida. 

La señora Yessica  indica que es la primera ves que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de los promotores. En la actualidad ella iniciará un negocio de de ventas de licores con este préstamo.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para comprar su mercadería (compra de licores), que adquirirá de El Alto y posterior lo comercializara en un lugar de venta que a alquilado. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y vive con sus padres.
texts.en:
The Communal Association “LAS YUNGUEÑITAS” will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer working with the Juan Pablo Center. It is composed of six members and it is directed by a direction board led by Yessica. The members of the Communal Association engage in different activities such as services, retail, new businesses and food production.

Yessica says it is the first time she has entered in Pro Mujer, and that she has been invited by the loan officers. She will start a liquor store with this loan.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy her products (spirits) in El Alto after they have been prepared; she will then sell them in her shop. As she is single, this type of activity allows her to earn an income to support her family as much as she can.

loans.use: To buy spirits.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman with seven children, six of whom attend school. She owns a house that has no electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, Chizi has operated a grocery business, selling from door-to-door and from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

Chizi plans to use this KES 40,000 loan to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Erkinoy

texts.ru: Эркиной жительница района Пяндж. Возраст, 46 лет. Замужем. Имеет троих детей. У нее среднее образование. Она занимается посевом зерновых культур. Кроме того она выращивает овощи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 11 лет. Кредит берет для закупа мелко - рогатого скота.
texts.en: Erkinoy is a resident of the Pyandj district.  She is 46 years old, married and has three children.  She has a secondary education.  Erkinoy is involved in growing cereal crops.  Besides this, she also grows vegetables.  She has been involved in this business for 11 years.  Erkinoy is requesting this loan for the purchase of small livestock.

loans.use: to purchase small livestock

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is from Maningcol, Ozamiz City. She is 52 years old. Esther is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a service-based business. Esther has been in her business for 5 years and earns about 10,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2010, Esther joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esther is requesting a loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

loans.name: Chanthol's Group

texts.en:
Chanthol is 30 years old, married and has no child. He is the breadwinner for his family, who are located in a rural area of the Ratanak Mondul district of Cambodia. To make a living, Chanthol has been farming maize as his main income source for six years. 
Chanthol has been with Kiva partner VisionFund since 2009. His past loans have helped him afford sufficient food and buy basic household items. Having successfully repaid his loans from VisionFund, Chanthol now leads a group of three members who are applying for another loan with VisionFund. As the leader, he will use his loan to buy maize seed and fertilizer for his farmland. Chanthol hopes to increase his crop yield and earn more income to improve his lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy maize seed and fertilizer for his farmland.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is applying for another loan to start a fish selling business. She will use this 50,000 Kes loan to purchase fish, cooking oil and to put up a stall for her new business. In the future, Fatuma aspires to continue improving her businesses. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Fatuma has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase fish, cooking oil and a stall for her new business.

loans.name: Unidos Progresamos Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Unidos Progresamos” está conformado por 17 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de empanadas, venta de tortillas, costuras, venta de ropa, lencería, venta de cuadros, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Valparaíso.
Eileen. Integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el primer lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste un pantalón de color gris, una polera de color rosada, su cabello es de color castaño, lo usa largo y suelto.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de papas fritas y empanadas desde hace 1 año. Comenta que trabaja por los alrededores de su casa junto a una amiga, vende en plazas, ferias ofreciendo sus papas fritas y empanadas de queso y queso camarón.
La mercadería en insumos que va necesitando los compra en supermercados mayoristas, distribuidoras, molino donde encuentra la harina a buen precio, las papas las compra en el mercado a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará una freidora de papas, mostaza, kétchup, aceite.
Una de las metas de Eileen son poder comprar un carrito para poder desplazarse sin ninguna dificultad para ofrecer sus alimentos a su clientela.
Eileen vive junto s u esposo y su hija pequeña de 2 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es tener un local de comida rápida para generar mayores ingresos y darles una buena estabilidad económica a su familia.
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación. Por otro lado las capacitaciones, le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Unidos Progresamos" [Together We Progress] and is made up of seventeen entrepreneurs who make a living in different fields such as: selling empanadas, selling tortillas, sewing, clothing sales, lingerie shops, table sales, and different services, among others.  All members are residents of the city of Valparaíso.

Eileen is a member of of this communal bank group.  In the photo she is seated in the first row, occupying the first spot from right to left, in grey pants and a pink shirt.  She has brown hair, and she wears it long and down.

She has made a living in the field of selling fried potatoes and empanadas for the past year.  She says that she works near her home with a friend, selling in plazas and at festivals, offering her fried potatoes, cheese empanadas, and cheese and shrimp empanadas.  

She buys the ingredients she needs from wholesale supermarkets, distributors, and mills where she can find flour at a good price.  She buys the potatoes at the market at a low cost, where it's more economically convenient.

With the loan, she will buy a potato deep-frier, mustard, ketchup, and oil.  One of Eileen's goals is to be able to buy a cart so that she can easily move herself around and be able to offer her goods to her customers.  

Eileen lives together with her husband and her small, two-year-old daughter.  Her work dream is to have a fast food stall to generate higher profits and to give economic stability to her family.  She is very happy and thankful for the opportunity offered through Fondo Esperanza, since they will allow her to invest in her business.  In regards to the communal bank, she says that they have very good communication.  In regards to the training, they have helped her to learn new selling and accounting strategies.  

Valparaíso is situated 120 kilometers northeast of Santiago.  It is the regional capital and headquarters of legislative power of the country.  It is the first port of the nation and offers a great variety of beautiful and picturesque places, like for example, the house of poet Pablo Neruda, winner of the Nobel Prize.

loans.use: to buy a potato deep-frier, mustard, ketchup, and oil.

loans.name: Mirella

texts.en:
Mirella owns a small shop that primarily sells electronic household devices such as hairdryers, electric razors, as well as various clothing lines, and she has been in business for 5 years. Originally, Ms. Mejia opened her store with $50, buying sheets and household items. Gradually, from selling items to her neighbors and saving her profits Mirella was able to rent a small location nearby her house where she operates the business. Sometimes, her husband has to lend her some of his own earnings in order to finance Mirella’s growth, but there are obvious limits to that growth when he can only lend $10 at a time. She is applying for this loan through Kiva and Mifex in order to purchase rice cookers, pots, and dishes. This is a critical time for such items since many families will be using these for Christmas celebrations. Ms. Mejia and her husband are a young but entrepreneurial couple; they are proud that they own their humble home and have saved enough money to send their children to school.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She is applying for this loan through Kiva and Mifex in order to purchase rice cookers, pots, and dishes.

loans.name: Démého

texts.en:
Mrs. Démého A. was born in 1944 in Aklakou in the prefecture of Lacs. A married mother of two (02) children, she has a business activity which generates income : the sale of "bouillie" (an African cereal-based breakfast). Along with a primary education, she now has 15 years of experience in this business. Her husband, a joiner who lost his ability to work, has left her to deal the many household expenses. However, Mrs. A. is not discouraged. Every morning, she gets up very early to prepare her bouillie, which she sells near the road. She has already benefited from a first loan well paid off.

Today, she is asking for $950 in financial support to buy bags of maize, sugar, and wood to satisfy the demands of her clientele. The satisfaction of this need will help her improve her family's living conditions and her savings.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Démého est née en 1944 à Aklakou dans la préfecture des Lacs. Mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants, elle a une activité génératrice de revenus : la vente de la bouillie. Instruite de niveau primaire, elle possède aujourd’hui une expérience de 15 ans dans cette activité. Son mari menuisier, ayant perdu sa force de travail, la laisse seule devant les nombreuses charges du ménage. Pourtant, Madame A. ne se décourage pas. Le matin, elle se réveille très tôt pour préparer sa bouillie qu’elle vend aux abords des routes. Elle a bénéficié déjà d’un premier crédit bien soldé.

Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite appui financier de $950 pour acheter des sacs de maïs, des sacs de sucre et du bois pour satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. La satisfaction de ce besoin l’aidera à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille de même que son épargne.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize, sugar, and wood, in order to prepare her "bouillie" (an African breakfast)

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Phorn N. is a widow living with her four children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is a hard-working mother struggling to feed her children and parents (who are living with her) by selling fish in the local market. Phorn N., 37 years old, can typically make around $6 a day. One of her children is a construction worker who contributes his daily wage to the household. Her other 3 children are students who help to cook meals for their family while they leave school.

Phorn N. hopes to use the loan to purchase more fish due to great demand from her customers. In the future, Phorn N. hopes to buy her own stand in the market so that she spends less than renting someone ele's monthly. Additionally, if it is possible, she would like to repair her house and send her children to the local university.

loans.use: To purchase more fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand his tailoring business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more raw materials

loans.name: Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Maiya P., 24 years old, lives in Bholdhoka, Lalitpur, Nepal. Bholdhoka is situated in Kathmandu valley and most of the people in this region are engaged in business activities.

Mrs. P. has one son, two years old. Her husband Shankar P. works for the police department. Mrs. P. opened a grocery shop 4 years ago. She needs US$175 as a loan to buy noodles, rice, biscuits, and so on for her shop. Her income is to be used for the better education for her children and she also wants to support her family in financial matters.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods to stock her shop

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
49 year old Mrs. Juana and her husband Paulino are mainly dedicated to growing livestock, but at the same time, offer exterior painting and battery charging services to their small community, jobs that have brought them additional economic deposits for supporting their family. The wish of this selfless mother is to provide her four young sons the opportunity to study for a professional career. This is an opportunity that she never had. At a very young age, Mrs. Juanita was left an orphan and did not rely on sufficient economic resources to embark on her current path. Since then she has had to work arduously to support herself. Mrs. Juanita asks a loan to buy raw material (paint) with the goal of continuing to provide her services. Juana has placed her hopes in you.

Translated from Spanish by David Hou, Princeton University Language Project volunteer.

Doña Juana, de 49 años de edad y su esposo, Paulino, están dedicados a la crianza de ganado y al mismo tiempo a ofrecer sus servicios de pintado de fachadas y carga de baterías a la población en general de su pequeña comunidad, oficios que les viene generando ingresos económicos adicionales para el sustento de su querida familia.El deseo que tiene esta abnegada madre es brindarle la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera profesional para que puedan cumplir cada una de las metas que se han trazado sus cuatro queridos hijos menores, oportunidad que ella nunca tuvo porque a muy corta edad quedó huérfana y no contaba con recursos económicos suficientes para emprender el camino que se había trazado; desde entonces tuvo que trabajar arduamente para auto sostenerse.Doña Juanita solicita un préstamo para comprar materia prima (pintura) con el objetivo de seguir brindando sus servicios. Juana tiene depositada sus esperanzas en vosotros.

loans.use: Purchase of greater quantity of paint to continue with her labor and to embellish the houses of her city.

loans.name: Silvia Ester

texts.es:
Silvia is a single mother and has 3 children who are the ones she fights for at present. Her only source of income is her business, which she has tried to maintain for several years. It has not been easy with the responsibility of the children. In some cases their illnesses throw everything out of balance and one must use the profits to cover expenses. But, in spite of all this and thanks to the financing she has received, Silvia has been able to supply some products that her clients request. He has had five years experience in the business which has helped her to date to be able to keep up with expenses and give her children the necessary education. With the credit she plans to buy some consumer goods that her clients want so that she can proviD. better service to them and keep them from going to other businesses when they can’t find what they want at her shop.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos que son por quienes lucha actualmente ,su fuente D. ingreso es únicamente su negocio, lo cual a tratado D. mantenerlo durante los años, no a sido fácil ya que con la responsabilidad D. los hijos y en algunos casos las enfermedades la desequilibran y hay que hacer uso D. las ganancias para cubrirlas, pero a pesar D. todo esto, gracias a los financiamientos a podido surtir algunos productos que sus clientes les piden ,tiene cinco años D. experiencia en el negocio lo cual le ayudado hasta la fecha para poder ir saliendo con los gastos y darle la educación necesaria a sus hijos, su propósito con el crédito es comprar algunos artículos D. primera necesidad que buscan sus clientes y a si poder prestar un mejor servició a ellos y no dejar que se vallan a otros negocios por no tenerlos en existencia.

loans.use: To buy corn, rice, and sugar in large quantities as well as cleaning supplies such as detergent, soap, etc.

loans.name: Obelisco Group

texts.en:
The community bank Obelisco was started seven years ago. It now has 20 associates, all of whom are from the town of Quinua. Quinua is the town where South America won its independence and is now known as the home of artisans who make beautiful ceramics.

Through the bank they have learned to save and to be punctual and responsible. They have also learned about self esteem, being independent, and working outsiD. of the home. Many of the associates have different businesses. Most make ceramics, but others carve alabaster, raise animals, grind flour, own grocery stores, or sell juices, food, fruits, and vegetables.

Each member has a different history he or she could tell. For example, Juana makes beautiful ceramics. She learned this skill from her husband, who has been practicing all his life. Or there is Erasma G., who used to grow herbs and raise animals, but with a loan from the community bank was able to buy a gas stove and begin to sell the delicious foods she had been making for years.

The associates need loans of different amounts ranging from 300 to 900 soles (3 soles = about $1), making a total of 10,250 soles. They will invest their loans in buying things such as fruits, vegetables, clay, dyes, seeds, flour, and sugar.

They will use their savings to educate their children, build houses, and continue to develop their businesses. They have many dreams, such as seeing their children become professionals, completing their homes, and finishing a biology degree and opening a local clinic.

loans.use: For the 20 associates to invest in buying things such as fruits, vegetables, clay, dyes, seeds, flour, and sugar

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria Isabel is very agile and able. Her creativity has helped her in becoming very succesful in making accessories for handbags. She's a mother of 3 children. She has been doing this for the past 2 years. She began by selling these accessories in her native city of Juliaca, and after high demand she began exporting her products to La Paz, Bolivia.

Maria Isabel begins her day at 8:00 in the morning and ends at 6:00 in the evening. Her husband, who sells and buys used cars, helps her from time to time. Maria Isabel hopes to continue selling her products not only in her native country but throughout South America. Your help will allow her to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Isabel, es una mujer muy ágil y hábil, su creatividad la está llevando a tener éxito en su negocio de confección de correas y accesorios para carteras, ella es madre de 3 hijos desde hace 2 años está dedicada a esta actividad. Se inició vendiendo en su ciudad natal Juliaca, pero viendo la demanda del mercado decidió exportarlo a la paz (Bolivia), Maria Isabel inicia su faena diaria a las 8:00 de la mañana para culminarla a las 6:00 de la tarde, en ocasiones con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo Miguel, que se dedica a la compra y venta de carros.El deseo de Maria Isabel es seguir expandiendo su negocio, no sólo en el mercado nacional si no también internacional, con ese propósito recurre a tu buen corazón y hace la solicitud de un préstamo. Vuestro aporte le dará la oportunidad de seguir incrementando su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Azizallah

texts.en:
Azizallah lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with three children, one son and two daughters. His two daughters are married and live with their families; his son is working with him.

Azizallah has a retail shop. He has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Now he wants to expand his business. He wants to take an individual loan to buy extra fruit to complete his stock, increase his business and help his family.

loans.use: To buy extra fruit to complete his stock.

loans.name: Hina

texts.en:
Hina S. was married fifteen years ago and lives with her family in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. She has six kids: five boys and one girl. Four of her kids attend a local school, whereas the younger two are not of school-going age yet. Both she and her husband wish their kids to finish school and find good jobs for themselves.

Hina's husband is a builder and he paints buildings in a special way known as "grapy auto," whereas she is a teacher at a local school. Her husband has been in this business for the last fifteen years and has eight workers to help him in the business. Hina is requesting you to grant her a loan of $475 to expand their business further.

loans.use: expand their construction business

loans.name: Nyoh

texts.en:
Nyoh M. was born in 1948. She is one of two wives and a mother of six children. Her daughter, who was unmarried, died last year after a protracted illness, leaving behind two children. Nyoh M. was the only person left to take care of them which includes paying their primary school fees and also hospital bills. Her husband is a subsistence farmer and brings no income to the family.
Nyoh M. joined GHAPE three years ago and has successfully repaid two loans, both of which she invested in her small shop in the cattle market. Like most people in Bamenda, M. operates a business and also farms to feed her family. Tragically, last year she lost most of her crops when a herd of cattle destroyed her farm.
M. is requesting a loan to expand her shop and replant her farm. Specifically she wants to buy cattle ropes to add to the palm oil and kola nuts that she is already selling. Her business is going to succeed because there is a high demand for ropes and palm oil in her area and almost all men chew kola nuts. She says the side benefit to her community will be keeping cattle out of people’s farms.
She plans to repay this loan in 18 months and the first installment repayment begins four months after disbursement.

loans.use: To buy cow ropes, palm oil

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.en:
Anastacio P. Avala is a very hard-working individual who lives with his wife in an unsafe area called Tacumbú. Day by day they struggle; she has a small kiosk in their house where she sells groceries and drinks, and he travels to the city to sell his carpets. Twice a month he travels to the center of the country to sell his carpets as well. He has dedicated himself to this for a long time, as it allows him the income necessary to maintain his family and pay his bills.

Mr. Avala needs the loan to buy more small, medium, and large carpets.

loans.use: To buy more small, medium, and large carpets.

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en:
Mrs. Sambath P. is a stove maker in the Tie Prampie Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Previously, she obtained a loan from AMK to start her current business, stove making. She has fully paid back the loan.

Since her business is going well, Mrs. Sambath P. wants to expand it. She decided to ask for a loan to buy clay to make more stoves to sell. She would use the rest of the loan to start a firewood selling business to augment her current work.

Her husband, Mr. So Morm, is a taxi driver who can make a small income to support his family. Mrs. Sambath P. is 45 years old and the mother of a child who is attending school. Mrs. Sambath P. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy clay to make more stoves to sell and to start a business selling firewood

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cece, as she is popularly called by her numerous customers, is a 48 year-old local restaurant operator. She is married and blessed with six children. With income from her business, she has provided for five of her children to graduate from high school.

In her restaurant, she prepares and sells local foods like "fufu" and "banku." Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, and taken with all kinds of soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and is taken with hot pepper or soup. Cecilia says that the prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her meet her production expenditures. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials, like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood.

Cecilia is a member of a group called Yesu Nimenidaso Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and provide support to one another to repay the loan. Her picture was taking after their group meeting.

loans.use: To buy raw materials like maize, cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa S. sells food items like tomatoes and beans at Elmina. Theresa has received a junior high level education. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a welder. Theresa has been selling food items like tomatoes and beans since 2008. She is responsible for feeding the family and paying utility bills. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy more fabric and food items for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to help her husband to start building a house for the family.

In the picture, on top of her head are a few pieces of fabric.

loans.use: To buy more fabric and food items for sale.

loans.name: Munaza's Group

texts.en:
Munaza baji is the wife of L. A. and lives in a small area named Bund Road of City Lahore, Pakistan. She couldn’t get an education because her parents couldn’t bear the expenses. She owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 25 years. She is the mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. Her elder son completed his education until the 8th standard and is now working in a factory. Her younger son reads in the 4th standard. Her daughter reads in the 2nd standard. Munaza baji’s husband is a driver by profession and drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). He has been driving this for the last 25 years. Munaza baji herself is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to repair the auto-rickshaw for her husband so that he able to earn more profit. She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Shagufta baji and Farzana bjai each want a loan to repair their auto-rickshaw. Razia baji wants a loan to repair her pickup vehicle which she uses for loading vegetables and fruits. Humaira baji wants a loan to buy more CD’s for her CD shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 36 year old man who lives in Saida, Southern Lebanon, with his wife. Bilal is a taxi driver. He likes taking care of his car by cleaning it very often and doing maintenance on it. Therefore, Bilal requested a loan of 1000 US Dollars from Al Majmoua in order to do more maintenance on his car. This is the first time that Bilal has asked for a loan. Bilal isn’t a regular taxi driver: he has passengers, but he also transports employees and students as well.

In the beginning of his working life, he faced some difficulties because he had to borrow money in order to buy taxi plates. He used to be a driver before, but then he preferred starting his own business by being a taxi driver. In the future, he plans to buy a bus to transport employees and students.

loans.use: Bilal needs the loan to do maintenance on his car

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 25 years old and she is a single parent with a child. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. Victoria sells sewing thread, sponges, bulbs, etc. She started this business in 2005. She is a LAPO client. Victoria needs the loan amount of N102, 000 to purchase more thread, sponges, bulbs and sewing needles to sell. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more thread, sponges, bulbs and sewing needles to sell

loans.name: Mr. Pengphalla Sok Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nineteen people in Kouk Trab village in Kandal province make up a village bank and Mr. Pengphalla S. is the village bank president. He and his wife own a small restaurant where they sell Chinese noodles with soup, coffee, and rice. Since their business is going well, they want to expand it. Thus, Mr. Pengphalla S. decided to ask for a loan to buy Chinese noodles and ingredients to make delicious food for his customers. He hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. He is 36 years old and the father of a child who is attending the local school.

Two members in this group have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows tH. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy Chinese noodles and ingredients to make delicious food

loans.name: Kyei

texts.en: Kyei B. sells groceries and other food supplies in Nyankumasi near Cape Coast. Kyei has received a junior high school education.  He is married and has 3 children. Kyei has been selling groceries and other food supplies since 2006. He is responsible for paying the children's school fees, rent, utility bills and other financial expenses. He will use his loan to buy more groceries and bags of rice, cartons of cooking oil and other food items to meet the recent increase in demand. He hopes to reinvest the profits from his business in the further expansion of his store.

loans.use: His loan will be used to buy more groceries and bags of rice, cartons of cooking oil and other food items to meet the increase in demand by her costumers.

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.en:
S. Shuhrat is 37 years old. He and his wife have one son, who is 6 years old. Shuhrat sells DVDs and CDs. He orders the delivery of the disks from the neighboring city of Khujand and tries to have all the new movies and concerts of the popular actors, singers, and others. He also provides computer services, such as audio editing of video tapes and discs with recordings of his clients' family events. Shuhrat tries to use modern, up-to-date technologies in his work so that he can satisfy the demands and requirements of the customers. 

Shurhrat's business is successful generating the main income for his family. Today Shuhrat requests $800 US for a term of 12 months. He is planning to purchase a lot of DVDs and CDs to sell. Shuhrat thanks everyone for supporting him and promises to be accurate in his loan payment.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged its already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase DVDs and CDs to sell

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 45-year-old man who lives in Tyre, Southern Lebanon with his wife and their five children. Mouhamad has been selling vegetables and coal for seven years. He has requested a loan of $1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase merchandise for his work. This is the first time that Mouhamad has requested a loan.

Mouhamad is special in his work because he has good quality products. His clients can be anybody. Mouhamad chose his business because he wanted to work independently. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Mouhamad will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his work.
